    31‚Üí## Phase 1: Plugin Interrogation
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí### Purpose
    34‚Üí
    35‚ÜíExtract accurate parameter information from audio plugins to ensure mappings use real, valid parameter indices.
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí### Prerequisites
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí- JUCE-based plughost binary (built from project)
    40‚Üí- Installed VST3 plugins
    41‚Üí- canonical-midi-maps module
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí### Process
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí#### Step 1: Build Plugin Host
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí\```bash
    48‚Üí# From project root
    49‚Üícd path/to/juce-plughost
    50‚Üímake
    51‚Üí# Binary output: build/plughost
    52‚Üí\```
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí#### Step 2: Run Batch Interrogation
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí\```bash
    57‚Üí# Navigate to canonical-midi-maps
    58‚Üícd modules/audio-control/modules/canonical-midi-maps
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí# Run batch plugin scanning
    61‚Üípnpm plugin:generate-batch
    62‚Üí\```
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí**What happens:**
    65‚Üí1. Launches `plughost` with `--batch-interrogate` flag
    66‚Üí2. Scans all VST3 plugins in standard directories
    67‚Üí3. Skips problematic plugins (UAD, etc.)
    68‚Üí4. Extracts parameter information for each plugin
    69‚Üí5. Outputs JSON stanzas to log file
    70‚Üí6. Caches results for 24 hours
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí#### Step 3: Process Results
    73‚Üí
    74‚ÜíThe batch generator automatically:
    75‚Üí- Reads JSON stanzas from plughost output
    76‚Üí- Converts to structured plugin descriptors
    77‚Üí- Categorizes parameters (oscillator, filter, envelope, etc.)
    78‚Üí- Saves individual descriptor files
    79‚Üí- Updates catalog index
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí### Output
    82‚Üí
    83‚Üí\```
    84‚Üíplugin-descriptors/
    85‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json      # Jupiter-8 emulation
    86‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ arturia-jup-8-v4.json                  # Arturia version
    87‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ analogobsession-channev.json           # Channel strip
    88‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ plugins-catalog-batch.json             # Master catalog
    89‚Üí\```

   355‚Üí### Ableton Live Deployment (Dual-Pipeline)
   356‚Üí
   357‚Üí#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)
   358‚Üí
   359‚Üí\```bash
   360‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw live --install
   361‚Üí\```
   362‚Üí
   363‚Üí**What happens:**
   364‚Üí1. Converts canonical map to plugin mapping format
   365‚Üí2. Writes to `live-max-cc-router/data/plugin-mappings.json`
   366‚Üí3. Runtime loader merges with canonical mappings
   367‚Üí4. Max for Live device uses merged mappings
   368‚Üí
   369‚Üí**Dual-Pipeline Architecture:**
   370‚Üí
   371‚Üí\```
   372‚ÜíTier 1: Canonical (Build-time)         Tier 2: Runtime (Device-extracted)
   373‚Üí‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ            ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
   374‚ÜíSource: YAML files                      Source: Controller slot
   375‚ÜíBuild:  convert-canonical-maps.cjs     Extract: controller-deploy
   376‚ÜíOutput: canonical-plugin-maps.ts        Output: plugin-mappings.json
   377‚Üí
   378‚Üí                    Runtime Merge
   379‚Üí                    { ...canonical, ...runtime }

   483‚Üí## CLI Reference
   484‚Üí
   485‚Üí### controller-deploy list
   486‚Üí
   487‚ÜíList connected controllers and available configurations.
   488‚Üí
   489‚Üí\```bash
   490‚Üínpx controller-deploy list
   491‚Üí\```
   492‚Üí
   493‚Üí**Output:**

   501‚Üí  Slot 3: Channel Strip
   502‚Üí  ...
   503‚Üí\```
   504‚Üí
   505‚Üí### controller-deploy deploy
   506‚Üí
   507‚ÜíDeploy controller configuration to DAW(s).
   508‚Üí
   509‚Üí**Options:**
   510‚Üí- `-c, --controller <type>`: Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)
   511‚Üí- `-s, --slot <number>`: Configuration slot (default: 0)
   512‚Üí- `-d, --daw <daws...>`: Target DAWs (default: ardour)
   513‚Üí- `-p, --plugin <name>`: Plugin name for context
   514‚Üí- `-m, --midi-channel <number>`: MIDI channel override
   515‚Üí- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory for canonical YAML
   516‚Üí- `--install`: Auto-install to DAW config directories
   517‚Üí- `--dry-run`: Preview without deploying
   518‚Üí
   519‚Üí**Examples:**
   520‚Üí\```bash
   521‚Üí# Basic deployment
   522‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
   523‚Üí
   524‚Üí# Multiple DAWs
   525‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
   526‚Üí
   527‚Üí# With plugin context
   528‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
   529‚Üí
   530‚Üí# Save canonical and install
   531‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --output ./mappings --install
   532‚Üí
   533‚Üí# Preview only
   534‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --dry-run
   535‚Üí\```

   537‚Üí## Troubleshooting
   538‚Üí
   539‚Üí### Plugin Interrogation Issues
   540‚Üí
   541‚Üí**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
   542‚Üí\```bash
   543‚Üí# Skip problematic plugins by editing
   544‚Üímodules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts
   545‚Üí
   546‚Üíconst SKIP_PATTERNS = [
   547‚Üí  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
   548‚Üí  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
   549‚Üí  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
   550‚Üí];
   551‚Üí\```
   552‚Üí
   553‚Üí**Problem:** No parameters found
   554‚Üí- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
   555‚Üí- Verify plugin is installed correctly
   556‚Üí- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`
   557‚Üí
   558‚Üí### Canonical Mapping Issues
   559‚Üí
   560‚Üí**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
   561‚Üí- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
   562‚Üí- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
   563‚Üí- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated
   564‚Üí
   565‚Üí**Problem:** YAML validation errors
   566‚Üí- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
   567‚Üí- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
   568‚Üí- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`
   569‚Üí
   570‚Üí### Deployment Issues
   571‚Üí
   572‚Üí**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
   573‚Üí- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
   574‚Üí- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`
   575‚Üí- Restart Ardour after installation
   576‚Üí
   577‚Üí**Problem:** Live mapping not working
   578‚Üí- Check `plugin-mappings.json` syntax
   579‚Üí- Verify runtime-loader is loading file
   580‚Üí- Check Max for Live device logs
   581‚Üí- Ensure plugin name matches exactly
   582‚Üí
   583‚Üí**Problem:** Controller not detected
   584‚Üí- Check MIDI connections (Web MIDI API requires Chrome/Edge)
   585‚Üí- Verify controller is powered on
   586‚Üí- Try manual adapter creation (bypass auto-detection)
   587‚Üí
   588‚Üí## Performance Tips
   589‚Üí
   590‚Üí### Cache Plugin Descriptors
   591‚Üí
   592‚ÜíPlugin interrogation is cached for 24 hours. To force refresh:
   593‚Üí\```bash
   594‚Üírm plugin-descriptors/plugins-catalog-batch.json
   595‚Üípnpm plugin:generate-batch
   596‚Üí\```
   597‚Üí
   598‚Üí### Batch Deployments
   599‚Üí
   600‚ÜíDeploy multiple configurations in one script:
   601‚Üí\```bash
   602‚Üí#!/bin/bash
   603‚Üífor slot in {0..3}; do
   604‚Üí  npx controller-deploy deploy --slot $slot --daw ardour live --install
   605‚Üídone
   606‚Üí\```
   607‚Üí
   608‚Üí### Validate Before Deploy
   609‚Üí
   610‚ÜíUse dry-run to verify before actual deployment:
   611‚Üí\```bash
   612‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --dry-run
   613‚Üí# Review output, then run without --dry-run
   614‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --install
   615‚Üí\```

     7‚Üí## Overview
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíThe 360 feature implements a modular, extensible architecture for deploying MIDI controller configurations to multiple DAWs. The design follows interface-first principles with clear separation of concerns across three main layers:
    10‚Üí

    12‚Üí2. **Canonical Conversion Layer** - Format translation to universal MIDI mappings
    13‚Üí3. **DAW Deployment Layer** - Platform-specific map generation and installation

    54‚Üí## Core Components
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí### 1. Controller-Workflow Module
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí**Purpose:** Generic framework for controller ‚Üí DAW deployment
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/`
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí**Key Abstractions:**
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí\```typescript
    65‚Üí// Controller interrogation interface
    66‚Üíinterface ControllerAdapterInterface {
    67‚Üí  connect(): Promise<void>;
    68‚Üí  listConfigurations(): Promise<ConfigurationSlot[]>;
    69‚Üí  readConfiguration(slot: number): Promise<ControllerConfiguration>;
    70‚Üí}
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí// Canonical conversion interface
    73‚Üíinterface CanonicalConverterInterface {
    74‚Üí  convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap;
    75‚Üí  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean;
    76‚Üí}
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí// DAW deployment interface
    79‚Üíinterface DAWDeployerInterface {
    80‚Üí  deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult>;
    81‚Üí  isInstalled(): Promise<boolean>;
    82‚Üí}
    83‚Üí\```
    84‚Üí
    85‚Üí**Design Principles:**
    86‚Üí- **Interface-first:** All adapters implement well-defined interfaces
    87‚Üí- **Dependency injection:** Components accept dependencies via constructor
    88‚Üí- **Factory pattern:** Auto-detection and instantiation via factories
    89‚Üí- **Event-driven:** Progress reporting via EventEmitter
    90‚Üí
    91‚ÜíSee [implementation/workplan.md](./implementation/workplan.md) for detailed design.
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí### 2. Launch Control XL3 Adapter
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí**Purpose:** Reference implementation for Novation Launch Control XL 3
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.ts`
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí**Capabilities:**
   100‚Üí- Read all 16 custom mode slots
   101‚Üí- Extract control configurations (48 controls: 24 encoders, 8 sliders, 16 buttons)
   102‚Üí- Map LCXL3-specific IDs (SEND_A1, FADER1, etc.) to generic control types
   103‚Üí- Wrapper around existing launch-control-xl3 library
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí**Control Mapping:**
   106‚Üí\```
   107‚ÜíLCXL3 ID     ‚Üí Generic ID    ‚Üí MIDI CC
   108‚Üí‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
   109‚ÜíSEND_A1      ‚Üí encoder_1     ‚Üí CC 13
   110‚ÜíSEND_A2      ‚Üí encoder_2     ‚Üí CC 14
   111‚Üí...
   112‚ÜíFADER1       ‚Üí slider_1      ‚Üí CC 53
   113‚ÜíFADER2       ‚Üí slider_2      ‚Üí CC 54
   114‚Üí...
   115‚ÜíFOCUS1       ‚Üí button_1      ‚Üí CC 41
   116‚ÜíFOCUS2       ‚Üí button_2      ‚Üí CC 42

   119‚Üí### 3. Canonical MIDI Maps
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí**Purpose:** Universal MIDI mapping format (DAW-agnostic)
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí**Location:** `modules/canonical-midi-maps/`
   124‚Üí
   125‚Üí**Format:** YAML
   126‚Üí
   127‚Üí**Structure:**
   128‚Üí\```yaml

   130‚Üí
   131‚Üídevice:
   132‚Üí  manufacturer: Novation
   133‚Üí  model: Launch Control XL 3
   134‚Üí
   135‚Üíplugin:
   136‚Üí  manufacturer: TAL Software
   137‚Üí  name: TAL-J-8
   138‚Üí  descriptor: plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üímetadata:
   141‚Üí  name: Jupiter-8 Template
   142‚Üí  description: Controls for TAL-J-8 synth
   143‚Üí  date: 2025-10-11
   144‚Üí
   145‚Üímidi_channel: 1  # Global MIDI channel

   201‚Üí‚îÇ                    Dual-Pipeline System                    ‚îÇ
   202‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

   210‚Üí        ‚Üì                                                ‚Üì
   211‚ÜíOutput: canonical-plugin-maps.ts                Output:  plugin-mappings.json
   212‚Üí
   213‚ÜíLoad:   Import at compile-time                  Load:    Runtime JSON parsing
   214‚Üí        (build artifact)                                 (runtime-loader.ts)
   215‚Üí
   216‚ÜíUpdates: Via PR/commit workflow                 Updates: One-click from hardware
   217‚Üí
   218‚Üí                              Runtime Merge
   219‚Üí                              ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
   220‚Üí                    { ...CANONICAL_PLUGIN_MAPS, ...runtimeMaps }

   349‚Üí## Design Patterns
   350‚Üí
   351‚Üí### Interface-First Design
   352‚Üí
   353‚ÜíAll major components define interfaces before implementation:
   354‚Üí- Enables testing with mocks
   355‚Üí- Clear contracts between layers
   356‚Üí- Easier to extend and maintain
   357‚Üí
   358‚Üí### Dependency Injection
   359‚Üí
   360‚Üí\```typescript
   361‚Üíexport class DeploymentWorkflow {
   362‚Üí  constructor(
   363‚Üí    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
   364‚Üí    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
   365‚Üí    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
   366‚Üí  ) {}
   367‚Üí}
   368‚Üí\```
   369‚Üí
   370‚ÜíBenefits:
   371‚Üí- Testable (inject mocks)
   372‚Üí- Flexible (swap implementations)
   373‚Üí- Follows project guidelines
   374‚Üí
   375‚Üí### Factory Pattern
   376‚Üí
   377‚Üí\```typescript
   378‚Üístatic async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
   379‚Üí  const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
   380‚Üí  const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
   381‚Üí  const deployers = new Map();
   382‚Üí  // ...
   383‚Üí  return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, deployers);
   384‚Üí}
   385‚Üí\```
   386‚Üí
   387‚ÜíBenefits:
   388‚Üí- Auto-detection of hardware
   389‚Üí- Simplified instantiation
   390‚Üí- Encapsulates complexity
   391‚Üí
   392‚Üí### Event-Driven Progress
   393‚Üí
   394‚Üí\```typescript
   395‚Üíworkflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
   396‚Üí  console.log(`[${step}/3] ${message}`);

   409‚Üí## Performance Considerations
   410‚Üí
   411‚Üí### Target Metrics
   412‚Üí
   413‚Üí| Operation | Target | Current Status |
   414‚Üí|-----------|--------|----------------|
   415‚Üí| Controller read | <2s | ‚úÖ Sub-second |
   416‚Üí| Canonical conversion | <100ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
   417‚Üí| Ardour XML generation | <50ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
   418‚Üí| Live JSON write | <20ms | ‚úÖ Instant |
   419‚Üí| End-to-end workflow | <10s | ‚è≥ Not measured |
   420‚Üí
   421‚Üí### Optimization Strategies
   422‚Üí
   423‚Üí- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
   424‚Üí- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
   425‚Üí- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
   426‚Üí- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks
   427‚Üí
   428‚Üí## Security Considerations
   429‚Üí
   430‚Üí- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
   431‚Üí- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
   432‚Üí- **Command injection:** No shell command execution (direct API calls only)
   433‚Üí- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options

   230‚Üíimport { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';

   232‚Üí
   233‚Üíexport class LaunchControlXL3Adapter implements ControllerAdapterInterface {

   237‚Üí    supportsCustomModes: true,

   244‚Üí  constructor(private device: LaunchControlXL3) {}

   246‚Üí  static async create(): Promise<LaunchControlXL3Adapter> {
   247‚Üí    const device = new LaunchControlXL3({ enableCustomModes: true });

   251‚Üí
   252‚Üí  async connect(): Promise<void> {
   253‚Üí    await this.device.connect();

   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí  async disconnect(): Promise<void> {

   264‚Üí  async listConfigurations(): Promise<ConfigurationSlot[]> {
   265‚Üí    const slots: ConfigurationSlot[] = [];
   266‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
   267‚Üí      const mode = await this.device.readCustomMode(i);
   268‚Üí      slots.push({
   269‚Üí        index: i,

   282‚Üí
   283‚Üí    // Convert LCXL3 CustomMode ‚Üí generic ControllerConfiguration
   284‚Üí    return {

   290‚Üí
   291‚Üí  async writeConfiguration(slot: number, config: ControllerConfiguration): Promise<void> {
   292‚Üí    // Convert generic ControllerConfiguration ‚Üí LCXL3 CustomMode
   293‚Üí    const customMode = this.convertToCustomMode(config);
   294‚Üí    await this.device.writeCustomMode(slot, customMode);

   306‚Üí  private convertControls(controls: any): ControlMapping[] {
   307‚Üí    const mappings: ControlMapping[] = [];
   308‚Üí    for (const [key, control] of Object.entries(controls)) {
   309‚Üí      mappings.push({
   310‚Üí        id: key,

   312‚Üí        type: (control as any).type,
   313‚Üí        cc: (control as any).ccNumber,
   314‚Üí        channel: (control as any).midiChannel,
   315‚Üí        range: [(control as any).minValue, (control as any).maxValue]
   316‚Üí      });
   317‚Üí    }
   318‚Üí    return mappings;
   319‚Üí  }

   325‚Üí}

   337‚Üí## Phase 3: Launch Control XL3 Converter
   338‚Üí
   339‚Üí**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.ts`
   340‚Üí
   341‚Üí\```typescript
   342‚Üíexport class LaunchControlXL3Converter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
   343‚Üí
   344‚Üí  getConverterInfo(): ConverterInfo {
   345‚Üí    return {
   346‚Üí      supportedController: 'Novation Launch Control XL 3',
   347‚Üí      version: '1.0.0',
   348‚Üí      features: ['custom-modes', 'label-preservation', 'all-control-types']
   349‚Üí    };
   350‚Üí  }
   351‚Üí
   352‚Üí  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean {
   353‚Üí    // Validate config has required LCXL3 structure
   354‚Üí    return config.controls.length > 0 &&
   355‚Üí           config.controls.every(c => c.cc !== undefined);
   356‚Üí  }
   357‚Üí
   358‚Üí  convert(
   359‚Üí    config: ControllerConfiguration,
   360‚Üí    options: ConversionOptions
   361‚Üí  ): CanonicalMidiMap {
   362‚Üí    return {
   363‚Üí      version: '1.0.0',
   364‚Üí      device: {
   365‚Üí        manufacturer: 'Novation',
   366‚Üí        model: 'Launch Control XL 3',
   367‚Üí        ...(options.deviceOverrides || {})
   368‚Üí      },
   369‚Üí      metadata: {
   370‚Üí        name: config.name,
   371‚Üí        description: `Converted from LCXL3 custom mode: ${config.name}`,
   372‚Üí        date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
   373‚Üí        tags: ['launch-control-xl3', 'auto-generated']
   374‚Üí      },
   375‚Üí      plugin: options.pluginInfo,
   376‚Üí      midi_channel: options.midiChannel,
   377‚Üí      controls: this.mapControls(config.controls, options)
   378‚Üí    };
   379‚Üí  }
   380‚Üí
   381‚Üí  private mapControls(controls: ControlMapping[], options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition[] {
   382‚Üí    return controls.map(control => ({
   383‚Üí      id: this.mapControlId(control.id),        // SEND_A1 ‚Üí encoder_1
   384‚Üí      name: options.preserveLabels ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(control.id),
   385‚Üí      type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
   386‚Üí      cc: control.cc!,
   387‚Üí      channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
   388‚Üí      range: control.range || [0, 127],
   389‚Üí      description: `Mapped from ${control.id}`
   390‚Üí    }));
   391‚Üí  }
   392‚Üí
   393‚Üí  private mapControlId(lcxl3Id: string): string {
   394‚Üí    // LCXL3-specific mapping: SEND_A1 ‚Üí encoder_1, FADER1 ‚Üí slider_1, etc.
   395‚Üí    const mapping: Record<string, string> = {
   396‚Üí      'SEND_A1': 'encoder_1', 'SEND_A2': 'encoder_2', 'SEND_A3': 'encoder_3',
   397‚Üí      'SEND_A4': 'encoder_4', 'SEND_A5': 'encoder_5', 'SEND_A6': 'encoder_6',
   398‚Üí      'SEND_A7': 'encoder_7', 'SEND_A8': 'encoder_8',
   399‚Üí      'SEND_B1': 'encoder_9', 'SEND_B2': 'encoder_10', 'SEND_B3': 'encoder_11',
   400‚Üí      'SEND_B4': 'encoder_12', 'SEND_B5': 'encoder_13', 'SEND_B6': 'encoder_14',
   401‚Üí      'SEND_B7': 'encoder_15', 'SEND_B8': 'encoder_16',
   402‚Üí      'PAN1': 'encoder_17', 'PAN2': 'encoder_18', 'PAN3': 'encoder_19',
   403‚Üí      'PAN4': 'encoder_20', 'PAN5': 'encoder_21', 'PAN6': 'encoder_22',
   404‚Üí      'PAN7': 'encoder_23', 'PAN8': 'encoder_24',
   405‚Üí      'FADER1': 'slider_1', 'FADER2': 'slider_2', 'FADER3': 'slider_3',
   406‚Üí      'FADER4': 'slider_4', 'FADER5': 'slider_5', 'FADER6': 'slider_6',
   407‚Üí      'FADER7': 'slider_7', 'FADER8': 'slider_8',
   408‚Üí      'FOCUS1': 'button_1', 'FOCUS2': 'button_2', 'FOCUS3': 'button_3',
   409‚Üí      'FOCUS4': 'button_4', 'FOCUS5': 'button_5', 'FOCUS6': 'button_6',
   410‚Üí      'FOCUS7': 'button_7', 'FOCUS8': 'button_8',
   411‚Üí      'CONTROL1': 'button_9', 'CONTROL2': 'button_10', 'CONTROL3': 'button_11',
   412‚Üí      'CONTROL4': 'button_12', 'CONTROL5': 'button_13', 'CONTROL6': 'button_14',
   413‚Üí      'CONTROL7': 'button_15', 'CONTROL8': 'button_16'
   414‚Üí    };
   415‚Üí    return mapping[lcxl3Id] || lcxl3Id.toLowerCase();
   416‚Üí  }
   417‚Üí
   418‚Üí  private mapControlType(type: ControlType): 'encoder' | 'slider' | 'button' | 'button_group' {
   419‚Üí    return type;
   420‚Üí  }
   421‚Üí
   422‚Üí  private getDefaultName(controlId: string): string {
   423‚Üí    return controlId.replace(/_/g, ' ').replace(/\b\w/g, l => l.toUpperCase());
   424‚Üí  }
   425‚Üí}
   426‚Üí\```

   436‚Üí
   437‚Üí## Phase 4: Generalized Deployment Workflow
   438‚Üí
   439‚Üí**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/orchestrator/DeploymentWorkflow.ts`
   440‚Üí
   441‚Üí\```typescript
   442‚Üíimport { EventEmitter } from 'eventemitter3';
   443‚Üí
   444‚Üíexport interface WorkflowOptions {
   445‚Üí  configSlot: number;
   446‚Üí  targets: string[];
   447‚Üí  pluginInfo?: PluginDefinition;
   448‚Üí  midiChannel?: number;
   449‚Üí  preserveLabels?: boolean;
   450‚Üí  outputDir?: string;
   451‚Üí  autoInstall?: boolean;
   452‚Üí  dryRun?: boolean;
   453‚Üí}
   454‚Üí
   455‚Üíexport interface WorkflowResult {
   456‚Üí  success: boolean;
   457‚Üí  controllerConfig?: ControllerConfiguration;
   458‚Üí  canonicalMap?: CanonicalMidiMap;
   459‚Üí  deployments: DeploymentResult[];
   460‚Üí  errors: string[];
   461‚Üí}
   462‚Üí
   463‚Üíexport interface CreateOptions {
   464‚Üí  controllerAdapter?: ControllerAdapterInterface;
   465‚Üí  targets: string[];
   466‚Üí}
   467‚Üí
   468‚Üíexport class DeploymentWorkflow extends EventEmitter {
   469‚Üí  constructor(
   470‚Üí    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
   471‚Üí    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
   472‚Üí    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
   473‚Üí  ) {
   474‚Üí    super();
   475‚Üí  }
   476‚Üí
   477‚Üí  static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
   478‚Üí    // Auto-detect controller or use specified adapter
   479‚Üí    const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
   480‚Üí
   481‚Üí    // Get appropriate converter for detected controller
   482‚Üí    const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
   483‚Üí
   484‚Üí    // Initialize DAW deployers
   485‚Üí    const deployers = new Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>();
   486‚Üí    if (options.targets.includes('ardour')) {
   487‚Üí      const { ArdourDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/ArdourDeployer.js');
   488‚Üí      deployers.set('ardour', new ArdourDeployer());
   489‚Üí    }
   490‚Üí    if (options.targets.includes('live')) {
   491‚Üí      const { LiveDeployer } = await import('../adapters/daws/LiveDeployer.js');
   492‚Üí      deployers.set('live', new LiveDeployer());
   493‚Üí    }
   494‚Üí
   495‚Üí    return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, deployers);
   496‚Üí  }
   497‚Üí
   498‚Üí  async execute(options: WorkflowOptions): Promise<WorkflowResult> {
   499‚Üí    const errors: string[] = [];
   500‚Üí
   501‚Üí    try {
   502‚Üí      // Step 1: Read configuration from controller
   503‚Üí      this.emit('progress', { step: 1, message: 'Reading controller configuration...' });
   504‚Üí      const config = await this.controllerAdapter.readConfiguration(options.configSlot);
   505‚Üí
   506‚Üí      // Step 2: Convert to canonical format
   507‚Üí      this.emit('progress', { step: 2, message: 'Converting to canonical format...' });
   508‚Üí      const canonicalMap = this.converter.convert(config, {
   509‚Üí        pluginInfo: options.pluginInfo,
   510‚Üí        midiChannel: options.midiChannel,
   511‚Üí        preserveLabels: options.preserveLabels ?? true
   512‚Üí      });
   513‚Üí
   514‚Üí      // Step 3: Save canonical YAML (optional)
   515‚Üí      if (options.outputDir) {
   516‚Üí        await this.saveCanonical(canonicalMap, options.outputDir);
   517‚Üí      }
   518‚Üí
   519‚Üí      // Step 4: Deploy to each target DAW
   520‚Üí      this.emit('progress', { step: 3, message: 'Deploying to DAWs...' });
   521‚Üí      const deployments: DeploymentResult[] = [];
   522‚Üí
   523‚Üí      for (const target of options.targets) {
   524‚Üí        const deployer = this.deployers.get(target);
   525‚Üí        if (deployer) {
   526‚Üí          const result = await deployer.deploy(canonicalMap, {
   527‚Üí            autoInstall: options.autoInstall,
   528‚Üí            dryRun: options.dryRun
   529‚Üí          });
   530‚Üí          deployments.push(result);
   531‚Üí          if (!result.success) {
   532‚Üí            errors.push(...(result.errors || [`${target} deployment failed`]));
   533‚Üí          }
   534‚Üí        } else {
   535‚Üí          errors.push(`No deployer available for ${target}`);
   536‚Üí        }
   537‚Üí      }
   538‚Üí
   539‚Üí      return {
   540‚Üí        success: deployments.every(d => d.success) && errors.length === 0,
   541‚Üí        controllerConfig: config,
   542‚Üí        canonicalMap,
   543‚Üí        deployments,
   544‚Üí        errors
   545‚Üí      };
   546‚Üí
   547‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   548‚Üí      errors.push(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error));
   549‚Üí      return {
   550‚Üí        success: false,
   551‚Üí        deployments: [],
   552‚Üí        errors
   553‚Üí      };
   554‚Üí    }
   555‚Üí  }
   556‚Üí
   557‚Üí  getControllerAdapter(): ControllerAdapterInterface {
   558‚Üí    return this.controllerAdapter;
   559‚Üí  }
   560‚Üí
   561‚Üí  private async saveCanonical(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, outputDir: string): Promise<void> {
   562‚Üí    const yaml = await import('yaml');
   563‚Üí    const { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } = await import('fs');
   564‚Üí    const { join } = await import('path');
   565‚Üí
   566‚Üí    mkdirSync(outputDir, { recursive: true });
   567‚Üí    const filename = `${canonicalMap.device.model.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}-${canonicalMap.metadata.name.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}.yaml`;
   568‚Üí    const filepath = join(outputDir, filename);
   569‚Üí
   570‚Üí    writeFileSync(filepath, yaml.stringify(canonicalMap));
   571‚Üí    this.emit('canonical-saved', { path: filepath });
   572‚Üí  }
   573‚Üí
   574‚Üí  private static async detectController(): Promise<ControllerAdapterInterface> {
   575‚Üí    // Try to detect connected controller
   576‚Üí    // Start with LCXL3, add more controllers later
   577‚Üí    try {
   578‚Üí      const { LaunchControlXL3Adapter } = await import('../adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.js');
   579‚Üí      return await LaunchControlXL3Adapter.create();
   580‚Üí    } catch {
   581‚Üí      throw new Error('No supported controller detected');
   582‚Üí    }
   583‚Üí  }
   584‚Üí
   585‚Üí  private static getConverterFor(adapter: ControllerAdapterInterface): CanonicalConverterInterface {
   586‚Üí    // Registry of converters by controller model
   587‚Üí    if (adapter.model === 'Launch Control XL 3') {
   588‚Üí      const { LaunchControlXL3Converter } = require('../converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.js');
   589‚Üí      return new LaunchControlXL3Converter();
   590‚Üí    }
   591‚Üí    throw new Error(`No converter available for ${adapter.model}`);
   592‚Üí  }
   593‚Üí}
   594‚Üí\```
   595‚Üí
   596‚Üí**Acceptance Criteria - Phase 4:**

   605‚Üí## Phase 5: Universal CLI
   606‚Üí
   607‚Üí**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/cli/deploy.ts`
   608‚Üí
   609‚Üí\```typescript
   610‚Üí#!/usr/bin/env node
   611‚Üíimport { Command } from 'commander';
   612‚Üíimport { DeploymentWorkflow } from '../orchestrator/DeploymentWorkflow.js';
   613‚Üí
   614‚Üíconst program = new Command();
   615‚Üí
   616‚Üíprogram
   617‚Üí  .name('controller-deploy')
   618‚Üí  .description('Deploy MIDI controller configurations to DAWs')
   619‚Üí  .version('1.0.0');
   620‚Üí
   621‚Üíprogram
   622‚Üí  .command('list')
   623‚Üí  .description('List connected controllers and available configurations')
   624‚Üí  .action(async () => {
   625‚Üí    try {
   626‚Üí      const workflow = await DeploymentWorkflow.create({ targets: [] });
   627‚Üí      const adapter = workflow.getControllerAdapter();
   628‚Üí
   629‚Üí      console.log(`\nüì± Detected: ${adapter.manufacturer} ${adapter.model}`);
   630‚Üí      console.log(`\nAvailable configurations:`);
   631‚Üí
   632‚Üí      const configs = await adapter.listConfigurations();
   633‚Üí      configs.forEach(slot => {
   634‚Üí        const status = slot.isEmpty ? '(empty)' : slot.name;
   635‚Üí        console.log(`  Slot ${slot.index}: ${status}`);
   636‚Üí      });
   637‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   638‚Üí      console.error(`\n‚ùå Error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
   639‚Üí      process.exit(1);
   640‚Üí    }
   641‚Üí  });
   642‚Üí
   643‚Üíprogram
   644‚Üí  .command('deploy')
   645‚Üí  .description('Deploy a controller configuration to DAW(s)')
   646‚Üí  .option('-c, --controller <type>', 'Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)')
   647‚Üí  .option('-s, --slot <number>', 'Configuration slot number', '0')
   648‚Üí  .option('-d, --daw <daws...>', 'Target DAWs (ardour, live)', ['ardour'])
   649‚Üí  .option('-p, --plugin <name>', 'Plugin name for parameter mapping')
   650‚Üí  .option('-m, --midi-channel <number>', 'MIDI channel override')
   651‚Üí  .option('-o, --output <dir>', 'Output directory for canonical YAML')
   652‚Üí  .option('--install', 'Auto-install to DAW config directories', false)
   653‚Üí  .option('--dry-run', 'Preview without deploying', false)
   654‚Üí  .action(async (options) => {
   655‚Üí    console.log('üéõÔ∏è  Controller Workflow - DAW Deployment\n');
   656‚Üí
   657‚Üí    try {
   658‚Üí      const workflow = await DeploymentWorkflow.create({
   659‚Üí        targets: options.daw
   660‚Üí      });
   661‚Üí
   662‚Üí      workflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
   663‚Üí        console.log(`[${step}/3] ${message}`);
   664‚Üí      });
   665‚Üí
   666‚Üí      workflow.on('canonical-saved', ({ path }) => {
   667‚Üí        console.log(`     ‚úì Saved canonical: ${path}`);
   668‚Üí      });
   669‚Üí
   670‚Üí      const result = await workflow.execute({
   671‚Üí        configSlot: parseInt(options.slot),
   672‚Üí        targets: options.daw,
   673‚Üí        pluginInfo: options.plugin ? { name: options.plugin } : undefined,
   674‚Üí        midiChannel: options.midiChannel ? parseInt(options.midiChannel) : undefined,
   675‚Üí        outputDir: options.output,
   676‚Üí        autoInstall: options.install,
   677‚Üí        dryRun: options.dryRun
   678‚Üí      });
   679‚Üí
   680‚Üí      if (result.success) {
   681‚Üí        console.log('\n‚úÖ Deployment complete!\n');
   682‚Üí        result.deployments.forEach(d => {
   683‚Üí          if (d.outputPath) {
   684‚Üí            console.log(`  ${d.dawName}: ${d.outputPath}`);
   685‚Üí          }
   686‚Üí        });
   687‚Üí      } else {
   688‚Üí        console.error('\n‚ùå Deployment failed:\n');
   689‚Üí        result.errors.forEach(e => console.error(`  - ${e}`));
   690‚Üí        process.exit(1);
   691‚Üí      }
   692‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   693‚Üí      console.error(`\n‚ùå Error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
   694‚Üí      process.exit(1);
   695‚Üí    }
   696‚Üí  });
   697‚Üí
   698‚Üíprogram.parse();
   699‚Üí\```

   725‚Üí## Phase 6: DAW Deployers
   726‚Üí
   727‚Üí### Ardour Deployer
   728‚Üí
   729‚Üí**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/adapters/daws/ArdourDeployer.ts`
   730‚Üí
   731‚Üí\```typescript
   732‚Üíimport { MidiMapBuilder, ArdourXMLSerializer } from '@oletizi/ardour-midi-maps';
   733‚Üí
   734‚Üíexport class ArdourDeployer implements DAWDeployerInterface {
   735‚Üí  readonly dawName = 'Ardour';
   736‚Üí  readonly version = '8.0';
   737‚Üí
   738‚Üí  async deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult> {
   739‚Üí    try {
   740‚Üí      // Convert canonical ‚Üí Ardour XML
   741‚Üí      const ardourMap = this.convertToArdour(canonicalMap);
   742‚Üí      const serializer = new ArdourXMLSerializer();
   743‚Üí      const xml = serializer.serializeMidiMap(ardourMap);
   744‚Üí
   745‚Üí      // Determine output path
   746‚Üí      const outputPath = options.outputPath || await this.getDefaultOutputPath(canonicalMap);
   747‚Üí
   748‚Üí      if (!options.dryRun) {
   749‚Üí        const { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } = await import('fs');
   750‚Üí        const { dirname } = await import('path');
   751‚Üí
   752‚Üí        mkdirSync(dirname(outputPath), { recursive: true });
   753‚Üí        writeFileSync(outputPath, xml);
   754‚Üí
   755‚Üí        // Install to Ardour config if requested
   756‚Üí        if (options.autoInstall) {
   757‚Üí          const configDir = await this.getConfigDirectory();
   758‚Üí          const { basename, join } = await import('path');
   759‚Üí          const installPath = join(configDir, basename(outputPath));
   760‚Üí          writeFileSync(installPath, xml);
   761‚Üí          return {
   762‚Üí            success: true,
   763‚Üí            dawName: this.dawName,
   764‚Üí            outputPath: installPath,
   765‚Üí            installed: true
   766‚Üí          };
   767‚Üí        }
   768‚Üí      }
   769‚Üí
   770‚Üí      return {
   771‚Üí        success: true,
   772‚Üí        dawName: this.dawName,
   773‚Üí        outputPath,
   774‚Üí        installed: false
   775‚Üí      };
   776‚Üí
   777‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   778‚Üí      return {
   779‚Üí        success: false,
   780‚Üí        dawName: this.dawName,
   781‚Üí        errors: [error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)]
   782‚Üí      };
   783‚Üí    }
   784‚Üí  }
   785‚Üí
   786‚Üí  async isInstalled(): Promise<boolean> {
   787‚Üí    const { existsSync } = await import('fs');
   788‚Üí    try {
   789‚Üí      const configDir = await this.getConfigDirectory();
   790‚Üí      return existsSync(configDir);
   791‚Üí    } catch {
   792‚Üí      return false;
   793‚Üí    }
   794‚Üí  }
   795‚Üí
   796‚Üí  async getConfigDirectory(): Promise<string> {
   797‚Üí    const { homedir } = await import('os');
   798‚Üí    const { join } = await import('path');
   799‚Üí    const home = homedir();
   800‚Üí
   801‚Üí    switch (process.platform) {
   802‚Üí      case 'darwin':
   803‚Üí        return join(home, 'Library', 'Preferences', 'Ardour8', 'midi_maps');
   804‚Üí      case 'linux':
   805‚Üí        return join(home, '.config', 'ardour8', 'midi_maps');
   806‚Üí      case 'win32':
   807‚Üí        return join(home, 'AppData', 'Local', 'Ardour8', 'midi_maps');
   808‚Üí      default:
   809‚Üí        throw new Error(`Unsupported platform: ${process.platform}`);
   810‚Üí    }
   811‚Üí  }
   812‚Üí
   813‚Üí  private convertToArdour(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap): any {
   814‚Üí    // Use existing ardour-midi-maps conversion logic
   815‚Üí    const builder = new MidiMapBuilder({
   816‚Üí      name: `${canonicalMap.device.manufacturer} ${canonicalMap.device.model}`,
   817‚Üí      version: canonicalMap.version
   818‚Üí    });
   819‚Üí
   820‚Üí    // Convert controls
   821‚Üí    for (const control of canonicalMap.controls) {
   822‚Üí      if (control.type === 'button') {
   823‚Üí        builder.addNoteBinding({
   824‚Üí          channel: control.channel as number,
   825‚Üí          note: control.cc!,
   826‚Üí          function: control.plugin_parameter ?
   827‚Üí            `/route/plugin/parameter S1 1 ${control.plugin_parameter}` :
   828‚Üí            'transport-stop'
   829‚Üí        });
   830‚Üí      } else {
   831‚Üí        builder.addCCBinding({
   832‚Üí          channel: control.channel as number,
   833‚Üí          controller: control.cc!,
   834‚Üí          function: control.plugin_parameter ?
   835‚Üí            `/route/plugin/parameter S1 1 ${control.plugin_parameter}` :
   836‚Üí            'track-set-gain[1]',
   837‚Üí          encoder: control.type === 'encoder'
   838‚Üí        });
   839‚Üí      }
   840‚Üí    }
   841‚Üí
   842‚Üí    return builder.build();
   843‚Üí  }
   844‚Üí
   845‚Üí  private async getDefaultOutputPath(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap): Promise<string> {
   846‚Üí    const { join } = await import('path');
   847‚Üí    const filename = `${canonicalMap.device.manufacturer.toLowerCase()}-${canonicalMap.device.model.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')}.map`;
   848‚Üí    return join(process.cwd(), 'dist', 'ardour-maps', filename);
   849‚Üí  }
   850‚Üí}
   851‚Üí\```

   114‚Üí    try {
   115‚Üí      const result = await executeDeployment(options);
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí      if (result.success) {
   118‚Üí        displaySuccessSummary(result);
   119‚Üí        process.exit(0);
   120‚Üí      } else {
   121‚Üí        displayErrorSummary(result);
   122‚Üí        process.exit(1);
   123‚Üí      }
   124‚Üí    } catch (error: unknown) {
   125‚Üí      handleError(error);
   126‚Üí    }
   127‚Üí  });
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí/**
   130‚Üí * Execute full deployment workflow.
   131‚Üí *
   132‚Üí * Orchestrates the complete process of reading a controller configuration,
   133‚Üí * converting it to canonical format, and deploying to one or more DAWs.
   134‚Üí *
   135‚Üí * @param options - Deployment options from CLI
   136‚Üí * @returns Deployment summary with paths and error details
   137‚Üí * @throws Error if slot number is invalid (not 0-15)
   138‚Üí * @throws Error if MIDI channel is invalid (not 0-15)
   139‚Üí * @throws Error if controller detection fails
   140‚Üí * @throws Error if configuration cannot be read from controller
   141‚Üí */
   142‚Üíasync function executeDeployment(options: {
   143‚Üí  controller?: string;
   144‚Üí  slot: string;
   145‚Üí  daw: string[];
   146‚Üí  plugin?: string;
   147‚Üí  midiChannel?: string;
   148‚Üí  output: string;
   149‚Üí  install: boolean;
   150‚Üí  dryRun: boolean;
   151‚Üí}): Promise<DeploymentSummary> {
   152‚Üí  const slotNumber = parseInt(options.slot, 10);
   153‚Üí  const midiChannel = options.midiChannel ? parseInt(options.midiChannel, 10) : undefined;
   154‚Üí
   155‚Üí  if (isNaN(slotNumber) || slotNumber < 0 || slotNumber > 15) {
   156‚Üí    throw new Error('Slot number must be between 0 and 15');
   157‚Üí  }
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí  if (midiChannel !== undefined && (isNaN(midiChannel) || midiChannel < 0 || midiChannel > 15)) {
   160‚Üí    throw new Error('MIDI channel must be between 0 and 15');
   161‚Üí  }
   162‚Üí
   163‚Üí  console.log('\nüéõÔ∏è  Controller Workflow - DAW Deployment\n');
   164‚Üí
   165‚Üí  // Step 1: Read controller configuration
   166‚Üí  emitProgress({ step: 1, total: 3, message: 'Reading controller configuration...' });
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí  const controller = await detectController();
   169‚Üí  await controller.connect();
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üí  const deviceInfo = await controller.getDeviceInfo();
   172‚Üí  const config = await controller.readConfiguration(slotNumber);
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí  console.log(`     ‚úì Controller: ${deviceInfo.manufacturer} ${deviceInfo.model}`);
   175‚Üí  console.log(`     ‚úì Configuration: "${config.name}" from slot ${slotNumber}\n`);
   176‚Üí
   177‚Üí  // Step 2: Convert to canonical format
   178‚Üí  emitProgress({ step: 2, total: 3, message: 'Converting to canonical format...' });
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí  const converter = new LaunchControlXL3Converter();
   181‚Üí
   182‚Üí  // Build plugin info if provided
   183‚Üí  let pluginInfo: PluginDefinition | undefined;
   184‚Üí  if (options.plugin) {
   185‚Üí    pluginInfo = {
   186‚Üí      manufacturer: 'Unknown',
   187‚Üí      name: options.plugin,
   188‚Üí    };
   189‚Üí  }
   190‚Üí
   191‚Üí  const canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap = converter.convert(config, {
   192‚Üí    ...(pluginInfo ? { pluginInfo } : {}),
   193‚Üí    ...(midiChannel !== undefined ? { midiChannel } : {}),
   194‚Üí    preserveLabels: true,
   195‚Üí  });
   196‚Üí
   197‚Üí  // Write canonical YAML
   198‚Üí  let canonicalPath = '';
   199‚Üí  if (!options.dryRun) {
   200‚Üí    await fs.mkdir(options.output, { recursive: true });
   201‚Üí    const canonicalFilename = `${sanitizeFilename(config.name)}.yaml`;
   202‚Üí    canonicalPath = path.join(options.output, canonicalFilename);
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üí    const yamlContent = yamlStringify(canonicalMap);
   205‚Üí    await fs.writeFile(canonicalPath, yamlContent, 'utf-8');
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí    console.log(`     ‚úì Saved canonical: ${canonicalPath}\n`);
   208‚Üí  } else {
   209‚Üí    canonicalPath = path.join(options.output, `${sanitizeFilename(config.name)}.yaml`);
   210‚Üí    console.log(`     ‚úì Canonical format generated (dry-run - not saved)\n`);
   211‚Üí  }
   212‚Üí
   213‚Üí  // Step 3: Deploy to DAWs
   214‚Üí  emitProgress({ step: 3, total: 3, message: 'Deploying to DAWs...' });
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí  const dawPaths: Record<string, string> = {};
   217‚Üí  const errors: string[] = [];
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí  for (const daw of options.daw) {
   220‚Üí    try {
   221‚Üí      const deployer = createDeployer(daw);
   222‚Üí      const dawPath = await deployer.deploy(canonicalMap, {
   223‚Üí        autoInstall: options.install,
   224‚Üí        outputPath: path.join(options.output, `${sanitizeFilename(config.name)}.${getFileExtension(daw)}`),
   225‚Üí        dryRun: options.dryRun,
   226‚Üí      });
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí      if (dawPath.success && dawPath.outputPath) {
   229‚Üí        dawPaths[daw] = dawPath.outputPath;
   230‚Üí        console.log(`     ‚úì ${capitalize(daw)}: ${dawPath.outputPath}`);
   231‚Üí      } else {
   232‚Üí        const deployErrors = dawPath.errors?.join(', ') || 'Unknown error';
   233‚Üí        errors.push(`${daw}: ${deployErrors}`);
   234‚Üí        console.log(`     ‚úó ${capitalize(daw)}: ${deployErrors}`);
   235‚Üí      }
   236‚Üí    } catch (error: unknown) {
   237‚Üí      const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);
   238‚Üí      errors.push(`${daw}: ${errorMessage}`);
   239‚Üí      console.log(`     ‚úó ${capitalize(daw)}: ${errorMessage}`);
   240‚Üí    }
   241‚Üí  }
   242‚Üí
   243‚Üí  await controller.disconnect();
   244‚Üí
   245‚Üí  return {
   246‚Üí    success: errors.length === 0,
   247‚Üí    controller: `${deviceInfo.manufacturer} ${deviceInfo.model}`,
   248‚Üí    slot: slotNumber,
   249‚Üí    canonicalPath,
   250‚Üí    dawPaths,
   251‚Üí    errors,
   252‚Üí  };
   253‚Üí}
   254‚Üí
   255‚Üí/**
   256‚Üí * Create DAW deployer based on DAW type.
   257‚Üí *
   258‚Üí * Factory function that instantiates the appropriate deployer implementation
   259‚Üí * for the specified DAW.
   260‚Üí *
   261‚Üí * @param daw - DAW name (e.g., "ardour", "live", "ableton")
   262‚Üí * @returns DAW-specific deployer instance
   263‚Üí * @throws Error if DAW is not supported
   264‚Üí */
   265‚Üífunction createDeployer(daw: string): DAWDeployerInterface {
   266‚Üí  const normalizedDAW = daw.toLowerCase();
   267‚Üí
   268‚Üí  switch (normalizedDAW) {
   269‚Üí    case 'ardour':
   270‚Üí      return ArdourDeployer.create();
   271‚Üí
   272‚Üí    case 'live':
   273‚Üí    case 'ableton':
   274‚Üí      throw new Error('Ableton Live deployment not yet implemented');
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí    default:
   277‚Üí      throw new Error(`Unsupported DAW: ${daw}`);
   278‚Üí  }
   279‚Üí}
   280‚Üí
   281‚Üí/**
   282‚Üí * Get file extension for DAW format.
   283‚Üí *
   284‚Üí * Maps DAW names to their respective output file extensions.
   285‚Üí *
   286‚Üí * @param daw - DAW name (e.g., "ardour", "live")
   287‚Üí * @returns File extension without dot (e.g., "map", "amxd")
   288‚Üí */
   289‚Üífunction getFileExtension(daw: string): string {
   290‚Üí  const normalizedDAW = daw.toLowerCase();
   291‚Üí
   292‚Üí  switch (normalizedDAW) {
   293‚Üí    case 'ardour':
   294‚Üí      return 'map';
   295‚Üí    case 'live':
   296‚Üí    case 'ableton':
   297‚Üí      return 'amxd';
   298‚Üí    default:
   299‚Üí      return 'txt';
   300‚Üí  }
   301‚Üí}
   302‚Üí
   303‚Üí/**
   304‚Üí * Auto-detect connected MIDI controller.
   305‚Üí *
   306‚Üí * Attempts to detect and connect to a supported MIDI controller.
   307‚Üí * Currently supports Novation Launch Control XL 3, with future
   308‚Üí * extensibility for additional controllers.
   309‚Üí *
   310‚Üí * @returns Connected controller adapter instance
   311‚Üí * @throws Error if no supported controller is detected
   312‚Üí */
   313‚Üíasync function detectController(): Promise<ControllerAdapterInterface> {
   314‚Üí  // Attempt to detect LCXL3
   315‚Üí  try {
   316‚Üí    const adapter = await LaunchControlXL3Adapter.create();
   317‚Üí    return adapter;
   318‚Üí  } catch (error: unknown) {
   319‚Üí    throw new Error(
   320‚Üí      'No supported controller detected. Ensure your controller is connected via USB.\n' +
   321‚Üí      'Supported controllers: Novation Launch Control XL 3'
   322‚Üí    );
   323‚Üí  }
   324‚Üí}
   325‚Üí
   326‚Üí/**
   327‚Üí * Emit progress message to console.
   328‚Üí *
   329‚Üí * Displays a formatted progress message showing the current step
   330‚Üí * in the deployment workflow.
   331‚Üí *
   332‚Üí * @param event - Progress event containing step, total, and message
   333‚Üí */
   334‚Üífunction emitProgress(event: ProgressEvent): void {
   335‚Üí  console.log(`[${event.step}/${event.total}] ${event.message}`);
   336‚Üí}
   337‚Üí
   338‚Üí/**
   339‚Üí * Display successful deployment summary.
   340‚Üí *
   341‚Üí * Prints a formatted success message with paths to all generated files
   342‚Üí * including the canonical YAML and DAW-specific formats.
   343‚Üí *
   344‚Üí * @param result - Deployment result summary
   345‚Üí */
   346‚Üífunction displaySuccessSummary(result: DeploymentSummary): void {
   347‚Üí  console.log('\n‚úÖ Deployment complete!\n');
   348‚Üí
   349‚Üí  console.log(`  Canonical YAML: ${result.canonicalPath}`);
   350‚Üí
   351‚Üí  if (Object.keys(result.dawPaths).length > 0) {
   352‚Üí    console.log('\n  DAW Formats:');
   353‚Üí    for (const [daw, dawPath] of Object.entries(result.dawPaths)) {
   354‚Üí      console.log(`    ${capitalize(daw)}: ${dawPath}`);
   355‚Üí    }
   356‚Üí  }
   357‚Üí
   358‚Üí  console.log('');
   359‚Üí}
   360‚Üí
   361‚Üí/**
   362‚Üí * Display error summary.
   363‚Üí *
   364‚Üí * Prints a formatted error message listing all errors that occurred
   365‚Üí * during the deployment workflow.
   366‚Üí *
   367‚Üí * @param result - Deployment result summary with errors
   368‚Üí */
   369‚Üífunction displayErrorSummary(result: DeploymentSummary): void {
   370‚Üí  console.error('\n‚ùå Deployment failed\n');
   371‚Üí
   372‚Üí  if (result.errors.length > 0) {
   373‚Üí    console.error('  Errors:');
   374‚Üí    for (const error of result.errors) {
   375‚Üí      console.error(`    - ${error}`);
   376‚Üí    }
   377‚Üí    console.error('');
   378‚Üí  }
   379‚Üí}
   380‚Üí
   381‚Üí/**
   382‚Üí * Handle uncaught errors.
   383‚Üí *
   384‚Üí * Final error handler that prints error messages and exits the process
   385‚Üí * with a non-zero status code.
   386‚Üí *
   387‚Üí * @param error - Error object or string
   388‚Üí */
   389‚Üífunction handleError(error: unknown): void {
   390‚Üí  const message = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);
   391‚Üí  console.error(`\n‚ùå Error: ${message}\n`);
   392‚Üí  process.exit(1);
   393‚Üí}
   394‚Üí
   395‚Üí/**
   396‚Üí * Sanitize filename for filesystem safety.
   397‚Üí *
   398‚Üí * Removes special characters and normalizes spaces to underscores
   399‚Üí * to create safe filenames for all platforms.
   400‚Üí *
   401‚Üí * @param name - Original name string
   402‚Üí * @returns Sanitized filename safe for filesystem use
   403‚Üí *
   404‚Üí * @example
   405‚Üí * \```typescript
   406‚Üí * sanitizeFilename("My Config #1")  // returns "my_config_1"
   407‚Üí * sanitizeFilename("Test-Mode")     // returns "test-mode"
   408‚Üí * \```
   409‚Üí */
   410‚Üífunction sanitizeFilename(name: string): string {
   411‚Üí  return name
   412‚Üí    .replace(/[^a-z0-9_-]/gi, '_')
   413‚Üí    .replace(/_+/g, '_')
   414‚Üí    .toLowerCase();
   415‚Üí}
   416‚Üí
   417‚Üí/**
   418‚Üí * Capitalize first letter of string.
   419‚Üí *
   420‚Üí * Simple utility to capitalize the first character of a string
   421‚Üí * for display purposes.
   422‚Üí *
   423‚Üí * @param str - Input string
   424‚Üí * @returns String with first character capitalized
   425‚Üí *
   426‚Üí * @example
   427‚Üí * \```typescript
   428‚Üí * capitalize("ardour")  // returns "Ardour"
   429‚Üí * capitalize("live")    // returns "Live"
   430‚Üí * \```
   431‚Üí */
   432‚Üífunction capitalize(str: string): string {
   433‚Üí  return str.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + str.slice(1);
   434‚Üí}

   437‚Üíprogram.parse();

/**
 * Parameter Matcher Service
 *
 * Uses Claude AI to perform fuzzy matching between hardware control names
 * and plugin parameter names, enabling intelligent auto-mapping of controllers
 * to plugin parameters.
 *
 * @module controller-workflow/services
 */

import * as fs from 'fs/promises';
import * as path from 'path';
import { spawn } from 'child_process';
import type { PluginDescriptor } from '@oletizi/canonical-midi-maps';

/**
 * Result of a parameter matching operation.
 * Contains the matched parameter index, confidence score, and reasoning.
 */
export interface ParameterMatchResult {
  /** Original control name from hardware controller */
  controlName: string;

  /** Matched plugin parameter index (undefined if no match) */
  pluginParameter?: number;

  /** Match confidence score from 0 to 1 */
  confidence: number;

  /** Name of the matched parameter */
  parameterName?: string;

  /** AI reasoning for the match decision */
  reasoning?: string;
}

/**
 * Options for parameter matching behavior.
 */
export interface MatchOptions {
  /** Minimum confidence threshold (0-1). Matches below this are discarded. */
  minConfidence?: number;

  /** Whether to preserve original control names in output */
  preserveControlNames?: boolean;

  /** Custom system prompt to guide matching behavior */
  customPrompt?: string;

  /** Timeout for AI request in milliseconds */
  timeout?: number;
}

/**
 * Interface for parameter matching implementations.
 * Allows for different matching strategies (AI-based, rule-based, etc.)
 */
export interface ParameterMatcherInterface {
  /**
   * Match hardware control names to plugin parameters.
   *
   * @param controlNames - List of hardware control names to match
   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor with parameter information
   * @param options - Optional matching configuration
   * @returns Promise resolving to array of match results
   */
  matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options?: MatchOptions
  ): Promise<ParameterMatchResult[]>;
}

/**
 * Claude AI-based parameter matcher implementation.
 *
 * Uses Claude to intelligently match hardware control names to plugin parameters
 * based on semantic similarity, common naming patterns, and domain knowledge.
 *
 * Supports both Anthropic API (via ANTHROPIC_API_KEY) and Claude CLI.
 */
export class ParameterMatcher implements ParameterMatcherInterface {
  private readonly minConfidence: number;
  private readonly timeout: number;

  /**
   * Create a new ParameterMatcher instance.
   *
   * @param options - Configuration options
   */
  constructor(options: { minConfidence?: number; timeout?: number } = {}) {
    this.minConfidence = options.minConfidence ?? 0.5;
    this.timeout = options.timeout ?? 30000; // 30 second default
  }

  /**
   * Factory method to create a ParameterMatcher instance.
   *
   * @param options - Configuration options
   * @returns New ParameterMatcher instance
   */
  static create(options?: { minConfidence?: number; timeout?: number }): ParameterMatcher {
    return new ParameterMatcher(options);
  }

  /**
   * Match hardware control names to plugin parameters using Claude AI.
   *
   * Constructs a prompt containing control names and plugin parameters,
   * sends it to Claude, and parses the structured response.
   *
   * @param controlNames - Hardware control names to match
   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor with parameters
   * @param options - Optional matching configuration
   * @returns Promise resolving to match results
   * @throws Error if Claude API/CLI is unavailable
   * @throws Error if response parsing fails
   */
  async matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options: MatchOptions = {}
  ): Promise<ParameterMatchResult[]> {
    const minConfidence = options.minConfidence ?? this.minConfidence;

    // Build the matching prompt
    const prompt = this.buildMatchingPrompt(controlNames, pluginDescriptor, options);

    // Call Claude (API or CLI)
    const response = await this.callClaude(prompt);

    // Parse Claude's response
    const results = this.parseClaudeResponse(response, controlNames, pluginDescriptor);

    // Filter by confidence threshold
    return results.map((result) => {
      if (result.confidence < minConfidence) {
        return {
          controlName: result.controlName,
          confidence: result.confidence,
          reasoning: result.reasoning,
        };
      }
      return result;
    });
  }

  /**
   * Build the matching prompt for Claude.
   *
   * Creates a structured prompt that guides Claude to match control names
   * to plugin parameters with confidence scores and reasoning.
   *
   * @param controlNames - Control names to match
   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor
   * @param options - Optional configuration
   * @returns Formatted prompt string
   */
  private buildMatchingPrompt(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options: MatchOptions
  ): string {
    const systemPrompt =
      options.customPrompt ||
      `You are an expert at mapping MIDI controller controls to audio plugin parameters.
Your task is to match hardware control names to plugin parameter names based on semantic similarity,
common audio engineering naming conventions, and logical groupings.

For each control name, provide:
1. The best matching plugin parameter index (or null if no good match)
2. A confidence score from 0.0 to 1.0
3. Brief reasoning for your choice

Consider:
- Semantic similarity (e.g., "Filter Cutoff" matches "Cutoff", "LP Freq", "Filter Frequency")
- Common abbreviations (e.g., "Res" for "Resonance", "Env" for "Envelope")
- Logical groupings (e.g., oscillator controls, filter controls, envelope controls)
- Parameter groups and categories in the plugin
- Audio engineering domain knowledge

Respond with a JSON array of objects with this structure:
[
  {
    "controlName": "string",
    "parameterIndex": number | null,
    "parameterName": "string" | null,
    "confidence": number,
    "reasoning": "string"
  }
]`;

    // Format parameter list
    const parameterList = pluginDescriptor.parameters
      .map((param) => {
        const group = param.group ? ` [${param.group}]` : '';
        return `  ${param.index}: ${param.name}${group}`;
      })
      .join('\n');

    const controlList = controlNames.map((name, i) => `  ${i}: ${name}`).join('\n');

    const prompt = `${systemPrompt}

PLUGIN: ${pluginDescriptor.plugin.manufacturer} - ${pluginDescriptor.plugin.name}
Total Parameters: ${pluginDescriptor.parameters.length}

PLUGIN PARAMETERS:
${parameterList}

HARDWARE CONTROLS TO MATCH:
${controlList}

Please provide the JSON response with matches for each control.`;

    return prompt;
  }

  /**
   * Call Claude AI to process the matching request.
   *
   * Attempts to use Anthropic API if ANTHROPIC_API_KEY is set,
   * otherwise falls back to Claude CLI command.
   *
   * @param prompt - The matching prompt
   * @returns Promise resolving to Claude's response text
   * @throws Error if both API and CLI are unavailable
   * @throws Error if request times out or fails
   */
  private async callClaude(prompt: string): Promise<string> {
    const apiKey = process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY;

    if (apiKey) {
      return this.callClaudeAPI(prompt, apiKey);
    } else {
      return this.callClaudeCLI(prompt);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Call Claude using the Anthropic API.
   *
   * Makes a direct HTTP request to the Anthropic API endpoint.
   *
   * @param prompt - The matching prompt
   * @param apiKey - Anthropic API key
   * @returns Promise resolving to Claude's response
   * @throws Error if API request fails
   */
  private async callClaudeAPI(prompt: string, apiKey: string): Promise<string> {
    const response = await fetch('https://api.anthropic.com/v1/messages', {
      method: 'POST',
      headers: {
        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        'x-api-key': apiKey,
        'anthropic-version': '2023-06-01',
      },
      body: JSON.stringify({
        model: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022',
        max_tokens: 4096,
        messages: [
          {
            role: 'user',
            content: prompt,
          },
        ],
      }),
    });

    if (!response.ok) {
      const error = await response.text();
      throw new Error(`Claude API request failed: ${response.status} - ${error}`);
    }

    const data = (await response.json()) as {
      content: Array<{ type: string; text: string }>;
    };

    if (!data.content || data.content.length === 0) {
      throw new Error('Claude API returned empty response');
    }

    return data.content[0].text;
  }

  /**
   * Call Claude using the CLI command.
   *
   * Spawns the `claude` CLI process and pipes the prompt to it.
   *
   * @param prompt - The matching prompt
   * @returns Promise resolving to Claude's response
   * @throws Error if CLI command fails or times out
   */
  private async callClaudeCLI(prompt: string): Promise<string> {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      const process = spawn('claude', [], {
        stdio: ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
      });

      let stdout = '';
      let stderr = '';

      const timeoutHandle = setTimeout(() => {
        process.kill();
        reject(new Error(`Claude CLI request timed out after ${this.timeout}ms`));
      }, this.timeout);

      process.stdout.on('data', (data) => {
        stdout += data.toString();
      });

      process.stderr.on('data', (data) => {
        stderr += data.toString();
      });

      process.on('error', (error) => {
        clearTimeout(timeoutHandle);
        reject(new Error(`Failed to spawn Claude CLI: ${error.message}`));
      });

      process.on('close', (code) => {
        clearTimeout(timeoutHandle);

        if (code !== 0) {
          reject(new Error(`Claude CLI exited with code ${code}: ${stderr}`));
          return;
        }

        if (!stdout.trim()) {
          reject(new Error('Claude CLI returned empty response'));
          return;
        }

        resolve(stdout);
      });

      // Write prompt to stdin
      process.stdin.write(prompt);
      process.stdin.end();
    });
  }

  /**
   * Parse Claude's JSON response into ParameterMatchResult objects.
   *
   * Extracts the JSON array from Claude's response and validates the structure.
   *
   * @param response - Raw response text from Claude
   * @param controlNames - Original control names for validation
   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor for parameter lookup
   * @returns Array of match results
   * @throws Error if response cannot be parsed or is invalid
   */
  private parseClaudeResponse(
    response: string,
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor
  ): ParameterMatchResult[] {
    // Extract JSON from response (Claude might wrap it in markdown code blocks)
    const jsonMatch = response.match(/\[[\s\S]*\]/);
    if (!jsonMatch) {
      throw new Error(`Could not find JSON array in Claude response: ${response.substring(0, 200)}`);
    }

    let parsed: unknown;
    try {
      parsed = JSON.parse(jsonMatch[0]);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to parse Claude response as JSON: ${error}`);
    }

    if (!Array.isArray(parsed)) {
      throw new Error('Claude response is not an array');
    }

    // Validate and transform response
    const results: ParameterMatchResult[] = [];

    for (let i = 0; i < controlNames.length; i++) {
      const controlName = controlNames[i];
      const match = parsed[i];

      if (!match || typeof match !== 'object') {
        // If Claude didn't provide a match for this control, add a no-match result
        results.push({
          controlName,
          confidence: 0,
          reasoning: 'No match found',
        });
        continue;
      }

      const paramIndex = match.parameterIndex;
      const confidence = typeof match.confidence === 'number' ? match.confidence : 0;
      const reasoning = typeof match.reasoning === 'string' ? match.reasoning : '';

      if (paramIndex === null || paramIndex === undefined || paramIndex < 0) {
        results.push({
          controlName,
          confidence,
          reasoning,
        });
        continue;
      }

      // Validate parameter index
      const parameter = pluginDescriptor.parameters[paramIndex];
      if (!parameter) {
        results.push({
          controlName,
          confidence: 0,
          reasoning: `Invalid parameter index ${paramIndex}`,
        });
        continue;
      }

      results.push({
        controlName,
        pluginParameter: paramIndex,
        parameterName: parameter.name,
        confidence,
        reasoning,
      });
    }

    return results;
  }
}

/**
 * Load a plugin descriptor from the canonical-midi-maps registry.
 *
 * Looks up plugin descriptor files by manufacturer and plugin name,
 * normalizing names to match filesystem conventions.
 *
 * @param pluginName - Plugin name (e.g., "TAL-J-8" or "tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8")
 * @returns Promise resolving to plugin descriptor
 * @throws Error if descriptor file not found or cannot be loaded
 */
export async function loadPluginDescriptor(pluginName: string): Promise<PluginDescriptor> {
  // Normalize plugin name to filename format
  const normalizedName = pluginName.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-');

  // Find the canonical-midi-maps module
  // Navigate from controller-workflow to canonical-midi-maps
  const baseDir = path.resolve(__dirname, '../../canonical-midi-maps/plugin-descriptors');

  // Try to find matching descriptor file
  let descriptorPath: string | undefined;

  try {
    const files = await fs.readdir(baseDir);

    // Look for exact match or substring match
    const matchingFile = files.find(
      (file) => file === `${normalizedName}.json` || file.includes(normalizedName)
    );

    if (matchingFile) {
      descriptorPath = path.join(baseDir, matchingFile);
    }
  } catch (error) {
    throw new Error(`Failed to read plugin descriptors directory: ${error}`);
  }

  if (!descriptorPath) {
    throw new Error(
      `Plugin descriptor not found for "${pluginName}". ` +
        `Searched in ${baseDir} for files matching "${normalizedName}"`
    );
  }

  // Load and parse the descriptor
  try {
    const content = await fs.readFile(descriptorPath, 'utf-8');
    const descriptor = JSON.parse(content) as PluginDescriptor;

    // Validate basic structure
    if (!descriptor.plugin || !descriptor.parameters) {
      throw new Error('Invalid plugin descriptor structure: missing plugin or parameters');
    }

    return descriptor;
  } catch (error) {
    throw new Error(`Failed to load plugin descriptor from ${descriptorPath}: ${error}`);
  }
}

## Phase 1: Plugin Interrogation

### Purpose

Extract accurate parameter information from audio plugins to ensure mappings use real, valid parameter indices.

### Prerequisites

- JUCE-based plughost binary (built from project)
- Installed VST3 plugins
- canonical-midi-maps module

### Process

#### Step 1: Build Plugin Host

\```bash
# From project root
cd path/to/juce-plughost
make
# Binary output: build/plughost
\```

#### Step 2: Run Batch Interrogation

\```bash
# Navigate to canonical-midi-maps
cd modules/audio-control/modules/canonical-midi-maps

# Run batch plugin scanning
pnpm plugin:generate-batch
\```

**What happens:**
1. Launches `plughost` with `--batch-interrogate` flag
2. Scans all VST3 plugins in standard directories
3. Skips problematic plugins (UAD, etc.)
4. Extracts parameter information for each plugin
5. Outputs JSON stanzas to log file
6. Caches results for 24 hours

#### Step 3: Process Results

The batch generator automatically:
- Reads JSON stanzas from plughost output
- Converts to structured plugin descriptors
- Categorizes parameters (oscillator, filter, envelope, etc.)
- Saves individual descriptor files
- Updates catalog index

### Output

\```
plugin-descriptors/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json      # Jupiter-8 emulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ arturia-jup-8-v4.json                  # Arturia version
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ analogobsession-channev.json           # Channel strip
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ plugins-catalog-batch.json             # Master catalog
\```

### Example Plugin Descriptor

\```json
{
  "plugin": {
    "manufacturer": "TAL-Togu Audio Line",
    "name": "TAL-J-8",
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "format": "VST3",
    "uid": "-664001267"
  },
  "metadata": {
    "parameter_count": 2234,
    "created": "2025-10-11T10:00:00Z",
    "author": "plughost-batch",
    "tags": ["synthesizer", "analog", "jupiter-8"]
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "index": 105,
      "name": "VCF Cutoff",
      "min": 0,
      "max": 1,
      "default": 0.5,
      "group": "filter",
      "type": "continuous",
      "automatable": true
    },
    {
      "index": 65,
      "name": "Env Attack",
      "min": 0,
      "max": 1,
      "default": 0.1,
      "group": "envelope",
      "type": "continuous",
      "automatable": true
    }
  ],
  "groups": {
    "filter": {
      "parameters": [105, 107, 109, 111]
    },
    "envelope": {
      "parameters": [65, 67, 69, 71]
    }
  }
}
\```

## Phase 2: Canonical Mapping

### Purpose

Create device-specific MIDI controller ‚Üí plugin parameter mappings using accurate parameter indices from Phase 1.

### Two Approaches

#### Approach A: Manual YAML Creation (Traditional)

1. Choose hardware controller (e.g., Launch Control XL 3)
2. Choose target plugin (e.g., TAL-J-8)
3. Reference plugin descriptor for parameter indices
4. Create YAML mapping file

#### Approach B: Hardware Extraction (360 Feature) ‚≠ê

1. Create custom mode on hardware controller
2. Label controls with parameter names
3. Use `controller-deploy` to extract configuration
4. Automatically generate canonical mapping
5. **AI-powered parameter matching** (Phase 2.5)

### Manual YAML Creation

#### Step 1: Choose Target Combination

- **Hardware:** Novation Launch Control XL 3
- **Plugin:** TAL-J-8
- **Descriptor:** `plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json`

#### Step 2: Create YAML File

**Location:** `maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/roland-jupiter-8/tal-j8.yaml`

\```yaml
version: 1.0.0

device:
  manufacturer: Novation
  model: Launch Control XL 3

plugin:
  manufacturer: TAL Software
  name: TAL-J-8
  descriptor: plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json

metadata:
  name: Jupiter-8 Template
  description: Controls for TAL-J-8 synthesizer
  date: 2025-10-11
  author: Your Name
  tags: [synthesizer, jupiter-8]

midi_channel: 1

controls:
  # Row A Encoders - Filter Section
  - id: encoder_1
    name: VCF Cutoff
    type: encoder
    cc: 13
    channel: 1
    plugin_parameter: 105    # From descriptor: VCF Cutoff
    range: [0, 127]

  - id: encoder_2
    name: VCF Resonance
    type: encoder
    cc: 14
    plugin_parameter: 107    # From descriptor: VCF Resonance

  # Faders - Envelopes
  - id: slider_1
    name: Env Attack
    type: slider
    cc: 53
    plugin_parameter: 65     # From descriptor: Env Attack

  - id: slider_2
    name: Env Decay
    type: slider
    cc: 54
    plugin_parameter: 67     # From descriptor: Env Decay

  # Buttons - Toggles
  - id: button_1
    name: Filter Mode
    type: button
    cc: 41
    plugin_parameter: 112    # From descriptor: Filter Mode Toggle
\```

### Hardware Extraction (One-Click Deployment) ‚≠ê

#### Step 1: Create Custom Mode on Controller

Using Novation Components software:
1. Open Launch Control XL 3 editor
2. Create new custom mode in slot 0
3. Assign CC numbers to controls
4. **Label each control** with parameter name
5. Save to device

#### Step 2: Extract Configuration

\```bash
# List available configurations
npx controller-deploy list

# Output:
# üì± Detected: Novation Launch Control XL 3
#
# Available configurations:
#   Slot 0: Jupiter-8 Template
#   Slot 1: Minimoog Template
#   Slot 2: (empty)
#   ...
\```

#### Step 3: Deploy to DAWs

\```bash
# Deploy single DAW
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour

# Deploy multiple DAWs
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live

# With plugin context (triggers fuzzy matching)
npx controller-deploy deploy \
  --slot 0 \
  --plugin "TAL-J-8" \
  --daw ardour live \
  --install

# Save canonical map for reference
npx controller-deploy deploy \
  --slot 0 \
  --output ./my-mappings \
  --install
\```

**What happens:**
1. Reads custom mode from controller slot 0
2. Extracts control assignments and labels
3. Converts to canonical MIDI map format
4. **[Phase 2.5] AI-powered fuzzy matching** (when --plugin provided)
5. Deploys to specified DAWs
6. Optionally saves canonical YAML

### Integration Methods

#### Method 1: Claude CLI (Preferred)

\```typescript
// Shell out to claude CLI
const result = await execAsync(
  `claude --prompt "Match these control names to plugin parameters: ${JSON.stringify(controls)}" --plugin-descriptor ${descriptorPath}`
);
\```

**Requirements:**
- `claude` CLI installed and in PATH
- API key configured in environment

#### Method 2: Anthropic API (Direct)

\```typescript
import Anthropic from '@anthropic-ai/sdk';

const anthropic = new Anthropic({
  apiKey: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
});

const message = await anthropic.messages.create({
  model: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022',
  max_tokens: 1024,
  messages: [{
    role: 'user',
    content: `Match control names to plugin parameters:\n${prompt}`
  }],
});
\```

### Matching Algorithm

Claude AI analyzes:
1. **Semantic similarity**: "VCF Cutoff" matches "VCF Cutoff" (exact)
2. **Abbreviations**: "Filter Res" matches "VCF Resonance"
3. **Synonyms**: "Env Attack" matches "Attack Time"
4. **Context**: Groups related parameters (filters, envelopes, etc.)
5. **Confidence scoring**: Returns match confidence for validation

### Example Prompt

\```
You are a MIDI parameter matching expert. Match hardware control names to plugin parameters.

Hardware Controls:
- VCF Cutoff (CC 13)
- Filter Res (CC 14)
- Env Attack (CC 53)
- LFO Rate (CC 21)

Plugin Parameters (TAL-J-8):
- [105] VCF Cutoff
- [107] VCF Resonance
- [109] VCF Envelope Amount
- [65] Attack Time
- [67] Decay Time
- [89] LFO 1 Rate
- [91] LFO 1 Amount

Return JSON with matches:
{
  "matches": [
    { "control": "VCF Cutoff", "cc": 13, "parameter": 105, "confidence": 1.0 },
    { "control": "Filter Res", "cc": 14, "parameter": 107, "confidence": 0.95 },
    ...
  ]
}
\```

### Output Format

\```json
{
  "matches": [
    {
      "control_name": "VCF Cutoff",
      "control_cc": 13,
      "parameter_index": 105,
      "parameter_name": "VCF Cutoff",
      "confidence": 1.0,
      "match_type": "exact"
    },
    {
      "control_name": "Filter Res",
      "control_cc": 14,
      "parameter_index": 107,
      "parameter_name": "VCF Resonance",
      "confidence": 0.95,
      "match_type": "abbreviation"
    },
    {
      "control_name": "Env Attack",
      "control_cc": 53,
      "parameter_index": 65,
      "parameter_name": "Attack Time",
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "match_type": "synonym"
    }
  ],
  "unmatched": []
}
\```

### Troubleshooting Fuzzy Matching

#### Problem: No matches found

**Causes:**
- Plugin descriptor not found
- Control names too generic ("Knob 1", "Encoder A")
- Plugin parameters unnamed or use internal IDs

**Solutions:**
\```bash
# Verify plugin descriptor exists
ls plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json

# Use more descriptive control names in hardware
# Good: "VCF Cutoff", "Resonance", "Attack"
# Bad: "Knob1", "Enc A", "Control 1"

# Manually specify parameter indices in YAML if AI fails
\```

#### Problem: Wrong parameter matched

**Causes:**
- Ambiguous control names
- Multiple parameters with similar names
- Low confidence matches

**Solutions:**
\```bash
# Review match confidence scores
# Confidence < 0.7 may indicate ambiguous match

# Use more specific control names
# Instead of: "Cutoff" ‚Üí "VCF Cutoff"
# Instead of: "Attack" ‚Üí "Env 1 Attack"

# Override matches in canonical YAML
\```

#### Problem: Claude API errors

**Causes:**
- API key not configured
- Rate limiting
- Network issues

**Solutions:**
\```bash
# Set API key
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key

# Or use claude CLI
which claude  # Verify CLI installed
claude --version

# Check rate limits in Anthropic Console
# Retry with exponential backoff
\```

#### Problem: Slow matching performance

**Solutions:**
\```bash
# Cache matches for reuse
# Matches saved in canonical YAML

# Batch multiple controls in single API call
# Faster than individual requests

# Use local descriptor cache
# Avoid re-reading descriptor files
\```

### Ableton Live Deployment (Dual-Pipeline)

#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)

\```bash
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw live --install
\```

**What happens:**
1. Converts canonical map to plugin mapping format
2. **AI-matched parameters included in JSON**
3. Writes to `live-max-cc-router/data/plugin-mappings.json`
4. Runtime loader merges with canonical mappings
5. Max for Live device uses merged mappings

**Dual-Pipeline Architecture:**

\```

## Common Workflows

### Workflow 1: New Plugin Mapping (Manual)

\```bash
# 1. Extract plugin parameters
cd modules/canonical-midi-maps
pnpm plugin:generate-batch

# 2. Create canonical mapping (edit YAML)
vim maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/synth-category/my-plugin.yaml

# 3. Generate Ardour map
cd ../ardour-midi-maps
pnpm generate:install

# 4. Use in Ardour
# (Select in control surface preferences)
\```

### Workflow 2: One-Click Hardware Extraction with AI Matching ‚≠ê

\```bash
# 1. Create custom mode on controller (use Novation Components)
# 2. Deploy in one command with AI-powered parameter matching
npx controller-deploy deploy \
  --slot 0 \
  --plugin "TAL-J-8" \
  --daw ardour live \
  --install \
  --output ./my-mappings

# Done! Both DAWs configured from hardware with AI-matched parameters
\```

### Workflow 3: Update Existing Mapping

\```bash
# 1. Edit canonical YAML
vim maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/synth/my-plugin.yaml

# 2. Regenerate Ardour map
cd modules/ardour-midi-maps
pnpm generate:install

# 3. Live updates automatically (watches JSON file)
\```

### Workflow 4: Multi-Plugin Session

\```bash
# Deploy multiple plugins from controller slots with AI matching
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour live
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 1 --plugin "Mini V4" --daw ardour live
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 2 --plugin "Jup-8 V4" --daw ardour live

# All three plugins now mapped from hardware with AI-matched parameters
\```
