### controller-deploy deploy

Deploy controller configuration to DAW(s).

**Options:**
- `-c, --controller <type>`: Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)
- `-s, --slot <number>`: Configuration slot (default: 0)
- `-d, --daw <daws...>`: Target DAWs (default: ardour)
- `-p, --plugin <name>`: Plugin name for AI parameter matching ‚≠ê
- `-m, --midi-channel <number>`: MIDI channel override
- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory for canonical YAML
- `--install`: Auto-install to DAW config directories
- `--dry-run`: Preview without deploying

**Examples:**
\```bash
# Basic deployment
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour

# Multiple DAWs
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live

# With plugin context (enables AI matching)
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour

# Save canonical and install
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --output ./mappings --install

# Preview only
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --dry-run
\```

## Troubleshooting

### Plugin Interrogation Issues

**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
\```bash
# Skip problematic plugins by editing
modules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts

const SKIP_PATTERNS = [
  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
];
\```

**Problem:** No parameters found
- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
- Verify plugin is installed correctly
- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`

### Canonical Mapping Issues

**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated

**Problem:** YAML validation errors
- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`

### Fuzzy Matching Issues

**Problem:** AI matching fails completely
- Verify `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable set
- Check `claude` CLI is installed: `which claude`
- Ensure plugin descriptor exists and is valid
- Check control names are descriptive (not "Knob1", "EncA")

**Problem:** Low confidence matches (< 0.7)
- Use more specific control names on hardware
- Add semantic context ("VCF Cutoff" vs "Cutoff")
- Manually override in canonical YAML if needed

**Problem:** Multiple parameters matched to same control
- Review match confidence scores in output
- Use most specific parameter name on hardware
- Manually specify correct parameter in YAML

**Problem:** Rate limiting or API errors
- Batch controls in single request (default behavior)
- Add retry logic with exponential backoff
- Use cached results when available

### Deployment Issues

**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`
- Restart Ardour after installation

**Problem:** Live mapping not working
- Check `plugin-mappings.json` syntax
- Verify runtime-loader is loading file
- Check Max for Live device logs
- Ensure plugin name matches exactly

**Problem:** Controller not detected
- Check MIDI connections (Web MIDI API requires Chrome/Edge)
- Verify controller is powered on
- Try manual adapter creation (bypass auto-detection)

## Performance Tips

### Cache Plugin Descriptors

Plugin interrogation is cached for 24 hours. To force refresh:
\```bash
rm plugin-descriptors/plugins-catalog-batch.json
pnpm plugin:generate-batch
\```

### Cache AI Matches

AI matches are saved in canonical YAML for reuse:
\```bash
# First deployment: AI matching runs (~2-5 seconds)
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --output ./cache

# Subsequent deployments: Reads from cached YAML (~instant)
npx controller-deploy deploy --input ./cache/lcxl3-jupiter8.yaml --daw ardour
\```

### Batch Deployments

Deploy multiple configurations in one script:
\```bash
#!/bin/bash
for slot in {0..3}; do
  npx controller-deploy deploy --slot $slot --daw ardour live --install
done
\```

### Validate Before Deploy

Use dry-run to verify before actual deployment:
\```bash
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --dry-run
# Review output, then run without --dry-run
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --install
\```

   144‚Üí
   145‚Üí## Phase 2: Canonical Mapping
   146‚Üí
   147‚Üí### Purpose
   148‚Üí
   149‚ÜíCreate device-specific MIDI controller ‚Üí plugin parameter mappings using accurate parameter indices from Phase 1.
   150‚Üí
   151‚Üí### Two Approaches
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí#### Approach A: Manual YAML Creation (Traditional)
   154‚Üí
   155‚Üí1. Choose hardware controller (e.g., Launch Control XL 3)
   156‚Üí2. Choose target plugin (e.g., TAL-J-8)
   157‚Üí3. Reference plugin descriptor for parameter indices
   158‚Üí4. Create YAML mapping file
   159‚Üí
   160‚Üí#### Approach B: Hardware Extraction (360 Feature) ‚≠ê
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí1. Create custom mode on hardware controller
   163‚Üí2. Label controls with parameter names
   164‚Üí3. Use `controller-deploy` to extract configuration
   165‚Üí4. Automatically generate canonical mapping
   166‚Üí5. **AI-powered parameter matching** (Phase 2.5)
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí### Manual YAML Creation
   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí#### Step 1: Choose Target Combination
   171‚Üí
   172‚Üí- **Hardware:** Novation Launch Control XL 3
   173‚Üí- **Plugin:** TAL-J-8
   174‚Üí- **Descriptor:** `plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json`
   175‚Üí
   176‚Üí#### Step 2: Create YAML File
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí**Location:** `maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/roland-jupiter-8/tal-j8.yaml`
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí\```yaml
   181‚Üíversion: 1.0.0
   182‚Üí
   183‚Üídevice:
   184‚Üí  manufacturer: Novation
   185‚Üí  model: Launch Control XL 3
   186‚Üí
   187‚Üíplugin:
   188‚Üí  manufacturer: TAL Software
   189‚Üí  name: TAL-J-8
   190‚Üí  descriptor: plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json
   191‚Üí
   192‚Üímetadata:
   193‚Üí  name: Jupiter-8 Template
   194‚Üí  description: Controls for TAL-J-8 synthesizer
   195‚Üí  date: 2025-10-11
   196‚Üí  author: Your Name
   197‚Üí  tags: [synthesizer, jupiter-8]
   198‚Üí
   199‚Üímidi_channel: 1
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üícontrols:
   202‚Üí  # Row A Encoders - Filter Section
   203‚Üí  - id: encoder_1
   204‚Üí    name: VCF Cutoff
   205‚Üí    type: encoder
   206‚Üí    cc: 13
   207‚Üí    channel: 1
   208‚Üí    plugin_parameter: 105    # From descriptor: VCF Cutoff
   209‚Üí    range: [0, 127]
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí  - id: encoder_2
   212‚Üí    name: VCF Resonance
   213‚Üí    type: encoder
   214‚Üí    cc: 14
   215‚Üí    plugin_parameter: 107    # From descriptor: VCF Resonance
   216‚Üí
   217‚Üí  # Faders - Envelopes
   218‚Üí  - id: slider_1
   219‚Üí    name: Env Attack
   220‚Üí    type: slider
   221‚Üí    cc: 53
   222‚Üí    plugin_parameter: 65     # From descriptor: Env Attack
   223‚Üí
   224‚Üí  - id: slider_2
   225‚Üí    name: Env Decay
   226‚Üí    type: slider
   227‚Üí    cc: 54
   228‚Üí    plugin_parameter: 67     # From descriptor: Env Decay
   229‚Üí
   230‚Üí  # Buttons - Toggles
   231‚Üí  - id: button_1
   232‚Üí    name: Filter Mode
   233‚Üí    type: button
   234‚Üí    cc: 41
   235‚Üí    plugin_parameter: 112    # From descriptor: Filter Mode Toggle
   236‚Üí\```
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí### Hardware Extraction (One-Click Deployment) ‚≠ê
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí#### Step 1: Create Custom Mode on Controller
   241‚Üí
   242‚ÜíUsing Novation Components software:
   243‚Üí1. Open Launch Control XL 3 editor
   244‚Üí2. Create new custom mode in slot 0
   245‚Üí3. Assign CC numbers to controls
   246‚Üí4. **Label each control** with parameter name
   247‚Üí5. Save to device
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí#### Step 2: Extract Configuration
   250‚Üí
   251‚Üí\```bash
   252‚Üí# List available configurations
   253‚Üínpx controller-deploy list
   254‚Üí
   255‚Üí# Output:
   256‚Üí# üì± Detected: Novation Launch Control XL 3
   257‚Üí#
   258‚Üí# Available configurations:
   259‚Üí#   Slot 0: Jupiter-8 Template
   260‚Üí#   Slot 1: Minimoog Template
   261‚Üí#   Slot 2: (empty)
   262‚Üí#   ...
   263‚Üí\```
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí#### Step 3: Deploy to DAWs
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí\```bash
   268‚Üí# Deploy single DAW
   269‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
   270‚Üí
   271‚Üí# Deploy multiple DAWs
   272‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
   273‚Üí
   274‚Üí# With plugin context (triggers fuzzy matching)
   275‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy \
   276‚Üí  --slot 0 \
   277‚Üí  --plugin "TAL-J-8" \
   278‚Üí  --daw ardour live \
   279‚Üí  --install
   280‚Üí
   281‚Üí# Save canonical map for reference
   282‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy \
   283‚Üí  --slot 0 \
   284‚Üí  --output ./my-mappings \
   285‚Üí  --install
   286‚Üí\```
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí**What happens:**
   289‚Üí1. Reads custom mode from controller slot 0
   290‚Üí2. Extracts control assignments and labels
   291‚Üí3. Converts to canonical MIDI map format
   292‚Üí4. **[Phase 2.5] AI-powered fuzzy matching** (when --plugin provided)
   293‚Üí5. Deploys to specified DAWs
   294‚Üí6. Optionally saves canonical YAML
   295‚Üí
   296‚Üí## Phase 2.5: AI-Powered Fuzzy Parameter Matching ‚≠ê
   297‚Üí
   298‚Üí### Purpose
   299‚Üí
   300‚ÜíAutomatically match human-readable control names from hardware (e.g., "VCF Cutoff", "Env Attack") to plugin parameter indices using Claude AI.

   304‚ÜíFuzzy matching is triggered when you provide the `--plugin` flag during deployment:
   305‚Üí
   306‚Üí\```bash
   307‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
   308‚Üí\```

   394‚Üí### Integration Methods
   395‚Üí
   396‚Üí#### Method 1: Claude CLI (Preferred)
   397‚Üí
   398‚Üí\```typescript
   399‚Üí// Shell out to claude CLI
   400‚Üíconst result = await execAsync(
   401‚Üí  `claude --prompt "Match these control names to plugin parameters: ${JSON.stringify(controls)}" --plugin-descriptor ${descriptorPath}`
   402‚Üí);
   403‚Üí\```
   404‚Üí
   405‚Üí**Requirements:**
   406‚Üí- `claude` CLI installed and in PATH
   407‚Üí- API key configured in environment
   408‚Üí
   409‚Üí#### Method 2: Anthropic API (Direct)
   410‚Üí
   411‚Üí\```typescript
   412‚Üíimport Anthropic from '@anthropic-ai/sdk';
   413‚Üí
   414‚Üíconst anthropic = new Anthropic({
   415‚Üí  apiKey: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
   416‚Üí});
   417‚Üí
   418‚Üíconst message = await anthropic.messages.create({
   419‚Üí  model: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022',
   420‚Üí  max_tokens: 1024,
   421‚Üí  messages: [{
   422‚Üí    role: 'user',
   423‚Üí    content: `Match control names to plugin parameters:\n${prompt}`
   424‚Üí  }],
   425‚Üí});
   426‚Üí\```
   427‚Üí
   428‚Üí### Matching Algorithm
   429‚Üí
   430‚ÜíClaude AI analyzes:
   431‚Üí1. **Semantic similarity**: "VCF Cutoff" matches "VCF Cutoff" (exact)
   432‚Üí2. **Abbreviations**: "Filter Res" matches "VCF Resonance"
   433‚Üí3. **Synonyms**: "Env Attack" matches "Attack Time"
   434‚Üí4. **Context**: Groups related parameters (filters, envelopes, etc.)
   435‚Üí5. **Confidence scoring**: Returns match confidence for validation
   436‚Üí
   437‚Üí### Example Prompt
   438‚Üí
   439‚Üí\```
   440‚ÜíYou are a MIDI parameter matching expert. Match hardware control names to plugin parameters.
   441‚Üí
   442‚ÜíHardware Controls:
   443‚Üí- VCF Cutoff (CC 13)
   444‚Üí- Filter Res (CC 14)
   445‚Üí- Env Attack (CC 53)
   446‚Üí- LFO Rate (CC 21)
   447‚Üí
   448‚ÜíPlugin Parameters (TAL-J-8):
   449‚Üí- [105] VCF Cutoff
   450‚Üí- [107] VCF Resonance
   451‚Üí- [109] VCF Envelope Amount
   452‚Üí- [65] Attack Time
   453‚Üí- [67] Decay Time
   454‚Üí- [89] LFO 1 Rate
   455‚Üí- [91] LFO 1 Amount
   456‚Üí
   457‚ÜíReturn JSON with matches:
   458‚Üí{
   459‚Üí  "matches": [
   460‚Üí    { "control": "VCF Cutoff", "cc": 13, "parameter": 105, "confidence": 1.0 },
   461‚Üí    { "control": "Filter Res", "cc": 14, "parameter": 107, "confidence": 0.95 },
   462‚Üí    ...
   463‚Üí  ]
   464‚Üí}
   465‚Üí\```
   466‚Üí

   468‚Üí

   471‚Üí  "matches": [

   501‚Üí### Troubleshooting Fuzzy Matching
   502‚Üí
   503‚Üí#### Problem: No matches found
   504‚Üí
   505‚Üí**Causes:**
   506‚Üí- Plugin descriptor not found
   507‚Üí- Control names too generic ("Knob 1", "Encoder A")
   508‚Üí- Plugin parameters unnamed or use internal IDs
   509‚Üí
   510‚Üí**Solutions:**
   511‚Üí\```bash
   512‚Üí# Verify plugin descriptor exists
   513‚Üíls plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json
   514‚Üí
   515‚Üí# Use more descriptive control names in hardware
   516‚Üí# Good: "VCF Cutoff", "Resonance", "Attack"
   517‚Üí# Bad: "Knob1", "Enc A", "Control 1"
   518‚Üí
   519‚Üí# Manually specify parameter indices in YAML if AI fails
   520‚Üí\```
   521‚Üí
   522‚Üí#### Problem: Wrong parameter matched
   523‚Üí
   524‚Üí**Causes:**
   525‚Üí- Ambiguous control names
   526‚Üí- Multiple parameters with similar names
   527‚Üí- Low confidence matches
   528‚Üí
   529‚Üí**Solutions:**
   530‚Üí\```bash
   531‚Üí# Review match confidence scores
   532‚Üí# Confidence < 0.7 may indicate ambiguous match
   533‚Üí
   534‚Üí# Use more specific control names
   535‚Üí# Instead of: "Cutoff" ‚Üí "VCF Cutoff"
   536‚Üí# Instead of: "Attack" ‚Üí "Env 1 Attack"
   537‚Üí
   538‚Üí# Override matches in canonical YAML
   539‚Üí\```
   540‚Üí
   541‚Üí#### Problem: Claude API errors

   543‚Üí**Causes:**

   546‚Üí- Network issues

   553‚Üí# Or use claude CLI

   555‚Üíclaude --version
   556‚Üí
   557‚Üí# Check rate limits in Anthropic Console
   558‚Üí# Retry with exponential backoff
   559‚Üí\```
   560‚Üí
   561‚Üí#### Problem: Slow matching performance
   562‚Üí
   563‚Üí**Solutions:**
   564‚Üí\```bash
   565‚Üí# Cache matches for reuse
   566‚Üí# Matches saved in canonical YAML
   567‚Üí
   568‚Üí# Batch multiple controls in single API call
   569‚Üí# Faster than individual requests
   570‚Üí
   571‚Üí# Use local descriptor cache

   573‚Üí\```

   575‚Üí## Phase 3: DAW Deployment
   576‚Üí
   577‚Üí### Purpose
   578‚Üí
   579‚ÜíConvert canonical mappings into DAW-specific formats and install to appropriate directories.
   580‚Üí
   581‚Üí### Supported DAWs
   582‚Üí
   583‚Üí| DAW | Format | Deployer | Status |
   584‚Üí|-----|--------|----------|--------|
   585‚Üí| Ardour | XML | ArdourDeployer | ‚úÖ Complete |
   586‚Üí| Ableton Live | JSON/M4L | LiveDeployer | ‚úÖ Complete (Tier 2) |
   587‚Üí| Reaper | ReaControlMIDI | (Future) | üìã Planned |
   588‚Üí| Bitwig | Controller Scripts | (Future) | üìã Planned |

   590‚Üí### Ardour Deployment

   593‚Üí

   597‚Üí

   640‚Üí### Ableton Live Deployment (Dual-Pipeline)
   641‚Üí
   642‚Üí#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)
   643‚Üí
   644‚Üí\```bash
   645‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw live --install
   646‚Üí\```
   647‚Üí
   648‚Üí**What happens:**
   649‚Üí1. Converts canonical map to plugin mapping format
   650‚Üí2. **AI-matched parameters included in JSON**
   651‚Üí3. Writes to `live-max-cc-router/data/plugin-mappings.json`
   652‚Üí4. Runtime loader merges with canonical mappings
   653‚Üí5. Max for Live device uses merged mappings
   654‚Üí
   655‚Üí**Dual-Pipeline Architecture:**
   656‚Üí
   657‚Üí\```
   658‚ÜíTier 1: Canonical (Build-time)         Tier 2: Runtime (Device-extracted)
   659‚Üí‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ            ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
   660‚ÜíSource: YAML files                      Source: Controller slot
   661‚ÜíBuild:  convert-canonical-maps.cjs     Extract: controller-deploy
   662‚ÜíOutput: canonical-plugin-maps.ts        Output: plugin-mappings.json
   663‚Üí                                                (with AI-matched params)
   664‚Üí
   665‚Üí                    Runtime Merge
   666‚Üí                    { ...canonical, ...runtime }
   667‚Üí\```
   668‚Üí
   669‚ÜíSee [live-deployer/architecture.md](./live-deployer/architecture.md) for details.

   795‚Üí### controller-deploy deploy
   796‚Üí
   797‚ÜíDeploy controller configuration to DAW(s).
   798‚Üí
   799‚Üí**Options:**
   800‚Üí- `-c, --controller <type>`: Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)
   801‚Üí- `-s, --slot <number>`: Configuration slot (default: 0)
   802‚Üí- `-d, --daw <daws...>`: Target DAWs (default: ardour)
   803‚Üí- `-p, --plugin <name>`: Plugin name for AI parameter matching ‚≠ê
   804‚Üí- `-m, --midi-channel <number>`: MIDI channel override
   805‚Üí- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory for canonical YAML
   806‚Üí- `--install`: Auto-install to DAW config directories
   807‚Üí- `--dry-run`: Preview without deploying
   808‚Üí
   809‚Üí**Examples:**
   810‚Üí\```bash
   811‚Üí# Basic deployment
   812‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
   813‚Üí
   814‚Üí# Multiple DAWs
   815‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
   816‚Üí
   817‚Üí# With plugin context (enables AI matching)
   818‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
   819‚Üí
   820‚Üí# Save canonical and install
   821‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --output ./mappings --install
   822‚Üí
   823‚Üí# Preview only
   824‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --dry-run
   825‚Üí\```

   827‚Üí## Troubleshooting
   828‚Üí
   829‚Üí### Plugin Interrogation Issues
   830‚Üí
   831‚Üí**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
   832‚Üí\```bash
   833‚Üí# Skip problematic plugins by editing
   834‚Üímodules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts
   835‚Üí
   836‚Üíconst SKIP_PATTERNS = [
   837‚Üí  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
   838‚Üí  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
   839‚Üí  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
   840‚Üí];
   841‚Üí\```
   842‚Üí
   843‚Üí**Problem:** No parameters found
   844‚Üí- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
   845‚Üí- Verify plugin is installed correctly
   846‚Üí- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`
   847‚Üí
   848‚Üí### Canonical Mapping Issues
   849‚Üí
   850‚Üí**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
   851‚Üí- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
   852‚Üí- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
   853‚Üí- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated
   854‚Üí
   855‚Üí**Problem:** YAML validation errors
   856‚Üí- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
   857‚Üí- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
   858‚Üí- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`
   859‚Üí
   860‚Üí### Fuzzy Matching Issues
   861‚Üí
   862‚Üí**Problem:** AI matching fails completely
   863‚Üí- Verify `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable set
   864‚Üí- Check `claude` CLI is installed: `which claude`
   865‚Üí- Ensure plugin descriptor exists and is valid
   866‚Üí- Check control names are descriptive (not "Knob1", "EncA")
   867‚Üí
   868‚Üí**Problem:** Low confidence matches (< 0.7)
   869‚Üí- Use more specific control names on hardware
   870‚Üí- Add semantic context ("VCF Cutoff" vs "Cutoff")
   871‚Üí- Manually override in canonical YAML if needed
   872‚Üí
   873‚Üí**Problem:** Multiple parameters matched to same control
   874‚Üí- Review match confidence scores in output
   875‚Üí- Use most specific parameter name on hardware
   876‚Üí- Manually specify correct parameter in YAML
   877‚Üí
   878‚Üí**Problem:** Rate limiting or API errors
   879‚Üí- Batch controls in single request (default behavior)
   880‚Üí- Add retry logic with exponential backoff
   881‚Üí- Use cached results when available
   882‚Üí
   883‚Üí### Deployment Issues
   884‚Üí
   885‚Üí**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
   886‚Üí- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
   887‚Üí- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`
   888‚Üí- Restart Ardour after installation
   889‚Üí
   890‚Üí**Problem:** Live mapping not working
   891‚Üí- Check `plugin-mappings.json` syntax
   892‚Üí- Verify runtime-loader is loading file
   893‚Üí- Check Max for Live device logs
   894‚Üí- Ensure plugin name matches exactly
   895‚Üí
   896‚Üí**Problem:** Controller not detected
   897‚Üí- Check MIDI connections (Web MIDI API requires Chrome/Edge)
   898‚Üí- Verify controller is powered on
   899‚Üí- Try manual adapter creation (bypass auto-detection)
   900‚Üí
   901‚Üí## Performance Tips
   902‚Üí
   903‚Üí### Cache Plugin Descriptors
   904‚Üí
   905‚ÜíPlugin interrogation is cached for 24 hours. To force refresh:
   906‚Üí\```bash
   907‚Üírm plugin-descriptors/plugins-catalog-batch.json
   908‚Üípnpm plugin:generate-batch
   909‚Üí\```
   910‚Üí
   911‚Üí### Cache AI Matches
   912‚Üí
   913‚ÜíAI matches are saved in canonical YAML for reuse:
   914‚Üí\```bash
   915‚Üí# First deployment: AI matching runs (~2-5 seconds)
   916‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --output ./cache
   917‚Üí
   918‚Üí# Subsequent deployments: Reads from cached YAML (~instant)
   919‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --input ./cache/lcxl3-jupiter8.yaml --daw ardour
   920‚Üí\```
   921‚Üí
   922‚Üí### Batch Deployments
   923‚Üí
   924‚ÜíDeploy multiple configurations in one script:
   925‚Üí\```bash
   926‚Üí#!/bin/bash
   927‚Üífor slot in {0..3}; do
   928‚Üí  npx controller-deploy deploy --slot $slot --daw ardour live --install
   929‚Üídone
   930‚Üí\```
   931‚Üí
   932‚Üí### Validate Before Deploy
   933‚Üí
   934‚ÜíUse dry-run to verify before actual deployment:
   935‚Üí\```bash
   936‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --dry-run
   937‚Üí# Review output, then run without --dry-run
   938‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --install
   939‚Üí\```

# Feature 360 Architecture

**Version:** 1.21
**Status:** In Progress
**Last Updated:** 2025-10-12

## Overview

The 360 feature implements a modular, extensible architecture for deploying MIDI controller configurations to multiple DAWs. The design follows interface-first principles with clear separation of concerns across four main layers:

1. **Controller Abstraction Layer** - Hardware interrogation and configuration extraction
2. **Canonical Conversion Layer** - Format translation to universal MIDI mappings
3. **Parameter Matching Layer** - AI-powered fuzzy matching of control names to plugin parameters
4. **DAW Deployment Layer** - Platform-specific map generation and installation

## System Architecture

## Core Components

### 1. Controller-Workflow Module

**Purpose:** Generic framework for controller ‚Üí DAW deployment

**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/`

**Key Abstractions:**

\```typescript
// Controller interrogation interface
interface ControllerAdapterInterface {
  connect(): Promise<void>;
  listConfigurations(): Promise<ConfigurationSlot[]>;
  readConfiguration(slot: number): Promise<ControllerConfiguration>;
}

// Canonical conversion interface
interface CanonicalConverterInterface {
  convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap;
  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean;
}

// Parameter matching interface (NEW)
interface ParameterMatcherInterface {
  matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor
  ): Promise<ParameterMatch[]>;
  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;
}

// DAW deployment interface
interface DAWDeployerInterface {
  deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult>;
  isInstalled(): Promise<boolean>;
}
\```

**Design Principles:**
- **Interface-first:** All adapters implement well-defined interfaces
- **Dependency injection:** Components accept dependencies via constructor
- **Factory pattern:** Auto-detection and instantiation via factories
- **Event-driven:** Progress reporting via EventEmitter
- **AI-augmented:** Optional Claude AI integration for parameter matching

See [implementation/workplan.md](./implementation/workplan.md) for detailed design.

### 2. Launch Control XL3 Adapter

**Purpose:** Reference implementation for Novation Launch Control XL 3

**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.ts`

**Capabilities:**
- Read all 16 custom mode slots
- Extract control configurations (48 controls: 24 encoders, 8 sliders, 16 buttons)
- Map LCXL3-specific IDs (SEND_A1, FADER1, etc.) to generic control types
- Wrapper around existing launch-control-xl3 library

**Control Mapping:**
\```
LCXL3 ID     ‚Üí Generic ID    ‚Üí MIDI CC
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
SEND_A1      ‚Üí encoder_1     ‚Üí CC 13
SEND_A2      ‚Üí encoder_2     ‚Üí CC 14
...
FADER1       ‚Üí slider_1      ‚Üí CC 53
FADER2       ‚Üí slider_2      ‚Üí CC 54
...
FOCUS1       ‚Üí button_1      ‚Üí CC 41

### 3. Canonical MIDI Maps

**Purpose:** Universal MIDI mapping format (DAW-agnostic)

**Location:** `modules/canonical-midi-maps/`

**Format:** YAML

**Structure:**
\```yaml
version: 1.0.0

device:
  manufacturer: Novation
  model: Launch Control XL 3

plugin:
  manufacturer: TAL Software
  name: TAL-J-8
  descriptor: plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json

metadata:
  name: Jupiter-8 Template
  description: Controls for TAL-J-8 synth
  date: 2025-10-12
  aiMatchingEnabled: true  # NEW: Indicates fuzzy matching was used

midi_channel: 1  # Global MIDI channel

controls:
  - id: encoder_1
    name: VCF Cutoff
    type: encoder
    cc: 13
    channel: 1
    plugin_parameter: 105      # Added by AI matcher
    match_confidence: 1.0       # NEW: Match quality
    range: [0, 127]
\```

**Key Features:**
- **Real parameter indices:** Uses plugin descriptors for accurate mappings
- **Hardware abstraction:** Generic control IDs work across devices
- **Plugin awareness:** Links to plugin descriptors for validation
- **Metadata rich:** Version tracking, tags, creation dates
- **AI-enhanced:** Optional fuzzy matching with confidence scores

See [project ARCHITECTURE.md](../../ARCHITECTURE.md) for component relationships.

**Key Capabilities:**

1. **Semantic Matching**
   - Exact matches: "VCF Cutoff" ‚Üí "VCF Cutoff"
   - Abbreviations: "Filter Res" ‚Üí "VCF Resonance"
   - Synonyms: "Env Attack" ‚Üí "Attack Time"
   - Context-aware: Groups related parameters

2. **Integration Methods**
   - **Method 1:** Shell out to `claude` CLI
   - **Method 2:** Direct Anthropic API calls
   - **Method 3:** Cached results from previous matches

3. **Confidence Scoring**
   - 1.0: Exact string match
   - 0.9-0.99: High confidence (clear synonym)
   - 0.7-0.89: Medium confidence (abbreviation/context)
   - < 0.7: Low confidence (ambiguous match)

4. **Error Handling**
   - Graceful degradation if AI unavailable
   - Retry logic with exponential backoff
   - Cache results for performance
   - Manual override support

**Interface:**

\```typescript
interface ParameterMatcherInterface {
  /**
   * Match control names to plugin parameters using AI
   */
  matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options?: MatchOptions
  ): Promise<ParameterMatch[]>;

  /**
   * Get match confidence score (0-1)
   */
  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;

  /**
   * Check if matcher is available (API key configured)
   */
  isAvailable(): Promise<boolean>;
}

interface ParameterMatch {
  controlName: string;
  controlCC: number;
  parameterIndex: number;
  parameterName: string;
  confidence: number;
  matchType: 'exact' | 'abbreviation' | 'synonym' | 'context';
}

interface MatchOptions {
  confidenceThreshold?: number;  // Default: 0.7
  enableCaching?: boolean;        // Default: true
  model?: string;                 // Default: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022'
}
\```

**Example Usage:**

\```typescript
import { ParameterMatcher } from '@/services/ParameterMatcher';

const matcher = new ParameterMatcher({
  apiKey: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
  useCLI: true  // Prefer CLI if available
});

// Load plugin descriptor
const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');

// Extract control names from hardware
const controlNames = ['VCF Cutoff', 'Filter Res', 'Env Attack'];

// Match parameters
const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);

// Apply matches to canonical map
for (const match of matches) {
  const control = canonicalMap.controls.find(c => c.name === match.controlName);
  if (control && match.confidence >= 0.7) {
    control.plugin_parameter = match.parameterIndex;
    control.match_confidence = match.confidence;
  }
}
\```

**Performance:**
- Single API call batches all controls
- Results cached in canonical YAML
- Typical matching time: 2-5 seconds
- Subsequent deployments: instant (uses cache)

**Dependencies:**
- `@anthropic-ai/sdk` (API method)
- `claude` CLI (optional, preferred method)
- Plugin descriptor files (from Phase 1)

**Output Format:** Ardour XML (with AI-matched parameters)
\```xml
<ArdourMIDIBindings version="1.0.0" name="LCXL3 - TAL-J-8">
  <DeviceInfo bank-size="8"/>

  <Binding channel="1" ctl="13" function="plugin-parameter"
           uri="TAL-J-8/param/105"/>  <!-- VCF Cutoff (confidence: 1.0) -->
  <Binding channel="1" ctl="53" function="plugin-parameter"
           uri="TAL-J-8/param/65"/>   <!-- Attack (confidence: 0.9) -->

### Workflow Orchestration (with AI Matching)

\```typescript
// Automated workflow via DeploymentWorkflow
const workflow = await DeploymentWorkflow.create({
  targets: ['ardour', 'live'],
  enableAIMatching: true  // NEW: Enable fuzzy parameter matching
});

const result = await workflow.execute({
  configSlot: 0,                    // Hardware slot
  targets: ['ardour', 'live'],      // Multiple DAWs
  pluginInfo: { name: 'TAL-J-8' },  // Triggers AI matching
  midiChannel: 1,
  preserveLabels: true,
  autoInstall: true
});

// Result contains:
// - controllerConfig: ControllerConfiguration
// - canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap (with AI-matched parameters)
// - parameterMatches: ParameterMatch[] (NEW: Match details)
// - deployments: DeploymentResult[]
// - errors: string[]
\```

## Extensibility

### Adding a New Controller

1. **Implement ControllerAdapter:**
   \```typescript
   export class NewControllerAdapter implements ControllerAdapterInterface {
     // Implement all interface methods
   }
   \```

2. **Implement CanonicalConverter:**
   \```typescript
   export class NewControllerConverter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
     convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap {
       // Device-specific ‚Üí canonical mapping
     }
   }
   \```

3. **Register in Workflow:**
   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.detectController()`
   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.getConverterFor()`

**No changes required:** Orchestrator, CLI, DAW deployers, and AI matcher all work generically.

### Adding a New DAW

1. **Implement DAWDeployer:**
   \```typescript
   export class NewDAWDeployer implements DAWDeployerInterface {
     async deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult> {
       // Generate DAW-specific format
       // AI-matched plugin_parameter fields available in canonicalMap
     }
   }
   \```

2. **Register in Workflow:**
   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.create()` to include new deployer

**No changes required:** Controller adapters, converters, orchestrator, and AI matcher all work generically.

## Design Patterns

### Interface-First Design

All major components define interfaces before implementation:
- Enables testing with mocks
- Clear contracts between layers
- Easier to extend and maintain
- AI matcher is optional dependency

### Dependency Injection

\```typescript
export class DeploymentWorkflow {
  constructor(
    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
    private parameterMatcher: ParameterMatcherInterface,  // NEW
    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
  ) {}
}
\```

Benefits:
- Testable (inject mocks)
- Flexible (swap implementations)
- Follows project guidelines
- AI matcher can be replaced or disabled

### Factory Pattern

\```typescript
static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
  const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
  const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
  const matcher = options.enableAIMatching
    ? new ParameterMatcher()
    : new NoOpMatcher();  // Graceful degradation
  const deployers = new Map();
  // ...
  return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, matcher, deployers);
}
\```

Benefits:
- Auto-detection of hardware
- Simplified instantiation
- Encapsulates complexity
- Optional AI matching

### Event-Driven Progress

\```typescript
workflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
  console.log(`[${step}/4] ${message}`);  // Updated for AI matching step
});

workflow.on('ai-matching', ({ controlCount, duration }) => {
  console.log(`AI matched ${controlCount} parameters in ${duration}ms`);
});

workflow.on('canonical-saved', ({ path }) => {
  console.log(`Saved: ${path}`);
});
\```

Benefits:
- Real-time feedback
- Decoupled UI/logging
- Extensible event system
- AI matching progress visibility

## Performance Considerations

### Target Metrics

| Operation | Target | Current Status |
|-----------|--------|----------------|
| Controller read | <2s | ‚úÖ Sub-second |
| Canonical conversion | <100ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
| AI parameter matching | <5s | ‚è≥ In progress |
| Ardour XML generation | <50ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
| Live JSON write | <20ms | ‚úÖ Instant |
| End-to-end workflow | <10s | ‚è≥ Not measured (~6s with AI) |

### Optimization Strategies

- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
- **AI result caching:** Matched parameters saved in canonical YAML
- **Batch matching:** All controls matched in single API call
- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks
- **Graceful degradation:** Falls back to generic mappings if AI unavailable

## Security Considerations

- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
- **API keys:** Secure storage and environment variable handling
- **Command injection:** No shell command execution except trusted `claude` CLI
- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options
- **AI prompts:** Input validation to prevent prompt injection
- **Rate limiting:** Respects Anthropic API rate limits

   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí**Key Capabilities:**
   241‚Üí
   242‚Üí1. **Semantic Matching**
   243‚Üí   - Exact matches: "VCF Cutoff" ‚Üí "VCF Cutoff"
   244‚Üí   - Abbreviations: "Filter Res" ‚Üí "VCF Resonance"
   245‚Üí   - Synonyms: "Env Attack" ‚Üí "Attack Time"
   246‚Üí   - Context-aware: Groups related parameters
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí2. **Integration Methods**
   249‚Üí   - **Method 1:** Shell out to `claude` CLI
   250‚Üí   - **Method 2:** Direct Anthropic API calls
   251‚Üí   - **Method 3:** Cached results from previous matches
   252‚Üí
   253‚Üí3. **Confidence Scoring**
   254‚Üí   - 1.0: Exact string match
   255‚Üí   - 0.9-0.99: High confidence (clear synonym)
   256‚Üí   - 0.7-0.89: Medium confidence (abbreviation/context)
   257‚Üí   - < 0.7: Low confidence (ambiguous match)
   258‚Üí
   259‚Üí4. **Error Handling**
   260‚Üí   - Graceful degradation if AI unavailable
   261‚Üí   - Retry logic with exponential backoff
   262‚Üí   - Cache results for performance
   263‚Üí   - Manual override support
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí**Interface:**
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí\```typescript
   268‚Üíinterface ParameterMatcherInterface {
   269‚Üí  /**
   270‚Üí   * Match control names to plugin parameters using AI
   271‚Üí   */
   272‚Üí  matchParameters(
   273‚Üí    controlNames: string[],
   274‚Üí    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
   275‚Üí    options?: MatchOptions
   276‚Üí  ): Promise<ParameterMatch[]>;
   277‚Üí
   278‚Üí  /**
   279‚Üí   * Get match confidence score (0-1)
   280‚Üí   */
   281‚Üí  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;
   282‚Üí
   283‚Üí  /**
   284‚Üí   * Check if matcher is available (API key configured)
   285‚Üí   */
   286‚Üí  isAvailable(): Promise<boolean>;
   287‚Üí}
   288‚Üí
   289‚Üíinterface ParameterMatch {
   290‚Üí  controlName: string;
   291‚Üí  controlCC: number;
   292‚Üí  parameterIndex: number;
   293‚Üí  parameterName: string;
   294‚Üí  confidence: number;
   295‚Üí  matchType: 'exact' | 'abbreviation' | 'synonym' | 'context';
   296‚Üí}
   297‚Üí
   298‚Üíinterface MatchOptions {
   299‚Üí  confidenceThreshold?: number;  // Default: 0.7
   300‚Üí  enableCaching?: boolean;        // Default: true
   301‚Üí  model?: string;                 // Default: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022'
   302‚Üí}
   303‚Üí\```
   304‚Üí
   305‚Üí**Example Usage:**
   306‚Üí
   307‚Üí\```typescript
   308‚Üíimport { ParameterMatcher } from '@/services/ParameterMatcher';
   309‚Üí
   310‚Üíconst matcher = new ParameterMatcher({
   311‚Üí  apiKey: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
   312‚Üí  useCLI: true  // Prefer CLI if available
   313‚Üí});
   314‚Üí
   315‚Üí// Load plugin descriptor
   316‚Üíconst descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');
   317‚Üí
   318‚Üí// Extract control names from hardware
   319‚Üíconst controlNames = ['VCF Cutoff', 'Filter Res', 'Env Attack'];
   320‚Üí
   321‚Üí// Match parameters
   322‚Üíconst matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
   323‚Üí
   324‚Üí// Apply matches to canonical map
   325‚Üífor (const match of matches) {
   326‚Üí  const control = canonicalMap.controls.find(c => c.name === match.controlName);
   327‚Üí  if (control && match.confidence >= 0.7) {
   328‚Üí    control.plugin_parameter = match.parameterIndex;
   329‚Üí    control.match_confidence = match.confidence;
   330‚Üí  }
   331‚Üí}
   332‚Üí\```
   333‚Üí
   334‚Üí**Performance:**
   335‚Üí- Single API call batches all controls
   336‚Üí- Results cached in canonical YAML
   337‚Üí- Typical matching time: 2-5 seconds
   338‚Üí- Subsequent deployments: instant (uses cache)
   339‚Üí
   340‚Üí**Dependencies:**
   341‚Üí- `@anthropic-ai/sdk` (API method)
   342‚Üí- `claude` CLI (optional, preferred method)
   343‚Üí- Plugin descriptor files (from Phase 1)

   374‚Üí### 5. Live Deployer (Dual-Pipeline Architecture)

   551‚Üí## Design Patterns
   552‚Üí
   553‚Üí### Interface-First Design
   554‚Üí
   555‚ÜíAll major components define interfaces before implementation:
   556‚Üí- Enables testing with mocks
   557‚Üí- Clear contracts between layers
   558‚Üí- Easier to extend and maintain
   559‚Üí- AI matcher is optional dependency
   560‚Üí
   561‚Üí### Dependency Injection
   562‚Üí
   563‚Üí\```typescript
   564‚Üíexport class DeploymentWorkflow {
   565‚Üí  constructor(
   566‚Üí    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
   567‚Üí    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
   568‚Üí    private parameterMatcher: ParameterMatcherInterface,  // NEW
   569‚Üí    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
   570‚Üí  ) {}
   571‚Üí}
   572‚Üí\```
   573‚Üí
   574‚ÜíBenefits:
   575‚Üí- Testable (inject mocks)
   576‚Üí- Flexible (swap implementations)
   577‚Üí- Follows project guidelines
   578‚Üí- AI matcher can be replaced or disabled
   579‚Üí
   580‚Üí### Factory Pattern
   581‚Üí
   582‚Üí\```typescript
   583‚Üístatic async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
   584‚Üí  const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
   585‚Üí  const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
   586‚Üí  const matcher = options.enableAIMatching
   587‚Üí    ? new ParameterMatcher()
   588‚Üí    : new NoOpMatcher();  // Graceful degradation
   589‚Üí  const deployers = new Map();
   590‚Üí  // ...
   591‚Üí  return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, matcher, deployers);
   592‚Üí}
   593‚Üí\```
   594‚Üí
   595‚ÜíBenefits:
   596‚Üí- Auto-detection of hardware
   597‚Üí- Simplified instantiation
   598‚Üí- Encapsulates complexity
   599‚Üí- Optional AI matching
   600‚Üí
   601‚Üí### Event-Driven Progress
   602‚Üí
   603‚Üí\```typescript
   604‚Üíworkflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
   605‚Üí  console.log(`[${step}/4] ${message}`);  // Updated for AI matching step
   606‚Üí});
   607‚Üí
   608‚Üíworkflow.on('ai-matching', ({ controlCount, duration }) => {
   609‚Üí  console.log(`AI matched ${controlCount} parameters in ${duration}ms`);
   610‚Üí});
   611‚Üí
   612‚Üíworkflow.on('canonical-saved', ({ path }) => {
   613‚Üí  console.log(`Saved: ${path}`);
   614‚Üí});
   615‚Üí\```
   616‚Üí
   617‚ÜíBenefits:
   618‚Üí- Real-time feedback
   619‚Üí- Decoupled UI/logging
   620‚Üí- Extensible event system
   621‚Üí- AI matching progress visibility
   622‚Üí
   623‚Üí## Performance Considerations
   624‚Üí
   625‚Üí### Target Metrics
   626‚Üí
   627‚Üí| Operation | Target | Current Status |
   628‚Üí|-----------|--------|----------------|
   629‚Üí| Controller read | <2s | ‚úÖ Sub-second |
   630‚Üí| Canonical conversion | <100ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
   631‚Üí| AI parameter matching | <5s | ‚è≥ In progress |
   632‚Üí| Ardour XML generation | <50ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
   633‚Üí| Live JSON write | <20ms | ‚úÖ Instant |
   634‚Üí| End-to-end workflow | <10s | ‚è≥ Not measured (~6s with AI) |
   635‚Üí
   636‚Üí### Optimization Strategies
   637‚Üí
   638‚Üí- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
   639‚Üí- **AI result caching:** Matched parameters saved in canonical YAML
   640‚Üí- **Batch matching:** All controls matched in single API call
   641‚Üí- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
   642‚Üí- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
   643‚Üí- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks
   644‚Üí- **Graceful degradation:** Falls back to generic mappings if AI unavailable
   645‚Üí
   646‚Üí## Security Considerations
   647‚Üí
   648‚Üí- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
   649‚Üí- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
   650‚Üí- **API keys:** Secure storage and environment variable handling
   651‚Üí- **Command injection:** No shell command execution except trusted `claude` CLI
   652‚Üí- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options
   653‚Üí- **AI prompts:** Input validation to prevent prompt injection
   654‚Üí- **Rate limiting:** Respects Anthropic API rate limits

/**
 * Parameter Matcher Service
 *
 * Uses Claude AI to perform fuzzy matching between hardware control names
 * and plugin parameter names, enabling intelligent auto-mapping of controllers
 * to plugin parameters.
 *

import * as fs from 'fs/promises';
import * as path from 'path';
import { spawn } from 'child_process';
import type { PluginDescriptor, PluginParameter } from '@oletizi/canonical-midi-maps';

/**
 * Result of a parameter matching operation.
 * Contains the matched parameter index, confidence score, and reasoning.
 */
export interface ParameterMatchResult {
  /** Original control name from hardware controller */
  controlName: string;

  /** Matched plugin parameter index (undefined if no match) */
  pluginParameter?: number;

  /** Match confidence score from 0 to 1 */
  confidence: number;

  /** Name of the matched parameter */
  parameterName?: string;

  /** AI reasoning for the match decision */
  reasoning?: string;
}

/**
 * Options for parameter matching behavior.
 */
export interface MatchOptions {
  /** Minimum confidence threshold (0-1). Matches below this are discarded. */
  minConfidence?: number;

  /** Whether to preserve original control names in output */
  preserveControlNames?: boolean;

  /** Custom system prompt to guide matching behavior */
  customPrompt?: string;

  /** Timeout for AI request in milliseconds */
  timeout?: number;
}

/**
 * Interface for parameter matching implementations.
 * Allows for different matching strategies (AI-based, rule-based, etc.)
 */
export interface ParameterMatcherInterface {
  /**
   * Match hardware control names to plugin parameters.
   *
   * @param controlNames - List of hardware control names to match
   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor with parameter information
   * @param options - Optional matching configuration
   * @returns Promise resolving to array of match results
   */
  matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options?: MatchOptions
  ): Promise<ParameterMatchResult[]>;
}

/**
 * Claude AI-based parameter matcher implementation.
 *
 * Uses Claude to intelligently match hardware control names to plugin parameters
 * based on semantic similarity, common naming patterns, and domain knowledge.
 *
 * Supports both Anthropic API (via ANTHROPIC_API_KEY) and Claude CLI.
 */
export class ParameterMatcher implements ParameterMatcherInterface {
  private readonly minConfidence: number;
  private readonly timeout: number;

  /**
   * Create a new ParameterMatcher instance.
   *
   * @param options - Configuration options
   */
  constructor(options: { minConfidence?: number; timeout?: number } = {}) {
    this.minConfidence = options.minConfidence ?? 0.5;
    this.timeout = options.timeout ?? 30000; // 30 second default
  }

  /**
   * Factory method to create a ParameterMatcher instance.
   *
   * @param options - Configuration options
   * @returns New ParameterMatcher instance
   */
  static create(options?: { minConfidence?: number; timeout?: number }): ParameterMatcher {
    return new ParameterMatcher(options);
  }

  /**
   * Match hardware control names to plugin parameters using Claude AI.
   *
   * Constructs a prompt containing control names and plugin parameters,
   * sends it to Claude, and parses the structured response.
   *
   * @param controlNames - Hardware control names to match
   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor with parameters
   * @param options - Optional matching configuration
   * @returns Promise resolving to match results
   * @throws Error if Claude API/CLI is unavailable
   * @throws Error if response parsing fails
   */
  async matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options: MatchOptions = {}
  ): Promise<ParameterMatchResult[]> {
    const minConfidence = options.minConfidence ?? this.minConfidence;

    // Build the matching prompt
    const prompt = this.buildMatchingPrompt(controlNames, pluginDescriptor, options);

    // Call Claude (API or CLI)
    const response = await this.callClaude(prompt);

    // Parse Claude's response
    const results = this.parseClaudeResponse(response, controlNames, pluginDescriptor);

    // Filter by confidence threshold
    return results.map((result): ParameterMatchResult => {
      if (result.confidence < minConfidence) {
        return {
          controlName: result.controlName,
          confidence: result.confidence,
          reasoning: result.reasoning ?? undefined,
        };
      }
      return result;
    });
  }

  /**
   * Build the matching prompt for Claude.
   *
   * Creates a structured prompt that guides Claude to match control names
   * to plugin parameters with confidence scores and reasoning.
   *
   * @param controlNames - Control names to match
   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor
   * @param options - Optional configuration
   * @returns Formatted prompt string
   */
  private buildMatchingPrompt(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options: MatchOptions
  ): string {
    const systemPrompt =
      options.customPrompt ||
      `You are an expert at mapping MIDI controller controls to audio plugin parameters.
Your task is to match hardware control names to plugin parameter names based on semantic similarity,
common audio engineering naming conventions, and logical groupings.

For each control name, provide:
1. The best matching plugin parameter index (or null if no good match)
2. A confidence score from 0.0 to 1.0
3. Brief reasoning for your choice

Consider:
- Semantic similarity (e.g., "Filter Cutoff" matches "Cutoff", "LP Freq", "Filter Frequency")
- Common abbreviations (e.g., "Res" for "Resonance", "Env" for "Envelope")
- Logical groupings (e.g., oscillator controls, filter controls, envelope controls)
- Parameter groups and categories in the plugin
- Audio engineering domain knowledge

Respond with a JSON array of objects with this structure:
[
  {
    "controlName": "string",
    "parameterIndex": number | null,
    "parameterName": "string" | null,
    "confidence": number,
    "reasoning": "string"
  }
]`;

    // Format parameter list
    const parameterList = pluginDescriptor.parameters
      .map((param: PluginParameter) => {
        const group = param.group ? ` [${param.group}]` : '';
        return `  ${param.index}: ${param.name}${group}`;
      })
      .join('\n');

    const controlList = controlNames.map((name, i) => `  ${i}: ${name}`).join('\n');

    const prompt = `${systemPrompt}

PLUGIN: ${pluginDescriptor.plugin.manufacturer} - ${pluginDescriptor.plugin.name}
Total Parameters: ${pluginDescriptor.parameters.length}

PLUGIN PARAMETERS:
${parameterList}

HARDWARE CONTROLS TO MATCH:
${controlList}

Please provide the JSON response with matches for each control.`;

    return prompt;
  }

  /**
   * Call Claude AI to process the matching request.
   *
   * Attempts to use Anthropic API if ANTHROPIC_API_KEY is set,
   * otherwise falls back to Claude CLI command.
   *
   * @param prompt - The matching prompt
   * @returns Promise resolving to Claude's response text
   * @throws Error if both API and CLI are unavailable
   * @throws Error if request times out or fails
   */
  private async callClaude(prompt: string): Promise<string> {
    const apiKey = process.env['ANTHROPIC_API_KEY'];

    if (apiKey) {
      return this.callClaudeAPI(prompt, apiKey);
    } else {
      return this.callClaudeCLI(prompt);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Call Claude using the Anthropic API.
   *
   * Makes a direct HTTP request to the Anthropic API endpoint.
   *
   * @param prompt - The matching prompt
   * @param apiKey - Anthropic API key
   * @returns Promise resolving to Claude's response
   * @throws Error if API request fails
   */
  private async callClaudeAPI(prompt: string, apiKey: string): Promise<string> {
    const response = await fetch('https://api.anthropic.com/v1/messages', {
      method: 'POST',
      headers: {
        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        'x-api-key': apiKey,
        'anthropic-version': '2023-06-01',
      },
      body: JSON.stringify({
        model: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022',
        max_tokens: 4096,
        messages: [
          {
            role: 'user',
            content: prompt,
          },
        ],
      }),
    });

    if (!response.ok) {
      const error = await response.text();
      throw new Error(`Claude API request failed: ${response.status} - ${error}`);
    }

    const data = (await response.json()) as {
      content: Array<{ type: string; text: string }>;
    };

    if (!data.content || data.content.length === 0) {
      throw new Error('Claude API returned empty response');
    }

    const firstContent = data.content[0];
    if (!firstContent) {
      throw new Error('Claude API returned empty content array');
    }

    return firstContent.text;
  }

  /**
   * Call Claude using the CLI command.
   *
   * Spawns the `claude` CLI process and pipes the prompt to it.
   *
   * @param prompt - The matching prompt
   * @returns Promise resolving to Claude's response
   * @throws Error if CLI command fails or times out
   */
  private async callClaudeCLI(prompt: string): Promise<string> {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      const process = spawn('claude', [], {
        stdio: ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
      });

      let stdout = '';
      let stderr = '';

      const timeoutHandle = setTimeout(() => {
        process.kill();
        reject(new Error(`Claude CLI request timed out after ${this.timeout}ms`));
      }, this.timeout);

      process.stdout.on('data', (data) => {
        stdout += data.toString();
      });

      process.stderr.on('data', (data) => {
        stderr += data.toString();
      });

      process.on('error', (error) => {
        clearTimeout(timeoutHandle);
        reject(new Error(`Failed to spawn Claude CLI: ${error.message}`));
      });

      process.on('close', (code) => {
        clearTimeout(timeoutHandle);

        if (code !== 0) {
          reject(new Error(`Claude CLI exited with code ${code}: ${stderr}`));
          return;
        }

        if (!stdout.trim()) {
          reject(new Error('Claude CLI returned empty response'));
          return;
        }

        resolve(stdout);
      });

      // Write prompt to stdin
      process.stdin.write(prompt);
      process.stdin.end();
    });
  }

  /**
   * Parse Claude's JSON response into ParameterMatchResult objects.
   *
   * Extracts the JSON array from Claude's response and validates the structure.
   *
   * @param response - Raw response text from Claude
   * @param controlNames - Original control names for validation
   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor for parameter lookup
   * @returns Array of match results
   * @throws Error if response cannot be parsed or is invalid
   */
  private parseClaudeResponse(
    response: string,
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor
  ): ParameterMatchResult[] {
    // Extract JSON from response (Claude might wrap it in markdown code blocks)
    const jsonMatch = response.match(/\[[\s\S]*\]/);
    if (!jsonMatch) {
      throw new Error(`Could not find JSON array in Claude response: ${response.substring(0, 200)}`);
    }

    let parsed: unknown;
    try {
      parsed = JSON.parse(jsonMatch[0]);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to parse Claude response as JSON: ${error}`);
    }

    if (!Array.isArray(parsed)) {
      throw new Error('Claude response is not an array');
    }

    // Validate and transform response
    const results: ParameterMatchResult[] = [];

    for (let i = 0; i < controlNames.length; i++) {
      const controlName = controlNames[i];
      if (!controlName) {
        continue;
      }

      const match = parsed[i];

      if (!match || typeof match !== 'object') {
        // If Claude didn't provide a match for this control, add a no-match result
        results.push({
          controlName,
          confidence: 0,
          reasoning: 'No match found',
        });
        continue;
      }

      const paramIndex = match.parameterIndex as number | null | undefined;
      const confidence = typeof match.confidence === 'number' ? match.confidence : 0;
      const reasoning = typeof match.reasoning === 'string' ? match.reasoning : undefined;

      if (paramIndex === null || paramIndex === undefined || paramIndex < 0) {
        results.push({
          controlName,
          confidence,
          reasoning,
        });
        continue;
      }

      // Validate parameter index
      const parameter = pluginDescriptor.parameters[paramIndex];
      if (!parameter) {
        results.push({
          controlName,
          confidence: 0,
          reasoning: `Invalid parameter index ${paramIndex}`,
        });
        continue;
      }

      results.push({
        controlName,
        pluginParameter: paramIndex,
        parameterName: parameter.name,
        confidence,
        reasoning,
      });
    }

    return results;
  }
}

/**
 * Load a plugin descriptor from the canonical-midi-maps registry.
 *
 * Looks up plugin descriptor files by manufacturer and plugin name,
 * normalizing names to match filesystem conventions.
 *
 * @param pluginName - Plugin name (e.g., "TAL-J-8" or "tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8")
 * @returns Promise resolving to plugin descriptor
 * @throws Error if descriptor file not found or cannot be loaded
 */
export async function loadPluginDescriptor(pluginName: string): Promise<PluginDescriptor> {
  // Normalize plugin name to filename format
  const normalizedName = pluginName.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-');

  // Find the canonical-midi-maps module
  // Navigate from controller-workflow to canonical-midi-maps
  const baseDir = path.resolve(__dirname, '../../canonical-midi-maps/plugin-descriptors');

  // Try to find matching descriptor file
  let descriptorPath: string | undefined;

  try {
    const files = await fs.readdir(baseDir);

    // Look for exact match or substring match
    const matchingFile = files.find(
      (file) => file === `${normalizedName}.json` || file.includes(normalizedName)
    );

    if (matchingFile) {
      descriptorPath = path.join(baseDir, matchingFile);
    }
  } catch (error) {
    throw new Error(`Failed to read plugin descriptors directory: ${error}`);
  }

  if (!descriptorPath) {
    throw new Error(
      `Plugin descriptor not found for "${pluginName}". ` +
        `Searched in ${baseDir} for files matching "${normalizedName}"`
    );
  }

  // Load and parse the descriptor
  try {
    const content = await fs.readFile(descriptorPath, 'utf-8');
    const descriptor = JSON.parse(content) as PluginDescriptor;

    // Validate basic structure
    if (!descriptor.plugin || !descriptor.parameters) {
      throw new Error('Invalid plugin descriptor structure: missing plugin or parameters');
    }

    return descriptor;
  } catch (error) {
    throw new Error(`Failed to load plugin descriptor from ${descriptorPath}: ${error}`);
  }
}

   230‚Üí  private async callClaude(prompt: string): Promise<string> {

   240‚Üí  /**
   241‚Üí   * Call Claude using the Anthropic API.
   242‚Üí   *
   243‚Üí   * Makes a direct HTTP request to the Anthropic API endpoint.
   244‚Üí   *
   245‚Üí   * @param prompt - The matching prompt
   246‚Üí   * @param apiKey - Anthropic API key
   247‚Üí   * @returns Promise resolving to Claude's response
   248‚Üí   * @throws Error if API request fails
   249‚Üí   */
   250‚Üí  private async callClaudeAPI(prompt: string, apiKey: string): Promise<string> {
   251‚Üí    const response = await fetch('https://api.anthropic.com/v1/messages', {
   252‚Üí      method: 'POST',
   253‚Üí      headers: {
   254‚Üí        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
   255‚Üí        'x-api-key': apiKey,
   256‚Üí        'anthropic-version': '2023-06-01',
   257‚Üí      },
   258‚Üí      body: JSON.stringify({
   259‚Üí        model: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022',
   260‚Üí        max_tokens: 4096,
   261‚Üí        messages: [
   262‚Üí          {
   263‚Üí            role: 'user',
   264‚Üí            content: prompt,
   265‚Üí          },
   266‚Üí        ],
   267‚Üí      }),
   268‚Üí    });
   269‚Üí
   270‚Üí    if (!response.ok) {
   271‚Üí      const error = await response.text();
   272‚Üí      throw new Error(`Claude API request failed: ${response.status} - ${error}`);
   273‚Üí    }
   274‚Üí
   275‚Üí    const data = (await response.json()) as {
   276‚Üí      content: Array<{ type: string; text: string }>;
   277‚Üí    };
   278‚Üí
   279‚Üí    if (!data.content || data.content.length === 0) {
   280‚Üí      throw new Error('Claude API returned empty response');
   281‚Üí    }
   282‚Üí
   283‚Üí    const firstContent = data.content[0];
   284‚Üí    if (!firstContent) {
   285‚Üí      throw new Error('Claude API returned empty content array');
   286‚Üí    }
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí    return firstContent.text;
   289‚Üí  }
   290‚Üí
   291‚Üí  /**
   292‚Üí   * Call Claude using the CLI command.
   293‚Üí   *
   294‚Üí   * Spawns the `claude` CLI process and pipes the prompt to it.
   295‚Üí   *
   296‚Üí   * @param prompt - The matching prompt
   297‚Üí   * @returns Promise resolving to Claude's response
   298‚Üí   * @throws Error if CLI command fails or times out
   299‚Üí   */
   300‚Üí  private async callClaudeCLI(prompt: string): Promise<string> {
   301‚Üí    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
   302‚Üí      const process = spawn('claude', [], {
   303‚Üí        stdio: ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
   304‚Üí      });
   305‚Üí
   306‚Üí      let stdout = '';
   307‚Üí      let stderr = '';
   308‚Üí
   309‚Üí      const timeoutHandle = setTimeout(() => {
   310‚Üí        process.kill();
   311‚Üí        reject(new Error(`Claude CLI request timed out after ${this.timeout}ms`));
   312‚Üí      }, this.timeout);
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí      process.stdout.on('data', (data) => {
   315‚Üí        stdout += data.toString();
   316‚Üí      });
   317‚Üí
   318‚Üí      process.stderr.on('data', (data) => {
   319‚Üí        stderr += data.toString();
   320‚Üí      });
   321‚Üí
   322‚Üí      process.on('error', (error) => {
   323‚Üí        clearTimeout(timeoutHandle);
   324‚Üí        reject(new Error(`Failed to spawn Claude CLI: ${error.message}`));
   325‚Üí      });
   326‚Üí
   327‚Üí      process.on('close', (code) => {
   328‚Üí        clearTimeout(timeoutHandle);
   329‚Üí
   330‚Üí        if (code !== 0) {
   331‚Üí          reject(new Error(`Claude CLI exited with code ${code}: ${stderr}`));
   332‚Üí          return;
   333‚Üí        }
   334‚Üí
   335‚Üí        if (!stdout.trim()) {
   336‚Üí          reject(new Error('Claude CLI returned empty response'));
   337‚Üí          return;
   338‚Üí        }
   339‚Üí
   340‚Üí        resolve(stdout);
   341‚Üí      });
   342‚Üí
   343‚Üí      // Write prompt to stdin
   344‚Üí      process.stdin.write(prompt);
   345‚Üí      process.stdin.end();
   346‚Üí    });
   347‚Üí  }

   349‚Üí  /**
   350‚Üí   * Parse Claude's JSON response into ParameterMatchResult objects.
   351‚Üí   *
   352‚Üí   * Extracts the JSON array from Claude's response and validates the structure.
   353‚Üí   *
   354‚Üí   * @param response - Raw response text from Claude
   355‚Üí   * @param controlNames - Original control names for validation
   356‚Üí   * @param pluginDescriptor - Plugin descriptor for parameter lookup
   357‚Üí   * @returns Array of match results
   358‚Üí   * @throws Error if response cannot be parsed or is invalid

   360‚Üí  private parseClaudeResponse(
   361‚Üí    response: string,
   362‚Üí    controlNames: string[],
   363‚Üí    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor
   364‚Üí  ): ParameterMatchResult[] {
   365‚Üí    // Extract JSON from response (Claude might wrap it in markdown code blocks)
   366‚Üí    const jsonMatch = response.match(/\[[\s\S]*\]/);
   367‚Üí    if (!jsonMatch) {
   368‚Üí      throw new Error(`Could not find JSON array in Claude response: ${response.substring(0, 200)}`);
   369‚Üí    }
   370‚Üí
   371‚Üí    let parsed: unknown;
   372‚Üí    try {
   373‚Üí      parsed = JSON.parse(jsonMatch[0]);
   374‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   375‚Üí      throw new Error(`Failed to parse Claude response as JSON: ${error}`);
   376‚Üí    }
   377‚Üí
   378‚Üí    if (!Array.isArray(parsed)) {
   379‚Üí      throw new Error('Claude response is not an array');
   380‚Üí    }
   381‚Üí
   382‚Üí    // Validate and transform response
   383‚Üí    const results: ParameterMatchResult[] = [];
   384‚Üí
   385‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < controlNames.length; i++) {
   386‚Üí      const controlName = controlNames[i];
   387‚Üí      if (!controlName) {
   388‚Üí        continue;
   389‚Üí      }
   390‚Üí
   391‚Üí      const match = parsed[i];
   392‚Üí
   393‚Üí      if (!match || typeof match !== 'object') {
   394‚Üí        // If Claude didn't provide a match for this control, add a no-match result
   395‚Üí        results.push({
   396‚Üí          controlName,
   397‚Üí          confidence: 0,
   398‚Üí          reasoning: 'No match found',
   399‚Üí        });
   400‚Üí        continue;
   401‚Üí      }
   402‚Üí
   403‚Üí      const paramIndex = match.parameterIndex as number | null | undefined;
   404‚Üí      const confidence = typeof match.confidence === 'number' ? match.confidence : 0;
   405‚Üí      const reasoning = typeof match.reasoning === 'string' ? match.reasoning : undefined;
   406‚Üí
   407‚Üí      if (paramIndex === null || paramIndex === undefined || paramIndex < 0) {
   408‚Üí        results.push({
   409‚Üí          controlName,
   410‚Üí          confidence,
   411‚Üí          reasoning,
   412‚Üí        });
   413‚Üí        continue;
   414‚Üí      }
   415‚Üí
   416‚Üí      // Validate parameter index
   417‚Üí      const parameter = pluginDescriptor.parameters[paramIndex];
   418‚Üí      if (!parameter) {
   419‚Üí        results.push({
   420‚Üí          controlName,
   421‚Üí          confidence: 0,
   422‚Üí          reasoning: `Invalid parameter index ${paramIndex}`,
   423‚Üí        });
   424‚Üí        continue;
   425‚Üí      }
   426‚Üí
   427‚Üí      results.push({
   428‚Üí        controlName,
   429‚Üí        pluginParameter: paramIndex,
   430‚Üí        parameterName: parameter.name,
   431‚Üí        confidence,
   432‚Üí        reasoning,
   433‚Üí      });
   434‚Üí    }
   435‚Üí
   436‚Üí    return results;
   437‚Üí  }
   438‚Üí}

   440‚Üí/**
   441‚Üí * Load a plugin descriptor from the canonical-midi-maps registry.
   442‚Üí *
   443‚Üí * Looks up plugin descriptor files by manufacturer and plugin name,
   444‚Üí * normalizing names to match filesystem conventions.
   445‚Üí *
   446‚Üí * @param pluginName - Plugin name (e.g., "TAL-J-8" or "tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8")
   447‚Üí * @returns Promise resolving to plugin descriptor
   448‚Üí * @throws Error if descriptor file not found or cannot be loaded
   449‚Üí */
   450‚Üíexport async function loadPluginDescriptor(pluginName: string): Promise<PluginDescriptor> {
   451‚Üí  // Normalize plugin name to filename format
   452‚Üí  const normalizedName = pluginName.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-');
   453‚Üí
   454‚Üí  // Find the canonical-midi-maps module
   455‚Üí  // Navigate from controller-workflow to canonical-midi-maps
   456‚Üí  const baseDir = path.resolve(__dirname, '../../canonical-midi-maps/plugin-descriptors');
   457‚Üí
   458‚Üí  // Try to find matching descriptor file
   459‚Üí  let descriptorPath: string | undefined;
   460‚Üí
   461‚Üí  try {
   462‚Üí    const files = await fs.readdir(baseDir);
   463‚Üí
   464‚Üí    // Look for exact match or substring match
   465‚Üí    const matchingFile = files.find(
   466‚Üí      (file) => file === `${normalizedName}.json` || file.includes(normalizedName)
   467‚Üí    );
   468‚Üí
   469‚Üí    if (matchingFile) {
   470‚Üí      descriptorPath = path.join(baseDir, matchingFile);
   471‚Üí    }
   472‚Üí  } catch (error) {

   474‚Üí  }
   475‚Üí

   478‚Üí      `Plugin descriptor not found for "${pluginName}". ` +

   480‚Üí    );
   481‚Üí  }
   482‚Üí
   483‚Üí  // Load and parse the descriptor
   484‚Üí  try {
   485‚Üí    const content = await fs.readFile(descriptorPath, 'utf-8');
   486‚Üí    const descriptor = JSON.parse(content) as PluginDescriptor;
   487‚Üí
   488‚Üí    // Validate basic structure

   491‚Üí    }
   492‚Üí
   493‚Üí    return descriptor;
   494‚Üí  } catch (error) {

/**
 * Parameter Matching Example
 *
 * Demonstrates using the ParameterMatcher service to intelligently map
 * hardware controller names to plugin parameters using Claude AI.
 */

import { ParameterMatcher, loadPluginDescriptor } from '../dist/services/index.js';

async function runExample() {
  console.log('Parameter Matching Example\n');

  // Example 1: Load a plugin descriptor
  console.log('1. Loading TAL-J-8 plugin descriptor...');
  try {
    const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');
    console.log(`   Loaded: ${descriptor.plugin.manufacturer} - ${descriptor.plugin.name}`);
    console.log(`   Parameters: ${descriptor.parameters.length}\n`);

    // Example 2: Match controller names to plugin parameters
    console.log('2. Matching hardware control names to plugin parameters...');

    const hardwareControls = [
      'Cutoff',
      'Resonance',
      'Attack',
      'Release',
      'LFO Speed',
      'Master Volume',
      'Chorus Depth',
      'VCF Freq',
    ];

    console.log(`   Hardware controls: ${hardwareControls.join(', ')}\n`);

    const matcher = ParameterMatcher.create({
      minConfidence: 0.6, // Only accept matches with 60%+ confidence
      timeout: 60000,     // 60 second timeout
    });

    const results = await matcher.matchParameters(hardwareControls, descriptor, {
      minConfidence: 0.6,
    });

    console.log('   Matching results:');

```md
# Controller Workflow Services

Intelligent services for controller configuration and plugin mapping.

## ParameterMatcher

The `ParameterMatcher` service uses Claude AI to intelligently match hardware controller control names to plugin parameters based on semantic similarity, common naming conventions, and audio engineering domain knowledge.

### Features

- **AI-Powered Matching**: Uses Claude 3.5 Sonnet for intelligent parameter matching
- **Flexible Integration**: Supports both Anthropic API and Claude CLI
- **Confidence Scoring**: Provides 0-1 confidence scores for each match
- **Semantic Understanding**: Recognizes common abbreviations and synonyms
- **Plugin Descriptor Support**: Works with the canonical-midi-maps plugin descriptor registry

### Basic Usage

\```typescript
import { ParameterMatcher, loadPluginDescriptor } from '@oletizi/controller-workflow';

// Load plugin descriptor
const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');

// Create matcher instance
const matcher = ParameterMatcher.create({
  minConfidence: 0.6,  // Minimum confidence threshold
  timeout: 30000,      // 30 second timeout
});

// Match control names to parameters
const hardwareControls = ['Cutoff', 'Resonance', 'Attack', 'Release'];
const results = await matcher.matchParameters(hardwareControls, descriptor);

// Process results
for (const result of results) {
  if (result.pluginParameter !== undefined) {
    console.log(`${result.controlName} ‚Üí ${result.parameterName}`);
    console.log(`  Confidence: ${result.confidence}`);
    console.log(`  Parameter Index: ${result.pluginParameter}`);
  }
}
\```

### Configuration

#### API vs CLI

The matcher supports two Claude integration methods:

1. **Anthropic API** (recommended):
   \```bash
   export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="your-api-key"
   \```

2. **Claude CLI** (fallback):
   \```bash
   npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude
   claude auth
   \```

If `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is set, the API will be used. Otherwise, it falls back to the CLI.

#### Match Options

\```typescript
interface MatchOptions {
  minConfidence?: number;        // 0-1, default 0.5
  preserveControlNames?: boolean; // Preserve original names
  customPrompt?: string;         // Custom system prompt
  timeout?: number;              // Request timeout in ms
}
\```

### Advanced Usage

#### Custom Prompts

You can provide a custom system prompt to guide matching behavior:

\```typescript
const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor, {
  customPrompt: `You are an expert at mapping MIDI controls to synthesizer parameters.
Focus on common synthesizer workflows and standard naming conventions.
Consider these priority mappings:
- Cutoff ‚Üí Filter Frequency
- Res ‚Üí Filter Resonance
- Atk ‚Üí Envelope Attack
...`
});
\```

#### Filtering by Confidence

\```typescript
const highConfidenceMatches = results.filter(r => r.confidence >= 0.8);
const unknownControls = results.filter(r => r.pluginParameter === undefined);
\```

#### Integration with Deployment Workflow

\```typescript
// Match parameters
const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);

// Add to canonical map
const canonicalMap = {
  name: 'My Controller',
  plugin: descriptor.plugin,
  bindings: matches.map((match, index) => ({
    control: match.controlName,
    cc: index + 1,
    parameter: match.pluginParameter,
    name: match.parameterName,
  })),
};
\```

### Plugin Descriptor Loading

The `loadPluginDescriptor` function loads plugin descriptors from the canonical-midi-maps registry:

\```typescript
// By plugin name (case-insensitive, space-insensitive)
const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('TAL-J-8');
const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal j 8');
const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8');

// All normalize to the same descriptor file
\```

### Error Handling

\```typescript
try {
  const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
} catch (error) {
  if (error.message.includes('API request failed')) {
    // Handle API errors (rate limits, auth, etc.)
  } else if (error.message.includes('timeout')) {
    // Handle timeout
  } else if (error.message.includes('Plugin descriptor not found')) {
    // Handle missing plugin descriptor
  }
}
\```

### Performance Considerations

- **API Response Time**: Typical 2-5 seconds for 10-20 controls
- **Rate Limits**: Anthropic API has rate limits; consider caching results
- **Batch Processing**: Process multiple controllers sequentially to avoid rate limits
- **Timeouts**: Default 30s should handle most plugins; increase for large plugins (>500 params)

### Examples

See `/examples/parameter-matching-example.ts` for a complete working example.

### Testing

Unit tests use mocked Claude responses to avoid API calls:

\```typescript
import { ParameterMatcher } from '@oletizi/controller-workflow';
import { vi } from 'vitest';

// Mock API response
global.fetch = vi.fn().mockResolvedValue({
  ok: true,
  json: async () => ({
    content: [{ type: 'text', text: JSON.stringify([/* mock matches */]) }],
  }),
});

process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY = 'test-key';
const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
\```

### Architecture

The ParameterMatcher follows interface-first design:

- **Interface**: `ParameterMatcherInterface` - contract for matching implementations
- **Implementation**: `ParameterMatcher` - Claude AI-based implementation
- **Factory Pattern**: `ParameterMatcher.create()` for dependency injection
- **Composition**: No inheritance, uses functional composition

### Future Enhancements

- Rule-based fallback matcher for offline usage
- Caching layer for common plugin/control combinations
- Learning from user corrections
- Support for multi-plugin scenarios
- Parameter group awareness (envelope, filter, oscillator)

```

- Dual Claude integration: Anthropic API (primary), CLI (fallback)

}

**Integration code:**

```typescript
// After line 175 (after reading controller config)
// Before line 178 (before converting to canonical)

// Step 1.5: AI-powered parameter matching (if plugin specified)
if (options.plugin) {
  try {
    emitProgress({ step: 1.5, total: 3, message: 'AI-matching control names to plugin parameters...' });
    
    const { ParameterMatcher, loadPluginDescriptor } = await import('../services/ParameterMatcher.js');
    
    // Load plugin descriptor
    const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor(options.plugin);
    console.log(`     ‚úì Loaded plugin descriptor: ${descriptor.plugin.name} (${descriptor.parameters.length} parameters)`);
    
    // Extract control names
    const controlNames = config.controls
      .filter(c => c.name && c.name.trim().length > 0)
      .map(c => c.name!);
    
    if (controlNames.length === 0) {
      console.log('     ‚ö† No named controls found, skipping AI matching');
    } else {
      // Match parameters
      const matcher = ParameterMatcher.create({ minConfidence: 0.6 });
      const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
      
      // Add plugin_parameter to controls
      let matchCount = 0;
      config.controls.forEach((control) => {
        if (!control.name) return;
        
        const match = matches.find(m => m.controlName === control.name);
        if (match?.pluginParameter !== undefined) {
          control.plugin_parameter = match.pluginParameter;
          matchCount++;
        }
      });
      
      console.log(`     ‚úì AI-matched ${matchCount}/${controlNames.length} controls (${((matchCount/controlNames.length)*100).toFixed(0)}%)`);
      
      // Show low confidence warnings
      const lowConfidence = matches.filter(m => m.confidence < 0.7 && m.pluginParameter !== undefined);
      if (lowConfidence.length > 0) {
        console.log(`     ‚ö† ${lowConfidence.length} matches with confidence < 0.7:`);
        lowConfidence.forEach(m => {
          console.log(`       - "${m.controlName}" ‚Üí ${m.parameterName} (${(m.confidence * 100).toFixed(0)}%)`);
        });
      }
    }
  } catch (error: unknown) {
    const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);
    console.log(`     ‚ö† AI matching failed: ${errorMessage}`);
    console.log('     ‚Ñπ Continuing without parameter matching...');
    // Don't fail deployment if AI matching fails
  }
  console.log('');
}
```
