1‚Üí# Controller Workflow Services
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíIntelligent services for controller configuration and plugin mapping.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## ParameterMatcher
     6‚Üí
     7‚ÜíThe `ParameterMatcher` service uses Claude Code CLI to intelligently match hardware controller control names to plugin parameters based on semantic similarity, common naming conventions, and audio engineering domain knowledge.
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí### Features
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí- **AI-Powered Matching**: Uses Claude Code CLI for intelligent parameter matching
    12‚Üí- **Confidence Scoring**: Provides 0-1 confidence scores for each match
    13‚Üí- **Semantic Understanding**: Recognizes common abbreviations and synonyms
    14‚Üí- **Plugin Descriptor Support**: Works with the canonical-midi-maps plugin descriptor registry
    15‚Üí- **Timeout Handling**: Configurable timeouts for CLI requests
    16‚Üí- **Error Handling**: Robust error handling for CLI failures
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí### Requirements
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí**Claude Code CLI must be installed and authenticated:**
    21‚Üí
    22‚Üí\```bash
    23‚Üí# Claude Code is already installed on your system
    24‚Üí# Verify it's working:
    25‚Üíclaude --version
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí# If you need to authenticate:
    28‚Üíclaude auth
    29‚Üí\```
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí### Basic Usage
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí\```typescript
    34‚Üíimport { ParameterMatcher, loadPluginDescriptor } from '@oletizi/controller-workflow';
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí// Load plugin descriptor
    37‚Üíconst descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí// Create matcher instance
    40‚Üíconst matcher = ParameterMatcher.create({
    41‚Üí  minConfidence: 0.6,  // Minimum confidence threshold
    42‚Üí  timeout: 30000,      // 30 second timeout
    43‚Üí});
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí// Match control names to parameters
    46‚Üíconst hardwareControls = ['Cutoff', 'Resonance', 'Attack', 'Release'];
    47‚Üíconst results = await matcher.matchParameters(hardwareControls, descriptor);
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí// Process results
    50‚Üífor (const result of results) {
    51‚Üí  if (result.pluginParameter !== undefined) {
    52‚Üí    console.log(`${result.controlName} ‚Üí ${result.parameterName}`);
    53‚Üí    console.log(`  Confidence: ${result.confidence}`);
    54‚Üí    console.log(`  Parameter Index: ${result.pluginParameter}`);
    55‚Üí  }
    56‚Üí}
    57‚Üí\```
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí### Configuration
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí#### Match Options
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí\```typescript
    64‚Üíinterface MatchOptions {
    65‚Üí  minConfidence?: number;        // 0-1, default 0.5
    66‚Üí  preserveControlNames?: boolean; // Preserve original names
    67‚Üí  customPrompt?: string;         // Custom system prompt
    68‚Üí  timeout?: number;              // Request timeout in ms
    69‚Üí}
    70‚Üí\```
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí### Advanced Usage
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí#### Custom Prompts
    75‚Üí
    76‚ÜíYou can provide a custom system prompt to guide matching behavior:
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí\```typescript
    79‚Üíconst results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor, {
    80‚Üí  customPrompt: `You are an expert at mapping MIDI controls to synthesizer parameters.
    81‚ÜíFocus on common synthesizer workflows and standard naming conventions.
    82‚ÜíConsider these priority mappings:
    83‚Üí- Cutoff ‚Üí Filter Frequency
    84‚Üí- Res ‚Üí Filter Resonance
    85‚Üí- Atk ‚Üí Envelope Attack
    86‚Üí...`
    87‚Üí});
    88‚Üí\```
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üí#### Filtering by Confidence
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí\```typescript
    93‚Üíconst highConfidenceMatches = results.filter(r => r.confidence >= 0.8);
    94‚Üíconst unknownControls = results.filter(r => r.pluginParameter === undefined);
    95‚Üí\```
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí#### Integration with Deployment Workflow
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí\```typescript
   100‚Üí// Match parameters
   101‚Üíconst matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí// Add to canonical map
   104‚Üíconst canonicalMap = {
   105‚Üí  name: 'My Controller',
   106‚Üí  plugin: descriptor.plugin,
   107‚Üí  bindings: matches.map((match, index) => ({
   108‚Üí    control: match.controlName,
   109‚Üí    cc: index + 1,
   110‚Üí    parameter: match.pluginParameter,
   111‚Üí    name: match.parameterName,
   112‚Üí  })),
   113‚Üí};
   114‚Üí\```
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí### Plugin Descriptor Loading
   117‚Üí
   118‚ÜíThe `loadPluginDescriptor` function loads plugin descriptors from the canonical-midi-maps registry:
   119‚Üí
   120‚Üí\```typescript
   121‚Üí// By plugin name (case-insensitive, space-insensitive)
   122‚Üíconst descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('TAL-J-8');
   123‚Üíconst descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal j 8');
   124‚Üíconst descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8');
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üí// All normalize to the same descriptor file
   127‚Üí\```
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí### Error Handling
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí\```typescript
   132‚Üítry {
   133‚Üí  const results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
   134‚Üí} catch (error) {
   135‚Üí  if (error.message.includes('Failed to spawn Claude CLI')) {
   136‚Üí    // Handle CLI not found or spawn errors
   137‚Üí    console.error('Claude Code CLI is not installed or not in PATH');
   138‚Üí  } else if (error.message.includes('timeout')) {
   139‚Üí    // Handle timeout
   140‚Üí    console.error('Claude CLI request timed out - try increasing timeout');
   141‚Üí  } else if (error.message.includes('exited with code')) {
   142‚Üí    // Handle CLI execution errors
   143‚Üí    console.error('Claude CLI failed to execute');
   144‚Üí  } else if (error.message.includes('Plugin descriptor not found')) {
   145‚Üí    // Handle missing plugin descriptor
   146‚Üí    console.error('Plugin not found in registry');
   147‚Üí  }
   148‚Üí}
   149‚Üí\```
   150‚Üí
   151‚Üí### Performance Considerations
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí- **CLI Response Time**: Typical 2-10 seconds for 10-20 controls (depends on Claude Code CLI performance)
   154‚Üí- **Batch Processing**: Process multiple controllers sequentially to avoid spawning too many processes
   155‚Üí- **Timeouts**: Default 30s should handle most plugins; increase for large plugins (>500 params)
   156‚Üí- **Caching**: Consider caching results for frequently used plugin/control combinations
   157‚Üí
   158‚Üí### Examples
   159‚Üí
   160‚ÜíSee `/examples/parameter-matching-example.ts` for a complete working example.
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí### Testing
   163‚Üí
   164‚ÜíUnit tests use mocked `spawn` to avoid actual CLI calls:
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí\```typescript
   167‚Üíimport { ParameterMatcher } from '@oletizi/controller-workflow';
   168‚Üíimport { vi } from 'vitest';
   169‚Üíimport { spawn } from 'child_process';
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üí// Mock spawn

   174‚Üí}));

   176‚Üí// Create mock process
   177‚Üíconst mockProc = {
   178‚Üí  stdout: { on: vi.fn() },
   179‚Üí  stderr: { on: vi.fn() },
   180‚Üí  stdin: { write: vi.fn(), end: vi.fn() },
   181‚Üí  on: vi.fn((event, handler) => {
   182‚Üí    if (event === 'close') handler(0);
   183‚Üí  }),
   184‚Üí};
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üívi.mocked(spawn).mockReturnValue(mockProc);
   187‚Üí
   188‚Üíconst results = await matcher.matchParameters(controls, descriptor);
   189‚Üí\```
   190‚Üí
   191‚Üí### Architecture
   192‚Üí
   193‚ÜíThe ParameterMatcher follows interface-first design:
   194‚Üí
   195‚Üí- **Interface**: `ParameterMatcherInterface` - contract for matching implementations
   196‚Üí- **Implementation**: `ParameterMatcher` - Claude Code CLI-based implementation
   197‚Üí- **Factory Pattern**: `ParameterMatcher.create()` for dependency injection
   198‚Üí- **Composition**: No inheritance, uses functional composition
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí### Implementation Details
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí#### How it Works
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üí1. **Prompt Construction**: Builds a detailed prompt with plugin parameters and control names
   205‚Üí2. **CLI Invocation**: Spawns `claude` command and pipes prompt to stdin
   206‚Üí3. **Response Parsing**: Extracts JSON from Claude's response (handles markdown code blocks)
   207‚Üí4. **Validation**: Validates parameter indices and confidence scores
   208‚Üí5. **Filtering**: Applies minimum confidence threshold
   209‚Üí
   210‚Üí#### CLI Command
   211‚Üí
   212‚ÜíThe service spawns the Claude Code CLI as:
   213‚Üí
   214‚Üí\```bash
   215‚Üíclaude < prompt.txt
   216‚Üí\```
   217‚Üí
   218‚ÜíThe prompt is piped to stdin, and the response is read from stdout.
   219‚Üí
   220‚Üí#### Response Format
   221‚Üí
   222‚ÜíClaude is instructed to respond with JSON:
   223‚Üí
   224‚Üí\```json
   225‚Üí[
   226‚Üí  {
   227‚Üí    "controlName": "Cutoff",
   228‚Üí    "parameterIndex": 42,
   229‚Üí    "parameterName": "Filter Cutoff",
   230‚Üí    "confidence": 0.95,
   231‚Üí    "reasoning": "Direct semantic match"
   232‚Üí  }
   233‚Üí]
   234‚Üí\```
   235‚Üí

# Code Review Report: Fuzzy Parameter Matching Implementation

## Executive Summary

**Recommendation:** ‚ö†Ô∏è **NEEDS CRITICAL FIX BEFORE HARDWARE VALIDATION**

The fuzzy parameter matching implementation is well-architected with strong testing coverage, but has **1 critical integration bug** that will prevent plugin_parameter values from flowing through to Ardour deployment.

---

## Critical Issues (MUST FIX)

### üî¥ CRITICAL: LaunchControlXL3Converter Does Not Preserve plugin_parameter Field

**File:** `/Users/orion/work/ol_dsp-audio-control-360/modules/audio-control/modules/controller-workflow/src/converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.ts`

**Location:** Lines 175-188 (mapControl method)

**Issue:**
The `LaunchControlXL3Converter.mapControl()` method creates canonical control definitions but **does not copy the `plugin_parameter` field** from the source ControlMapping to the CanonicalMidiMap control.

**Current Code (Lines 175-188):**
```typescript
private mapControl(control: ControlMapping, options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition {
  const canonicalId = this.mapControlId(control.id);
  const name = options.preserveLabels === true && control.name ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(canonicalId);

  return {
    id: canonicalId,
    name,
    type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
    cc: control.cc!,
    channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
    range: control.range ?? [0, 127],
    description: `Mapped from LCXL3 control: ${control.id}`,
  };
}
```

**Problem:**
The AI matching in `deploy.ts` (lines 202-210) adds `plugin_parameter` to `config.controls`, but this field is **lost** during conversion because the converter doesn't copy it.

**Impact:**
- AI-matched parameter indices are discarded
- Ardour MIDI maps will use fallback URIs like `/plugins/parameter/encoder_1` instead of `/plugins/parameter/5`
- Hardware validation will fail to demonstrate fuzzy matching benefit
- Integration between Step 1.5 (AI matching) and deployment is broken

**Fix Required:**
```typescript
private mapControl(control: ControlMapping, options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition {
  const canonicalId = this.mapControlId(control.id);
  const name = options.preserveLabels === true && control.name ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(canonicalId);

  const controlDef: ControlDefinition = {
    id: canonicalId,
    name,
    type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
    cc: control.cc!,
    channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
    range: control.range ?? [0, 127],
    description: `Mapped from LCXL3 control: ${control.id}`,
  };

  // Preserve plugin_parameter from AI matching
  if (control.plugin_parameter !== undefined) {
    controlDef.plugin_parameter = control.plugin_parameter;
  }

  return controlDef;
}
```

**Test Coverage Gap:**
The LaunchControlXL3Converter tests do not verify plugin_parameter preservation. Need to add test case:

```typescript
      },
    ],
  };
  const options: ConversionOptions = { preserveLabels: true };

  const result = converter.convert(config, options);

  expect(result.controls[0].plugin_parameter).toBe(42);
});
```

## Phase 1: Plugin Interrogation

### Purpose

Extract accurate parameter information from audio plugins to ensure mappings use real, valid parameter indices.

### Prerequisites

- JUCE-based plughost binary (built from project)
- Installed VST3 plugins
- canonical-midi-maps module

### Process

#### Step 1: Build Plugin Host

\```bash
# From project root
cd path/to/juce-plughost
make
# Binary output: build/plughost
\```

#### Step 2: Run Batch Interrogation

\```bash
# Navigate to canonical-midi-maps
cd modules/audio-control/modules/canonical-midi-maps

# Run batch plugin scanning
pnpm plugin:generate-batch
\```

**What happens:**
1. Launches `plughost` with `--batch-interrogate` flag
2. Scans all VST3 plugins in standard directories
3. Skips problematic plugins (UAD, etc.)
4. Extracts parameter information for each plugin
5. Outputs JSON stanzas to log file
6. Caches results for 24 hours

#### Step 3: Process Results

The batch generator automatically:
- Reads JSON stanzas from plughost output
- Converts to structured plugin descriptors
- Categorizes parameters (oscillator, filter, envelope, etc.)
- Saves individual descriptor files
- Updates catalog index

### Output

\```
plugin-descriptors/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json      # Jupiter-8 emulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ arturia-jup-8-v4.json                  # Arturia version
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ analogobsession-channev.json           # Channel strip
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ plugins-catalog-batch.json             # Master catalog
\```

### Example Plugin Descriptor

\```json
{
  "plugin": {
    "manufacturer": "TAL-Togu Audio Line",
    "name": "TAL-J-8",
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "format": "VST3",
    "uid": "-664001267"
  },
  "metadata": {
    "parameter_count": 2234,
    "created": "2025-10-11T10:00:00Z",
    "author": "plughost-batch",
    "tags": ["synthesizer", "analog", "jupiter-8"]
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "index": 105,
      "name": "VCF Cutoff",
      "min": 0,
      "max": 1,
      "default": 0.5,
      "group": "filter",
      "type": "continuous",
      "automatable": true
    },
    {
      "index": 65,
      "name": "Env Attack",
      "min": 0,
      "max": 1,
      "default": 0.1,
      "group": "envelope",
      "type": "continuous",
      "automatable": true
    }
  ],
  "groups": {
    "filter": {
      "parameters": [105, 107, 109, 111]
    },
    "envelope": {
      "parameters": [65, 67, 69, 71]
    }

}
\```

## Phase 2: Canonical Mapping

### Purpose

Create device-specific MIDI controller ‚Üí plugin parameter mappings using accurate parameter indices from Phase 1.

### Two Approaches

#### Approach A: Manual YAML Creation (Traditional)

1. Choose hardware controller (e.g., Launch Control XL 3)
2. Choose target plugin (e.g., TAL-J-8)
3. Reference plugin descriptor for parameter indices
4. Create YAML mapping file

#### Approach B: Hardware Extraction (360 Feature) ‚≠ê

1. Create custom mode on hardware controller
2. Label controls with parameter names
3. Use `controller-deploy` to extract configuration
4. Automatically generate canonical mapping
5. **AI-powered parameter matching** (Phase 2.5)

### Manual YAML Creation

#### Step 1: Choose Target Combination

- **Hardware:** Novation Launch Control XL 3
- **Plugin:** TAL-J-8
- **Descriptor:** `plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json`

#### Step 2: Create YAML File

**Location:** `maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/roland-jupiter-8/tal-j8.yaml`

\```yaml
version: 1.0.0

device:
  manufacturer: Novation
  model: Launch Control XL 3

plugin:
  manufacturer: TAL Software
  name: TAL-J-8
  descriptor: plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json

metadata:
  name: Jupiter-8 Template
  description: Controls for TAL-J-8 synthesizer
  date: 2025-10-11
  author: Your Name
  tags: [synthesizer, jupiter-8]

midi_channel: 1

controls:
  # Row A Encoders - Filter Section
  - id: encoder_1
    name: VCF Cutoff
    type: encoder
    cc: 13
    channel: 1
    plugin_parameter: 105    # From descriptor: VCF Cutoff
    range: [0, 127]

  - id: encoder_2
    name: VCF Resonance
    type: encoder
    cc: 14
    plugin_parameter: 107    # From descriptor: VCF Resonance

  # Faders - Envelopes
  - id: slider_1
    name: Env Attack
    type: slider
    cc: 53
    plugin_parameter: 65     # From descriptor: Env Attack

  - id: slider_2
    name: Env Decay
    type: slider
    cc: 54
    plugin_parameter: 67     # From descriptor: Env Decay

  # Buttons - Toggles
  - id: button_1
    name: Filter Mode
    type: button
    cc: 41
    plugin_parameter: 112    # From descriptor: Filter Mode Toggle
\```

### Hardware Extraction (One-Click Deployment) ‚≠ê

#### Step 1: Create Custom Mode on Controller

Using Novation Components software:
1. Open Launch Control XL 3 editor
2. Create new custom mode in slot 0
3. Assign CC numbers to controls
4. **Label each control** with parameter name
5. Save to device

#### Step 2: Extract Configuration

\```bash
# List available configurations
npx controller-deploy list

# Output:
# üì± Detected: Novation Launch Control XL 3
#
# Available configurations:
#   Slot 0: Jupiter-8 Template
#   Slot 1: Minimoog Template
#   Slot 2: (empty)
#   ...
\```

#### Step 3: Deploy to DAWs

\```bash
# Deploy single DAW
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour

# Deploy multiple DAWs
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live

# With plugin context (triggers fuzzy matching)
npx controller-deploy deploy \
  --slot 0 \
  --plugin "TAL-J-8" \
  --daw ardour live \
  --install

# Save canonical map for reference
npx controller-deploy deploy \
  --slot 0 \
  --output ./my-mappings \
  --install
\```

**What happens:**
1. Reads custom mode from controller slot 0
2. Extracts control assignments and labels
3. Converts to canonical MIDI map format
4. **[Phase 2.5] AI-powered fuzzy matching** (when --plugin provided)
5. Deploys to specified DAWs
6. Optionally saves canonical YAML

### Integration Method

The parameter matching service integrates with Claude AI exclusively through the Claude Code CLI:

\```typescript
// Shell out to Claude Code CLI
const result = await execAsync(
  `claude --prompt "Match these control names to plugin parameters: ${JSON.stringify(controls)}" --plugin-descriptor ${descriptorPath}`
);
\```

**Requirements:**
- Claude Code CLI installed and authenticated
- Claude Code session active

**Note:** The original implementation planned to support direct Anthropic API calls, but the production implementation uses Claude Code CLI exclusively for authentication simplicity and consistency with the Claude Code ecosystem.

### Matching Algorithm

Claude AI analyzes:
1. **Semantic similarity**: "VCF Cutoff" matches "VCF Cutoff" (exact)
2. **Abbreviations**: "Filter Res" matches "VCF Resonance"
3. **Synonyms**: "Env Attack" matches "Attack Time"
4. **Context**: Groups related parameters (filters, envelopes, etc.)
5. **Confidence scoring**: Returns match confidence for validation

### Example Prompt

\```
You are a MIDI parameter matching expert. Match hardware control names to plugin parameters.

Hardware Controls:
- VCF Cutoff (CC 13)
- Filter Res (CC 14)
- Env Attack (CC 53)
- LFO Rate (CC 21)

Plugin Parameters (TAL-J-8):
- [105] VCF Cutoff
- [107] VCF Resonance
- [109] VCF Envelope Amount
- [65] Attack Time
- [67] Decay Time
- [89] LFO 1 Rate
- [91] LFO 1 Amount

Return JSON with matches:
{
  "matches": [
    { "control": "VCF Cutoff", "cc": 13, "parameter": 105, "confidence": 1.0 },
    { "control": "Filter Res", "cc": 14, "parameter": 107, "confidence": 0.95 },
    ...
  ]
}
\```

      "control_name": "VCF Cutoff",

### Troubleshooting Fuzzy Matching

#### Problem: No matches found

**Causes:**
- Plugin descriptor not found
- Control names too generic ("Knob 1", "Encoder A")
- Plugin parameters unnamed or use internal IDs

**Solutions:**
\```bash
# Verify plugin descriptor exists
ls plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json

# Use more descriptive control names in hardware
# Good: "VCF Cutoff", "Resonance", "Attack"
# Bad: "Knob1", "Enc A", "Control 1"

# Manually specify parameter indices in YAML if AI fails
\```

#### Problem: Wrong parameter matched

**Causes:**
- Ambiguous control names
- Multiple parameters with similar names
- Low confidence matches

**Solutions:**
\```bash
# Review match confidence scores
# Confidence < 0.7 may indicate ambiguous match

# Use more specific control names
# Instead of: "Cutoff" ‚Üí "VCF Cutoff"
# Instead of: "Attack" ‚Üí "Env 1 Attack"

# Override matches in canonical YAML
\```

#### Problem: Claude Code CLI errors

**Causes:**
- Claude Code CLI not installed

## Phase 3: DAW Deployment

### Purpose

Convert canonical mappings into DAW-specific formats and install to appropriate directories.

### Supported DAWs

| DAW | Format | Deployer | Status |
|-----|--------|----------|--------|
| Ardour | XML | ArdourDeployer | ‚úÖ Complete |
| Ableton Live | JSON/M4L | LiveDeployer | ‚úÖ Complete (Tier 2) |
| Reaper | ReaControlMIDI | (Future) | üìã Planned |
| Bitwig | Controller Scripts | (Future) | üìã Planned |

### Ardour Deployment

#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)

\```bash
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --install
\```

#### Manual (from canonical maps)

\```bash
# Navigate to ardour-midi-maps
cd modules/audio-control/modules/ardour-midi-maps

# Generate and install
pnpm generate:install
\```

**Output:**
- **File:** `dist/ardour-maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3.map`
- **Installed:** `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/` (macOS)

**Ardour XML Structure (With Fuzzy Matching):**
\```xml
<ArdourMIDIBindings version="1.0.0" name="LCXL3 - TAL-J-8">
  <DeviceInfo bank-size="8"/>

  <!-- Filter Controls (AI-matched parameters) -->
  <Binding channel="1" ctl="13" function="plugin-parameter"
           uri="TAL-J-8/param/105"/>  <!-- VCF Cutoff -->
  <Binding channel="1" ctl="14" function="plugin-parameter"
           uri="TAL-J-8/param/107"/>  <!-- VCF Resonance -->

  <!-- Envelope Controls (AI-matched parameters) -->
  <Binding channel="1" ctl="53" function="plugin-parameter"
           uri="TAL-J-8/param/65"/>   <!-- Attack -->
  <Binding channel="1" ctl="54" function="plugin-parameter"
           uri="TAL-J-8/param/67"/>   <!-- Decay -->
</ArdourMIDIBindings>

#### Using in Ardour

2. Navigate to Control Surfaces
3. Select "Generic MIDI"
4. Choose "Novation Launch Control XL 3 - TAL-J-8" mapping
5. Select MIDI input device
6. Click "Apply"

### Ableton Live Deployment (Dual-Pipeline)

#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)

\```bash
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw live --install
\```

**What happens:**
1. Converts canonical map to plugin mapping format
2. **AI-matched parameters included in JSON**
3. Writes to `live-max-cc-router/data/plugin-mappings.json`
4. Runtime loader merges with canonical mappings
5. Max for Live device uses merged mappings

**Dual-Pipeline Architecture:**

\```
Tier 1: Canonical (Build-time)         Tier 2: Runtime (Device-extracted)
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ            ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
Source: YAML files                      Source: Controller slot
Build:  convert-canonical-maps.cjs     Extract: controller-deploy
Output: canonical-plugin-maps.ts        Output: plugin-mappings.json
                                                (with AI-matched params)

                    Runtime Merge
                    { ...canonical, ...runtime }
\```

## Common Workflows

### Workflow 1: New Plugin Mapping (Manual)

\```bash
# 1. Extract plugin parameters
cd modules/canonical-midi-maps
pnpm plugin:generate-batch

# 2. Create canonical mapping (edit YAML)
vim maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/synth-category/my-plugin.yaml

# 3. Generate Ardour map
cd ../ardour-midi-maps
pnpm generate:install

# 4. Use in Ardour
# (Select in control surface preferences)
\```

### Workflow 2: One-Click Hardware Extraction with AI Matching ‚≠ê

\```bash
# 1. Create custom mode on controller (use Novation Components)
# 2. Deploy in one command with AI-powered parameter matching
npx controller-deploy deploy \
  --slot 0 \
  --plugin "TAL-J-8" \
  --daw ardour live \
  --install \
  --output ./my-mappings

# Done! Both DAWs configured from hardware with AI-matched parameters
\```

### Workflow 3: Update Existing Mapping

\```bash
# 1. Edit canonical YAML
vim maps/novation-launch-control-xl-3/synth/my-plugin.yaml

# 2. Regenerate Ardour map
cd modules/ardour-midi-maps
pnpm generate:install

# 3. Live updates automatically (watches JSON file)
\```

### Workflow 4: Multi-Plugin Session

\```bash
# Deploy multiple plugins from controller slots with AI matching
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour live
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 1 --plugin "Mini V4" --daw ardour live
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 2 --plugin "Jup-8 V4" --daw ardour live

# All three plugins now mapped from hardware with AI-matched parameters
\```

## CLI Reference

### controller-deploy list

List connected controllers and available configurations.

\```bash
npx controller-deploy list
\```

**Output:**
\```
üì± Detected: Novation Launch Control XL 3

Available configurations:
  Slot 0: Jupiter-8 Template
  Slot 1: Minimoog Template
  Slot 2: (empty)
  Slot 3: Channel Strip
  ...
\```

### controller-deploy deploy

Deploy controller configuration to DAW(s).

**Options:**
- `-c, --controller <type>`: Controller type (auto-detect if omitted)
- `-s, --slot <number>`: Configuration slot (default: 0)
- `-d, --daw <daws...>`: Target DAWs (default: ardour)
- `-p, --plugin <name>`: Plugin name for AI parameter matching ‚≠ê
- `-m, --midi-channel <number>`: MIDI channel override
- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory for canonical YAML
- `--install`: Auto-install to DAW config directories
- `--dry-run`: Preview without deploying

**Examples:**
\```bash
# Basic deployment
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour

# Multiple DAWs
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live

# With plugin context (enables AI matching)
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour

# Save canonical and install
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --output ./mappings --install

# Preview only
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --dry-run
\```

## Troubleshooting

### Plugin Interrogation Issues

**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
\```bash
# Skip problematic plugins by editing
modules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts

const SKIP_PATTERNS = [
  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
];
\```

**Problem:** No parameters found
- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
- Verify plugin is installed correctly
- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`

### Canonical Mapping Issues

**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated

**Problem:** YAML validation errors
- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`

### Fuzzy Matching Issues

**Problem:** AI matching fails completely
- Verify Claude Code CLI is installed: `which claude`
- Check authentication: `claude auth status`
- Ensure Claude Code session is active
- Ensure plugin descriptor exists and is valid
- Check control names are descriptive (not "Knob1", "EncA")

**Problem:** Low confidence matches (< 0.7)
- Use more specific control names on hardware
- Add semantic context ("VCF Cutoff" vs "Cutoff")
- Manually override in canonical YAML if needed

**Problem:** Multiple parameters matched to same control
- Review match confidence scores in output
- Use most specific parameter name on hardware
- Manually specify correct parameter in YAML

**Problem:** Claude Code CLI not responding
- Check Claude Code is running
- Restart Claude Code session
- Verify network connectivity
- Check Claude Code status page for service issues

### Deployment Issues

**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`
- Restart Ardour after installation

**Problem:** Live mapping not working
- Check `plugin-mappings.json` syntax
- Verify runtime-loader is loading file
- Check Max for Live device logs
- Ensure plugin name matches exactly

**Problem:** Controller not detected
- Check MIDI connections (Web MIDI API requires Chrome/Edge)
- Verify controller is powered on
- Try manual adapter creation (bypass auto-detection)

## Performance Tips

### Cache Plugin Descriptors

Plugin interrogation is cached for 24 hours. To force refresh:
\```bash
rm plugin-descriptors/plugins-catalog-batch.json
pnpm plugin:generate-batch
\```

### Cache AI Matches

AI matches are saved in canonical YAML for reuse:
\```bash
# First deployment: AI matching runs (~2-5 seconds)
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --output ./cache

# Subsequent deployments: Reads from cached YAML (~instant)
npx controller-deploy deploy --input ./cache/lcxl3-jupiter8.yaml --daw ardour
\```

### Batch Deployments

Deploy multiple configurations in one script:
\```bash
#!/bin/bash
for slot in {0..3}; do
  npx controller-deploy deploy --slot $slot --daw ardour live --install
done
\```

### Validate Before Deploy

Use dry-run to verify before actual deployment:
\```bash
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --dry-run
# Review output, then run without --dry-run
npx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live --install
\```

   238‚Üí### Hardware Extraction (One-Click Deployment) ‚≠ê
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí#### Step 1: Create Custom Mode on Controller
   241‚Üí
   242‚ÜíUsing Novation Components software:
   243‚Üí1. Open Launch Control XL 3 editor
   244‚Üí2. Create new custom mode in slot 0
   245‚Üí3. Assign CC numbers to controls
   246‚Üí4. **Label each control** with parameter name
   247‚Üí5. Save to device
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí#### Step 2: Extract Configuration
   250‚Üí
   251‚Üí\```bash
   252‚Üí# List available configurations
   253‚Üínpx controller-deploy list
   254‚Üí
   255‚Üí# Output:
   256‚Üí# üì± Detected: Novation Launch Control XL 3
   257‚Üí#
   258‚Üí# Available configurations:
   259‚Üí#   Slot 0: Jupiter-8 Template
   260‚Üí#   Slot 1: Minimoog Template
   261‚Üí#   Slot 2: (empty)
   262‚Üí#   ...
   263‚Üí\```
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí#### Step 3: Deploy to DAWs
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí\```bash
   268‚Üí# Deploy single DAW
   269‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour
   270‚Üí
   271‚Üí# Deploy multiple DAWs
   272‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour live
   273‚Üí
   274‚Üí# With plugin context (triggers fuzzy matching)
   275‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy \
   276‚Üí  --slot 0 \
   277‚Üí  --plugin "TAL-J-8" \
   278‚Üí  --daw ardour live \
   279‚Üí  --install
   280‚Üí
   281‚Üí# Save canonical map for reference
   282‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy \
   283‚Üí  --slot 0 \
   284‚Üí  --output ./my-mappings \
   285‚Üí  --install
   286‚Üí\```
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí**What happens:**
   289‚Üí1. Reads custom mode from controller slot 0
   290‚Üí2. Extracts control assignments and labels
   291‚Üí3. Converts to canonical MIDI map format
   292‚Üí4. **[Phase 2.5] AI-powered fuzzy matching** (when --plugin provided)
   293‚Üí5. Deploys to specified DAWs
   294‚Üí6. Optionally saves canonical YAML
   295‚Üí
   296‚Üí## Phase 2.5: AI-Powered Fuzzy Parameter Matching ‚≠ê
   297‚Üí
   298‚Üí### Purpose
   299‚Üí
   300‚ÜíAutomatically match human-readable control names from hardware (e.g., "VCF Cutoff", "Env Attack") to plugin parameter indices using Claude AI via Claude Code CLI.
   301‚Üí
   302‚Üí### When It Runs
   303‚Üí
   304‚ÜíFuzzy matching is triggered when you provide the `--plugin` flag during deployment:
   305‚Üí
   306‚Üí\```bash
   307‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
   308‚Üí\```

   358‚Üí### Before and After
   359‚Üí
   360‚Üí#### Before Fuzzy Matching (Generic URIs)
   361‚Üí
   362‚Üí\```yaml
   363‚Üícontrols:
   364‚Üí  - id: encoder_1

   366‚Üí    cc: 13
   367‚Üí    # No plugin_parameter field
   368‚Üí\```
   369‚Üí
   370‚Üí**Ardour Output:**
   371‚Üí\```xml
   372‚Üí<Binding channel="1" ctl="13" function="track-set-gain[1]"/>
   373‚Üí<!-- Generic function, not plugin-specific -->
   374‚Üí\```
   375‚Üí
   376‚Üí#### After Fuzzy Matching (Plugin-Specific URIs)
   377‚Üí
   378‚Üí\```yaml
   379‚Üícontrols:
   380‚Üí  - id: encoder_1
   381‚Üí    name: VCF Cutoff        # From hardware
   382‚Üí    cc: 13

   384‚Üí\```
   385‚Üí
   386‚Üí**Ardour Output:**
   387‚Üí\```xml
   388‚Üí<Binding channel="1" ctl="13" function="plugin-parameter"
   389‚Üí         uri="TAL-J-8/param/105"/>  <!-- VCF Cutoff -->
   390‚Üí<!-- Plugin-specific parameter binding -->
   391‚Üí\```
   392‚Üí
   393‚Üí### Integration Method
   394‚Üí
   395‚ÜíThe parameter matching service integrates with Claude AI exclusively through the Claude Code CLI:
   396‚Üí
   397‚Üí\```typescript
   398‚Üí// Shell out to Claude Code CLI
   399‚Üíconst result = await execAsync(
   400‚Üí  `claude --prompt "Match these control names to plugin parameters: ${JSON.stringify(controls)}" --plugin-descriptor ${descriptorPath}`
   401‚Üí);
   402‚Üí\```
   403‚Üí
   404‚Üí**Requirements:**
   405‚Üí- Claude Code CLI installed and authenticated
   406‚Üí- Claude Code session active
   407‚Üí
   408‚Üí**Note:** The original implementation planned to support direct Anthropic API calls, but the production implementation uses Claude Code CLI exclusively for authentication simplicity and consistency with the Claude Code ecosystem.
   409‚Üí
   410‚Üí### Matching Algorithm
   411‚Üí
   412‚ÜíClaude AI analyzes:
   413‚Üí1. **Semantic similarity**: "VCF Cutoff" matches "VCF Cutoff" (exact)
   414‚Üí2. **Abbreviations**: "Filter Res" matches "VCF Resonance"
   415‚Üí3. **Synonyms**: "Env Attack" matches "Attack Time"
   416‚Üí4. **Context**: Groups related parameters (filters, envelopes, etc.)
   417‚Üí5. **Confidence scoring**: Returns match confidence for validation
   418‚Üí
   419‚Üí### Example Prompt
   420‚Üí
   421‚Üí\```
   422‚ÜíYou are a MIDI parameter matching expert. Match hardware control names to plugin parameters.
   423‚Üí
   424‚ÜíHardware Controls:
   425‚Üí- VCF Cutoff (CC 13)
   426‚Üí- Filter Res (CC 14)
   427‚Üí- Env Attack (CC 53)
   428‚Üí- LFO Rate (CC 21)
   429‚Üí
   430‚ÜíPlugin Parameters (TAL-J-8):
   431‚Üí- [105] VCF Cutoff
   432‚Üí- [107] VCF Resonance
   433‚Üí- [109] VCF Envelope Amount
   434‚Üí- [65] Attack Time
   435‚Üí- [67] Decay Time
   436‚Üí- [89] LFO 1 Rate
   437‚Üí- [91] LFO 1 Amount
   438‚Üí
   439‚ÜíReturn JSON with matches:
   440‚Üí{
   441‚Üí  "matches": [
   442‚Üí    { "control": "VCF Cutoff", "cc": 13, "parameter": 105, "confidence": 1.0 },
   443‚Üí    { "control": "Filter Res", "cc": 14, "parameter": 107, "confidence": 0.95 },
   444‚Üí    ...
   445‚Üí  ]
   446‚Üí}
   447‚Üí\```

   483‚Üí### Troubleshooting Fuzzy Matching
   484‚Üí
   485‚Üí#### Problem: No matches found
   486‚Üí
   487‚Üí**Causes:**
   488‚Üí- Plugin descriptor not found
   489‚Üí- Control names too generic ("Knob 1", "Encoder A")
   490‚Üí- Plugin parameters unnamed or use internal IDs
   491‚Üí
   492‚Üí**Solutions:**
   493‚Üí\```bash
   494‚Üí# Verify plugin descriptor exists
   495‚Üíls plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json
   496‚Üí
   497‚Üí# Use more descriptive control names in hardware
   498‚Üí# Good: "VCF Cutoff", "Resonance", "Attack"
   499‚Üí# Bad: "Knob1", "Enc A", "Control 1"
   500‚Üí
   501‚Üí# Manually specify parameter indices in YAML if AI fails
   502‚Üí\```
   503‚Üí
   504‚Üí#### Problem: Wrong parameter matched
   505‚Üí
   506‚Üí**Causes:**
   507‚Üí- Ambiguous control names
   508‚Üí- Multiple parameters with similar names
   509‚Üí- Low confidence matches
   510‚Üí
   511‚Üí**Solutions:**
   512‚Üí\```bash
   513‚Üí# Review match confidence scores
   514‚Üí# Confidence < 0.7 may indicate ambiguous match
   515‚Üí
   516‚Üí# Use more specific control names
   517‚Üí# Instead of: "Cutoff" ‚Üí "VCF Cutoff"
   518‚Üí# Instead of: "Attack" ‚Üí "Env 1 Attack"
   519‚Üí
   520‚Üí# Override matches in canonical YAML
   521‚Üí\```
   522‚Üí
   523‚Üí#### Problem: Claude Code CLI errors
   524‚Üí
   525‚Üí**Causes:**
   526‚Üí- Claude Code CLI not installed
   527‚Üí- Not authenticated with Claude Code
   528‚Üí- Claude Code session expired
   529‚Üí
   530‚Üí**Solutions:**
   531‚Üí\```bash
   532‚Üí# Verify CLI installed
   533‚Üíwhich claude  # Should show path to CLI
   534‚Üí
   535‚Üí# Check version
   536‚Üíclaude --version
   537‚Üí
   538‚Üí# Authenticate if needed
   539‚Üíclaude auth login
   540‚Üí
   541‚Üí# Verify authentication
   542‚Üíclaude auth status
   543‚Üí\```
   544‚Üí
   545‚Üí#### Problem: Slow matching performance
   546‚Üí
   547‚Üí**Solutions:**
   548‚Üí\```bash
   549‚Üí# Cache matches for reuse
   550‚Üí# Matches saved in canonical YAML
   551‚Üí
   552‚Üí# Batch multiple controls in single API call
   553‚Üí# Faster than individual requests
   554‚Üí
   555‚Üí# Use local descriptor cache
   556‚Üí# Avoid re-reading descriptor files
   557‚Üí\```

   559‚Üí## Phase 3: DAW Deployment
   560‚Üí
   561‚Üí### Purpose
   562‚Üí
   563‚ÜíConvert canonical mappings into DAW-specific formats and install to appropriate directories.
   564‚Üí
   565‚Üí### Supported DAWs
   566‚Üí
   567‚Üí| DAW | Format | Deployer | Status |
   568‚Üí|-----|--------|----------|--------|
   569‚Üí| Ardour | XML | ArdourDeployer | ‚úÖ Complete |
   570‚Üí| Ableton Live | JSON/M4L | LiveDeployer | ‚úÖ Complete (Tier 2) |
   571‚Üí| Reaper | ReaControlMIDI | (Future) | üìã Planned |
   572‚Üí| Bitwig | Controller Scripts | (Future) | üìã Planned |
   573‚Üí
   574‚Üí### Ardour Deployment
   575‚Üí
   576‚Üí#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)
   577‚Üí
   578‚Üí\```bash
   579‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw ardour --install
   580‚Üí\```
   581‚Üí
   582‚Üí#### Manual (from canonical maps)

   624‚Üí### Ableton Live Deployment (Dual-Pipeline)
   625‚Üí
   626‚Üí#### Automatic (via controller-deploy)
   627‚Üí
   628‚Üí\```bash
   629‚Üínpx controller-deploy deploy --slot 0 --daw live --install
   630‚Üí\```
   631‚Üí
   632‚Üí**What happens:**
   633‚Üí1. Converts canonical map to plugin mapping format
   634‚Üí2. **AI-matched parameters included in JSON**
   635‚Üí3. Writes to `live-max-cc-router/data/plugin-mappings.json`
   636‚Üí4. Runtime loader merges with canonical mappings
   637‚Üí5. Max for Live device uses merged mappings
   638‚Üí
   639‚Üí**Dual-Pipeline Architecture:**
   640‚Üí
   641‚Üí\```
   642‚ÜíTier 1: Canonical (Build-time)         Tier 2: Runtime (Device-extracted)
   643‚Üí‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ            ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
   644‚ÜíSource: YAML files                      Source: Controller slot
   645‚ÜíBuild:  convert-canonical-maps.cjs     Extract: controller-deploy
   646‚ÜíOutput: canonical-plugin-maps.ts        Output: plugin-mappings.json
   647‚Üí                                                (with AI-matched params)
   648‚Üí
   649‚Üí                    Runtime Merge
   650‚Üí                    { ...canonical, ...runtime }
   651‚Üí\```
   652‚Üí
   653‚ÜíSee [live-deployer/architecture.md](./live-deployer/architecture.md) for details.

   811‚Üí## Troubleshooting
   812‚Üí
   813‚Üí### Plugin Interrogation Issues
   814‚Üí
   815‚Üí**Problem:** Plugin crashes during scan
   816‚Üí\```bash
   817‚Üí# Skip problematic plugins by editing
   818‚Üímodules/canonical-midi-maps/src/tools/batch-plugin-generator.ts
   819‚Üí
   820‚Üíconst SKIP_PATTERNS = [
   821‚Üí  /UAD/i,           # Universal Audio plugins
   822‚Üí  /Waves/i,         # Waves plugins (if problematic)
   823‚Üí  /YourPlugin/i     # Add problematic plugin
   824‚Üí];
   825‚Üí\```
   826‚Üí
   827‚Üí**Problem:** No parameters found
   828‚Üí- Check plugin format (VST3 required)
   829‚Üí- Verify plugin is installed correctly
   830‚Üí- Try manual interrogation: `plughost --interrogate /path/to/plugin.vst3`
   831‚Üí
   832‚Üí### Canonical Mapping Issues
   833‚Üí
   834‚Üí**Problem:** Wrong parameter indices
   835‚Üí- Verify plugin descriptor exists and is current
   836‚Üí- Check parameter index in descriptor JSON
   837‚Üí- Regenerate descriptor if plugin was updated
   838‚Üí
   839‚Üí**Problem:** YAML validation errors
   840‚Üí- Check YAML syntax (indentation, colons, quotes)
   841‚Üí- Verify required fields (version, device, plugin, controls)
   842‚Üí- Use YAML validator: `npx js-yaml --validate mapping.yaml`
   843‚Üí
   844‚Üí### Fuzzy Matching Issues
   845‚Üí
   846‚Üí**Problem:** AI matching fails completely
   847‚Üí- Verify Claude Code CLI is installed: `which claude`
   848‚Üí- Check authentication: `claude auth status`
   849‚Üí- Ensure Claude Code session is active
   850‚Üí- Ensure plugin descriptor exists and is valid
   851‚Üí- Check control names are descriptive (not "Knob1", "EncA")
   852‚Üí
   853‚Üí**Problem:** Low confidence matches (< 0.7)
   854‚Üí- Use more specific control names on hardware
   855‚Üí- Add semantic context ("VCF Cutoff" vs "Cutoff")
   856‚Üí- Manually override in canonical YAML if needed
   857‚Üí
   858‚Üí**Problem:** Multiple parameters matched to same control
   859‚Üí- Review match confidence scores in output
   860‚Üí- Use most specific parameter name on hardware
   861‚Üí- Manually specify correct parameter in YAML
   862‚Üí
   863‚Üí**Problem:** Claude Code CLI not responding
   864‚Üí- Check Claude Code is running
   865‚Üí- Restart Claude Code session
   866‚Üí- Verify network connectivity
   867‚Üí- Check Claude Code status page for service issues
   868‚Üí
   869‚Üí### Deployment Issues
   870‚Üí
   871‚Üí**Problem:** Ardour map not appearing
   872‚Üí- Check installation path: `~/Library/Preferences/Ardour8/midi_maps/`
   873‚Üí- Verify XML is valid: `xmllint --noout mapping.map`

**Feature:** AI-powered parameter matching between hardware control names and plugin parameters
**Version:** 1.21

## Overview

This document provides comprehensive end-to-end testing procedures for the fuzzy parameter matching feature, which uses Claude AI to intelligently map hardware controller control names to audio plugin parameters.

### Feature Description

The parameter matching feature enables:
- **Semantic matching** of control names to plugin parameters (e.g., "Filter Cutoff" ‚Üí "Cutoff Frequency")
- **Abbreviation recognition** (e.g., "Res" ‚Üí "Resonance", "Env" ‚Üí "Envelope Attack")
- **Confidence scoring** for each match (0.0 to 1.0 scale)
- **Graceful degradation** when Claude CLI is unavailable or matching fails
- **Plugin descriptor integration** using canonical-midi-maps registry

### Testing Objectives

1. **Validate core matching logic** with real hardware and plugin data
2. **Verify error handling** for edge cases and failure modes
3. **Measure performance** and ensure acceptable response times
4. **Confirm output quality** in canonical YAML and DAW-specific formats

## Troubleshooting Guide

### Issue: Claude CLI Not Found

**Symptoms:**
\```
‚ö† AI matching failed: Failed to spawn Claude CLI: spawn claude ENOENT
\```

**Solutions:**
1. Verify Claude CLI installation: `which claude`
2. Install Claude CLI if missing: Follow installation guide at https://claude.ai/cli
3. Verify authentication: `claude --version`
4. Check PATH: `echo $PATH` should include Claude CLI directory

### Issue: Plugin Descriptor Not Found

**Symptoms:**
\```
‚ö† AI matching failed: Plugin descriptor not found for "PluginName"
\```

**Solutions:**
1. List available descriptors:
   \```bash
   ls -la modules/canonical-midi-maps/plugin-descriptors/
   \```
2. Create missing descriptor:
   \```bash
   # Create descriptor file at:
   # modules/canonical-midi-maps/plugin-descriptors/{manufacturer}-{plugin}.json
   \```
3. Verify descriptor structure matches schema
4. Use exact plugin name or normalized name (lowercase, hyphens)

### Issue: Low Match Rate

**Symptoms:**
- Match rate < 50%
- Many controls with confidence < 0.6

**Possible Causes:**
1. Control names are too generic (e.g., "Knob 1", "Encoder A")
2. Plugin parameter names don't match control names
3. Plugin descriptor has incorrect parameter names

**Solutions:**
1. Rename controls on hardware to be more descriptive
2. Update plugin descriptor with accurate parameter names
3. Lower confidence threshold (use at your own risk):
   \```typescript
   // In ParameterMatcher constructor
   this.minConfidence = 0.4; // Lower threshold
   \```

### Issue: Slow AI Matching

**Symptoms:**
- Claude AI step takes > 10 seconds
- Timeout errors

**Solutions:**
1. Check internet connectivity (Claude API requires network)
2. Increase timeout in ParameterMatcher:
   \```typescript
   this.timeout = 60000; // 60 second timeout
   \```
3. Reduce number of parameters in plugin descriptor
4. Use caching for repeated matches (future enhancement)

### Issue: Malformed JSON Response

**Symptoms:**
\```
‚ö† AI matching failed: Could not find JSON array in Claude response
\```

**Possible Causes:**
1. Claude returned explanation text instead of JSON
2. Network issues caused truncated response
3. Prompt was unclear or ambiguous

**Solutions:**
1. Check Claude CLI is up to date: `claude --version`
2. Retry the operation (transient network issues)
3. Review Claude response in debug logs
4. Adjust system prompt for clearer instructions

### Issue: Hardware Not Detected

**Symptoms:**
\```
Error: No supported controller detected
\```

**Solutions:**
1. Check USB connection
2. Verify device appears in system:
   \```bash
   # macOS
   ls /dev/cu.usbmodem*

   # Linux
   ls /dev/midi*
   \```
3. Restart device (power cycle)
4. Check device is in correct mode (not in bootloader/DFU mode)

# Feature 360 Architecture

**Version:** 1.21
**Status:** In Progress
**Last Updated:** 2025-10-12

## Overview

The 360 feature implements a modular, extensible architecture for deploying MIDI controller configurations to multiple DAWs. The design follows interface-first principles with clear separation of concerns across four main layers:

1. **Controller Abstraction Layer** - Hardware interrogation and configuration extraction
2. **Canonical Conversion Layer** - Format translation to universal MIDI mappings
3. **Parameter Matching Layer** - AI-powered fuzzy matching of control names to plugin parameters
4. **DAW Deployment Layer** - Platform-specific map generation and installation

## Core Components

### 1. Controller-Workflow Module

**Purpose:** Generic framework for controller ‚Üí DAW deployment

**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/`

**Key Abstractions:**

\```typescript
// Controller interrogation interface
interface ControllerAdapterInterface {
  connect(): Promise<void>;
  listConfigurations(): Promise<ConfigurationSlot[]>;
  readConfiguration(slot: number): Promise<ControllerConfiguration>;
}

// Canonical conversion interface
interface CanonicalConverterInterface {
  convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap;
  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean;
}

// Parameter matching interface (NEW)
interface ParameterMatcherInterface {
  matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor
  ): Promise<ParameterMatch[]>;
  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;
}

// DAW deployment interface
interface DAWDeployerInterface {
  deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult>;
  isInstalled(): Promise<boolean>;
}
\```

**Design Principles:**
- **Interface-first:** All adapters implement well-defined interfaces
- **Dependency injection:** Components accept dependencies via constructor
- **Factory pattern:** Auto-detection and instantiation via factories
- **Event-driven:** Progress reporting via EventEmitter
- **AI-augmented:** Optional Claude Code CLI integration for parameter matching

See [implementation/workplan.md](./implementation/workplan.md) for detailed design.

### 2. Launch Control XL3 Adapter

**Purpose:** Reference implementation for Novation Launch Control XL 3

**Location:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/adapters/controllers/LaunchControlXL3Adapter.ts`

**Capabilities:**
- Read all 16 custom mode slots
- Extract control configurations (48 controls: 24 encoders, 8 sliders, 16 buttons)
- Map LCXL3-specific IDs (SEND_A1, FADER1, etc.) to generic control types
- Wrapper around existing launch-control-xl3 library

**Control Mapping:**
\```

### 3. Canonical MIDI Maps

**Purpose:** Universal MIDI mapping format (DAW-agnostic)

**Location:** `modules/canonical-midi-maps/`

**Format:** YAML

**Structure:**
\```yaml
version: 1.0.0

device:
  manufacturer: Novation
  model: Launch Control XL 3

plugin:
  manufacturer: TAL Software
  name: TAL-J-8
  descriptor: plugin-descriptors/tal-togu-audio-line-tal-j-8.json

metadata:
  name: Jupiter-8 Template
  description: Controls for TAL-J-8 synth
  date: 2025-10-12
  aiMatchingEnabled: true  # NEW: Indicates fuzzy matching was used

midi_channel: 1  # Global MIDI channel

controls:
  - id: encoder_1
    name: VCF Cutoff
    type: encoder
    cc: 13
    channel: 1
    plugin_parameter: 105      # Added by AI matcher
    match_confidence: 1.0       # NEW: Match quality
    range: [0, 127]
\```

**Key Features:**
- **Real parameter indices:** Uses plugin descriptors for accurate mappings
- **Hardware abstraction:** Generic control IDs work across devices
- **Plugin awareness:** Links to plugin descriptors for validation
- **Metadata rich:** Version tracking, tags, creation dates
- **AI-enhanced:** Optional fuzzy matching with confidence scores

See [project ARCHITECTURE.md](../../ARCHITECTURE.md) for component relationships.

**Key Capabilities:**

1. **Semantic Matching**
   - Exact matches: "VCF Cutoff" ‚Üí "VCF Cutoff"
   - Abbreviations: "Filter Res" ‚Üí "VCF Resonance"
   - Synonyms: "Env Attack" ‚Üí "Attack Time"
   - Context-aware: Groups related parameters

2. **Integration Method**
   - **Claude Code CLI:** Exclusively uses Claude Code CLI for AI integration
   - **Authentication:** Leverages Claude Code's built-in authentication
   - **Caching:** Results cached in canonical YAML for performance

3. **Confidence Scoring**
   - 1.0: Exact string match
   - 0.9-0.99: High confidence (clear synonym)
   - 0.7-0.89: Medium confidence (abbreviation/context)
   - < 0.7: Low confidence (ambiguous match)

4. **Error Handling**
   - Graceful degradation if CLI unavailable
   - Retry logic with exponential backoff
   - Cache results for performance
   - Manual override support

**Interface:**

\```typescript
interface ParameterMatcherInterface {
  /**
   * Match control names to plugin parameters using AI
   */
  matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options?: MatchOptions
  ): Promise<ParameterMatch[]>;

  /**
   * Get match confidence score (0-1)
   */
  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;

  /**
   * Check if matcher is available (CLI installed and authenticated)
   */
  isAvailable(): Promise<boolean>;
}

interface ParameterMatch {
  controlName: string;
  controlCC: number;
  parameterIndex: number;
  parameterName: string;
  confidence: number;
  matchType: 'exact' | 'abbreviation' | 'synonym' | 'context';
}

interface MatchOptions {
  confidenceThreshold?: number;  // Default: 0.7
  enableCaching?: boolean;        // Default: true
  model?: string;                 // Default: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022'
}
\```

**Example Usage:**

\```typescript
import { ParameterMatcher } from '@/services/ParameterMatcher';

const matcher = new ParameterMatcher({
  useCLI: true  // Uses Claude Code CLI
});

// Load plugin descriptor
const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');

// Extract control names from hardware
const controlNames = ['VCF Cutoff', 'Filter Res', 'Env Attack'];

// Match parameters
const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);

// Apply matches to canonical map
for (const match of matches) {
  const control = canonicalMap.controls.find(c => c.name === match.controlName);
  if (control && match.confidence >= 0.7) {
    control.plugin_parameter = match.parameterIndex;
    control.match_confidence = match.confidence;
  }
}
\```

**Performance:**
- Single CLI call batches all controls
- Results cached in canonical YAML
- Typical matching time: 2-5 seconds
- Subsequent deployments: instant (uses cache)

**Dependencies:**
- Claude Code CLI (required)
- Plugin descriptor files (from Phase 1)

## Extensibility

### Adding a New Controller

1. **Implement ControllerAdapter:**
   \```typescript
   export class NewControllerAdapter implements ControllerAdapterInterface {
     // Implement all interface methods
   }
   \```

2. **Implement CanonicalConverter:**
   \```typescript
   export class NewControllerConverter implements CanonicalConverterInterface {
     convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap {
       // Device-specific ‚Üí canonical mapping
     }
   }
   \```

3. **Register in Workflow:**
   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.detectController()`
   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.getConverterFor()`

**No changes required:** Orchestrator, CLI, DAW deployers, and AI matcher all work generically.

### Adding a New DAW

1. **Implement DAWDeployer:**
   \```typescript
   export class NewDAWDeployer implements DAWDeployerInterface {
     async deploy(canonicalMap: CanonicalMidiMap, options: DeploymentOptions): Promise<DeploymentResult> {
       // Generate DAW-specific format
       // AI-matched plugin_parameter fields available in canonicalMap
     }
   }
   \```

2. **Register in Workflow:**
   - Update `DeploymentWorkflow.create()` to include new deployer

**No changes required:** Controller adapters, converters, orchestrator, and AI matcher all work generically.

## Design Patterns

### Interface-First Design

All major components define interfaces before implementation:
- Enables testing with mocks
- Clear contracts between layers
- Easier to extend and maintain
- AI matcher is optional dependency

### Dependency Injection

\```typescript
export class DeploymentWorkflow {
  constructor(
    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
    private parameterMatcher: ParameterMatcherInterface,  // NEW
    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
  ) {}
}
\```

Benefits:
- Testable (inject mocks)
- Flexible (swap implementations)
- Follows project guidelines
- AI matcher can be replaced or disabled

### Factory Pattern

\```typescript
static async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
  const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
  const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
  const matcher = options.enableAIMatching
    ? new ParameterMatcher()
    : new NoOpMatcher();  // Graceful degradation
  const deployers = new Map();
  // ...
  return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, matcher, deployers);
}
\```

Benefits:
- Auto-detection of hardware
- Simplified instantiation
- Encapsulates complexity
- Optional AI matching

### Event-Driven Progress

\```typescript
workflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
  console.log(`[${step}/4] ${message}`);  // Updated for AI matching step
});

workflow.on('ai-matching', ({ controlCount, duration }) => {
  console.log(`AI matched ${controlCount} parameters in ${duration}ms`);
});

workflow.on('canonical-saved', ({ path }) => {
  console.log(`Saved: ${path}`);
});
\```

Benefits:
- Real-time feedback
- Decoupled UI/logging
- Extensible event system
- AI matching progress visibility

## Performance Considerations

### Target Metrics

| Operation | Target | Current Status |
|-----------|--------|----------------|
| Controller read | <2s | ‚úÖ Sub-second |
| Canonical conversion | <100ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
| AI parameter matching | <5s | ‚è≥ In progress |
| Ardour XML generation | <50ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
| Live JSON write | <20ms | ‚úÖ Instant |
| End-to-end workflow | <10s | ‚è≥ Not measured (~6s with AI) |

### Optimization Strategies

- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
- **AI result caching:** Matched parameters saved in canonical YAML
- **Batch matching:** All controls matched in single CLI call
- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks
- **Graceful degradation:** Falls back to generic mappings if AI unavailable

## Security Considerations

- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
- **Authentication:** Leverages Claude Code's secure authentication
- **Command execution:** Only trusted Claude Code CLI commands
- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options
- **AI prompts:** Input validation to prevent prompt injection
- **Rate limiting:** Respects Claude Code CLI rate limits

   240‚Üí**Key Capabilities:**
   241‚Üí
   242‚Üí1. **Semantic Matching**
   243‚Üí   - Exact matches: "VCF Cutoff" ‚Üí "VCF Cutoff"
   244‚Üí   - Abbreviations: "Filter Res" ‚Üí "VCF Resonance"
   245‚Üí   - Synonyms: "Env Attack" ‚Üí "Attack Time"
   246‚Üí   - Context-aware: Groups related parameters
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí2. **Integration Method**
   249‚Üí   - **Claude Code CLI:** Exclusively uses Claude Code CLI for AI integration
   250‚Üí   - **Authentication:** Leverages Claude Code's built-in authentication
   251‚Üí   - **Caching:** Results cached in canonical YAML for performance
   252‚Üí
   253‚Üí3. **Confidence Scoring**
   254‚Üí   - 1.0: Exact string match
   255‚Üí   - 0.9-0.99: High confidence (clear synonym)
   256‚Üí   - 0.7-0.89: Medium confidence (abbreviation/context)
   257‚Üí   - < 0.7: Low confidence (ambiguous match)
   258‚Üí
   259‚Üí4. **Error Handling**
   260‚Üí   - Graceful degradation if CLI unavailable
   261‚Üí   - Retry logic with exponential backoff
   262‚Üí   - Cache results for performance
   263‚Üí   - Manual override support
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí**Interface:**
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí\```typescript
   268‚Üíinterface ParameterMatcherInterface {
   269‚Üí  /**
   270‚Üí   * Match control names to plugin parameters using AI
   271‚Üí   */
   272‚Üí  matchParameters(
   273‚Üí    controlNames: string[],
   274‚Üí    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
   275‚Üí    options?: MatchOptions
   276‚Üí  ): Promise<ParameterMatch[]>;
   277‚Üí
   278‚Üí  /**
   279‚Üí   * Get match confidence score (0-1)
   280‚Üí   */
   281‚Üí  getConfidence(match: ParameterMatch): number;
   282‚Üí
   283‚Üí  /**
   284‚Üí   * Check if matcher is available (CLI installed and authenticated)
   285‚Üí   */
   286‚Üí  isAvailable(): Promise<boolean>;
   287‚Üí}
   288‚Üí
   289‚Üíinterface ParameterMatch {
   290‚Üí  controlName: string;
   291‚Üí  controlCC: number;
   292‚Üí  parameterIndex: number;
   293‚Üí  parameterName: string;
   294‚Üí  confidence: number;
   295‚Üí  matchType: 'exact' | 'abbreviation' | 'synonym' | 'context';
   296‚Üí}
   297‚Üí
   298‚Üíinterface MatchOptions {
   299‚Üí  confidenceThreshold?: number;  // Default: 0.7
   300‚Üí  enableCaching?: boolean;        // Default: true
   301‚Üí  model?: string;                 // Default: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022'
   302‚Üí}
   303‚Üí\```
   304‚Üí
   305‚Üí**Example Usage:**
   306‚Üí
   307‚Üí\```typescript
   308‚Üíimport { ParameterMatcher } from '@/services/ParameterMatcher';
   309‚Üí
   310‚Üíconst matcher = new ParameterMatcher({
   311‚Üí  useCLI: true  // Uses Claude Code CLI
   312‚Üí});
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí// Load plugin descriptor
   315‚Üíconst descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor('tal-j-8');
   316‚Üí
   317‚Üí// Extract control names from hardware
   318‚Üíconst controlNames = ['VCF Cutoff', 'Filter Res', 'Env Attack'];
   319‚Üí
   320‚Üí// Match parameters
   321‚Üíconst matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
   322‚Üí
   323‚Üí// Apply matches to canonical map
   324‚Üífor (const match of matches) {
   325‚Üí  const control = canonicalMap.controls.find(c => c.name === match.controlName);
   326‚Üí  if (control && match.confidence >= 0.7) {
   327‚Üí    control.plugin_parameter = match.parameterIndex;
   328‚Üí    control.match_confidence = match.confidence;
   329‚Üí  }
   330‚Üí}
   331‚Üí\```
   332‚Üí
   333‚Üí**Performance:**
   334‚Üí- Single CLI call batches all controls
   335‚Üí- Results cached in canonical YAML
   336‚Üí- Typical matching time: 2-5 seconds
   337‚Üí- Subsequent deployments: instant (uses cache)
   338‚Üí
   339‚Üí**Dependencies:**
   340‚Üí- Claude Code CLI (required)
   341‚Üí- Plugin descriptor files (from Phase 1)

   377‚Üí
   378‚Üí**Architecture:** Two-tier mapping system with AI matching
   379‚Üí
   380‚Üí\```
   381‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   382‚Üí‚îÇ                    Dual-Pipeline System                    ‚îÇ
   383‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   384‚Üí
   385‚ÜíTier 1: Canonical (Build-time)                 Tier 2: Runtime (Device-extracted + AI)
   386‚Üí‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ                    ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
   387‚ÜíSource: YAML files                              Source: Hardware custom modes
   388‚Üí        (version-controlled)                             (extracted via LiveDeployer)
   389‚Üí
   390‚ÜíBuild:  convert-canonical-maps.cjs              Extract: controller-deploy deploy
   391‚Üí        ‚Üì                                       AI Match: ParameterMatcher (CLI)
   392‚ÜíOutput: canonical-plugin-maps.ts                        ‚Üì
   393‚Üí                                                Output:  plugin-mappings.json
   394‚Üí                                                         (with AI-matched params)
   395‚Üí
   396‚ÜíLoad:   Import at compile-time                  Load:    Runtime JSON parsing
   397‚Üí        (build artifact)                                 (runtime-loader.ts)
   398‚Üí
   399‚ÜíUpdates: Via PR/commit workflow                 Updates: One-click from hardware
   400‚Üí
   401‚Üí                              Runtime Merge
   402‚Üí                              ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
   403‚Üí                    { ...CANONICAL_PLUGIN_MAPS, ...runtimeMaps }
   404‚Üí                              (runtime wins, includes AI matches)
   405‚Üí\```
   406‚Üí
   407‚Üí**Benefits:**
   408‚Üí- **Tier 1** provides curated, version-controlled defaults
   409‚Üí- **Tier 2** enables one-click deployment with AI parameter matching via Claude Code CLI
   410‚Üí- **No conflicts** with build pipeline (separate data files)
   411‚Üí- **Runtime override** allows user customization
   412‚Üí- **AI-enhanced** parameter bindings for better plugin control
   413‚Üí
   414‚ÜíSee [live-deployer/architecture.md](./live-deployer/architecture.md) for details.

   549‚Üí## Design Patterns
   550‚Üí
   551‚Üí### Interface-First Design
   552‚Üí
   553‚ÜíAll major components define interfaces before implementation:
   554‚Üí- Enables testing with mocks
   555‚Üí- Clear contracts between layers
   556‚Üí- Easier to extend and maintain
   557‚Üí- AI matcher is optional dependency
   558‚Üí
   559‚Üí### Dependency Injection
   560‚Üí
   561‚Üí\```typescript
   562‚Üíexport class DeploymentWorkflow {
   563‚Üí  constructor(
   564‚Üí    private controllerAdapter: ControllerAdapterInterface,
   565‚Üí    private converter: CanonicalConverterInterface,
   566‚Üí    private parameterMatcher: ParameterMatcherInterface,  // NEW
   567‚Üí    private deployers: Map<string, DAWDeployerInterface>
   568‚Üí  ) {}
   569‚Üí}
   570‚Üí\```
   571‚Üí
   572‚ÜíBenefits:
   573‚Üí- Testable (inject mocks)
   574‚Üí- Flexible (swap implementations)
   575‚Üí- Follows project guidelines
   576‚Üí- AI matcher can be replaced or disabled
   577‚Üí
   578‚Üí### Factory Pattern
   579‚Üí
   580‚Üí\```typescript
   581‚Üístatic async create(options: CreateOptions): Promise<DeploymentWorkflow> {
   582‚Üí  const adapter = options.controllerAdapter || await this.detectController();
   583‚Üí  const converter = this.getConverterFor(adapter);
   584‚Üí  const matcher = options.enableAIMatching
   585‚Üí    ? new ParameterMatcher()
   586‚Üí    : new NoOpMatcher();  // Graceful degradation
   587‚Üí  const deployers = new Map();
   588‚Üí  // ...
   589‚Üí  return new DeploymentWorkflow(adapter, converter, matcher, deployers);
   590‚Üí}
   591‚Üí\```
   592‚Üí
   593‚ÜíBenefits:
   594‚Üí- Auto-detection of hardware
   595‚Üí- Simplified instantiation
   596‚Üí- Encapsulates complexity
   597‚Üí- Optional AI matching
   598‚Üí
   599‚Üí### Event-Driven Progress
   600‚Üí
   601‚Üí\```typescript
   602‚Üíworkflow.on('progress', ({ step, message }) => {
   603‚Üí  console.log(`[${step}/4] ${message}`);  // Updated for AI matching step
   604‚Üí});
   605‚Üí
   606‚Üíworkflow.on('ai-matching', ({ controlCount, duration }) => {
   607‚Üí  console.log(`AI matched ${controlCount} parameters in ${duration}ms`);
   608‚Üí});
   609‚Üí
   610‚Üíworkflow.on('canonical-saved', ({ path }) => {
   611‚Üí  console.log(`Saved: ${path}`);
   612‚Üí});
   613‚Üí\```
   614‚Üí
   615‚ÜíBenefits:
   616‚Üí- Real-time feedback
   617‚Üí- Decoupled UI/logging
   618‚Üí- Extensible event system
   619‚Üí- AI matching progress visibility
   620‚Üí
   621‚Üí## Performance Considerations
   622‚Üí
   623‚Üí### Target Metrics
   624‚Üí
   625‚Üí| Operation | Target | Current Status |
   626‚Üí|-----------|--------|----------------|
   627‚Üí| Controller read | <2s | ‚úÖ Sub-second |
   628‚Üí| Canonical conversion | <100ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
   629‚Üí| AI parameter matching | <5s | ‚è≥ In progress |
   630‚Üí| Ardour XML generation | <50ms | ‚è≥ Not measured |
   631‚Üí| Live JSON write | <20ms | ‚úÖ Instant |
   632‚Üí| End-to-end workflow | <10s | ‚è≥ Not measured (~6s with AI) |
   633‚Üí
   634‚Üí### Optimization Strategies
   635‚Üí
   636‚Üí- **Caching:** Controller configurations cached between deployments
   637‚Üí- **AI result caching:** Matched parameters saved in canonical YAML
   638‚Üí- **Batch matching:** All controls matched in single CLI call
   639‚Üí- **Lazy loading:** DAW deployers loaded on-demand
   640‚Üí- **Async operations:** Non-blocking I/O for file operations
   641‚Üí- **Streaming:** Large maps processed in chunks
   642‚Üí- **Graceful degradation:** Falls back to generic mappings if AI unavailable
   643‚Üí
   644‚Üí## Security Considerations
   645‚Üí
   646‚Üí- **File system access:** Validates output paths before writing
   647‚Üí- **MIDI input:** Validates SysEx messages before parsing
   648‚Üí- **Authentication:** Leverages Claude Code's secure authentication
   649‚Üí- **Command execution:** Only trusted Claude Code CLI commands
   650‚Üí- **Path traversal:** Sanitizes file paths in output directory options
   651‚Üí- **AI prompts:** Input validation to prevent prompt injection
   652‚Üí- **Rate limiting:** Respects Claude Code CLI rate limits

# Feature 360: MIDI Controller ‚Üí DAW Deployment Pipeline

**Version:** 1.21
**Status:** 90% Complete (Hardware Validated + AI Matching)
**Branch:** `feat/cc-mapping-360`

## Overview

The 360 feature provides a complete "round-trip" workflow for deploying MIDI controller configurations to multiple DAWs. The name "360" reflects the comprehensive, full-circle nature of the workflow: extract configuration from hardware ‚Üí convert to canonical format ‚Üí deploy to any supported DAW.

### Key Capabilities

1. **Device Interrogation**: Read custom mode configurations from MIDI controllers
2. **Canonical Mapping**: Convert device-specific formats to universal canonical MIDI maps
3. **AI Parameter Matching**: Automatically map control names to plugin parameters using Claude Code CLI
4. **Multi-DAW Deployment**: Generate and deploy to Ardour, Ableton Live, and future DAWs
5. **One-Click Workflow**: Single command from controller extraction to DAW installation

### Supported Hardware

- **Current**: Novation Launch Control XL 3 (reference implementation)
  - ‚úÖ Hardware validated (2025-10-12)
  - Serial: LX280935400469
  - Firmware: 1.0.10.84
- **Future**: Any MIDI controller with programmable custom modes

### Supported DAWs

- **Ardour**: ‚úÖ Full support (MIDI map XML generation and installation) - Hardware validated
- **Ableton Live**: üü° Dual-pipeline mapping system (canonical + runtime JSON) - CLI integration pending
- **Future**: Reaper, Bitwig, and other DAWs

Fix the CRITICAL bug in LaunchControlXL3Converter that prevents plugin_parameter preservation.

## Critical Bug

**File:** `modules/controller-workflow/src/converters/LaunchControlXL3Converter.ts`

**Problem:** The `mapControl()` method at lines 175-188 does not copy the `plugin_parameter` field from ControlMapping to ControlDefinition, causing AI-matched parameter indices to be lost during conversion.

## Fix Required

**Location:** Lines 175-188 in `mapControl()` method

**Current code:**
```typescript
private mapControl(control: ControlMapping, options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition {
  const canonicalId = this.mapControlId(control.id);
  const name = options.preserveLabels === true && control.name ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(canonicalId);

  return {
    id: canonicalId,
    name,
    type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
    cc: control.cc!,
    channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
    range: control.range ?? [0, 127],
    description: `Mapped from LCXL3 control: ${control.id}`,
  };
}
```

**Fixed code:**
```typescript
private mapControl(control: ControlMapping, options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition {
  const canonicalId = this.mapControlId(control.id);
  const name = options.preserveLabels === true && control.name ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(canonicalId);

  const controlDef: ControlDefinition = {
    id: canonicalId,
    name,
    type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
    cc: control.cc!,
    channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
```

```typescript
  getConverterInfo(): ConverterInfo {
    return {
      supportedController: 'Novation Launch Control XL 3',
      version: '1.0.0',
      features: ['custom-modes', 'label-preservation', 'all-control-types', '48-controls'],
    };
  }

  /**
   * Validate that a controller configuration can be converted.
   * Checks for required structure and MIDI CC assignments.
   */
  canConvert(config: ControllerConfiguration): boolean {
    if (!config.controls || config.controls.length === 0) {
      return false;
    }

    // All controls must have CC numbers defined for LCXL3
    return config.controls.every((control) => control.cc !== undefined && control.cc >= 0 && control.cc <= 127);
  }

  /**
   * Convert LCXL3 controller configuration to canonical MIDI map format.
   *
   * @param config - LCXL3 custom mode configuration
   * @param options - Conversion options (plugin info, channel, label preservation)
   * @returns Canonical MIDI map with properly mapped control IDs
   * @throws Error if configuration is invalid
   */
  convert(config: ControllerConfiguration, options: ConversionOptions): CanonicalMidiMap {
    if (!this.canConvert(config)) {
      throw new Error('Invalid LCXL3 configuration: missing controls or CC assignments');
    }

    const currentDate = new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0];

    const map: CanonicalMidiMap = {
      version: '1.0.0',
      device: {
        manufacturer: 'Novation',
        model: 'Launch Control XL 3',
        ...(options.deviceOverrides ?? {}),
      },
      metadata: {
        name: config.name,
        description: `Converted from LCXL3 custom mode: ${config.name}`,
        tags: ['launch-control-xl3', 'auto-generated'] as string[],
      },
      controls: this.mapControls(config.controls, options),
    };

    // Add optional date if it exists
    if (currentDate) {
      map.metadata.date = currentDate;
    }

    // Add optional properties only if they exist
    if (options.pluginInfo !== undefined) {
      map.plugin = options.pluginInfo;
    }
    if (options.midiChannel !== undefined) {
      map.midi_channel = options.midiChannel;
    }

    return map;
  }

  /**
   * Map all LCXL3 controls to canonical control definitions.
   *
   * @param controls - Array of LCXL3 control mappings
   * @param options - Conversion options
   * @returns Array of canonical control definitions
   */
  private mapControls(controls: ControlMapping[], options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition[] {
    return controls.map((control) => this.mapControl(control, options));
  }

  /**
   * Map a single LCXL3 control to canonical control definition.
   *
   * @param control - LCXL3 control mapping
   * @param options - Conversion options
   * @returns Canonical control definition
   */
  private mapControl(control: ControlMapping, options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition {
    const canonicalId = this.mapControlId(control.id);
    const name = options.preserveLabels === true && control.name ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(canonicalId);

    const controlDef: ControlDefinition = {
      id: canonicalId,
      name,
      type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
      cc: control.cc!,
      channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
      range: control.range ?? [0, 127],
      description: `Mapped from LCXL3 control: ${control.id}`,
    };

    // Preserve plugin_parameter from AI matching (if present)
    if (control.plugin_parameter !== undefined) {
      controlDef.plugin_parameter = control.plugin_parameter;
    }

    return controlDef;
  }

  /**
   * Map LCXL3 control ID to canonical control ID.
   * Falls back to lowercase version if no mapping exists.
   *
   * @param lcxl3Id - LCXL3-specific control ID (e.g., SEND_A1, FADER1)
   * @returns Canonical control ID (e.g., encoder_1, slider_1)
   */
  private mapControlId(lcxl3Id: string): string {
    const mapped = LaunchControlXL3Converter.CONTROL_ID_MAP[lcxl3Id];
    if (mapped) {
      return mapped;
    }

    // Fallback for unknown control IDs
    return lcxl3Id.toLowerCase();
  }

  /**
   * Map LCXL3 control type to canonical control type.
   * Direct pass-through as types are already compatible.
   *
   * @param type - LCXL3 control type
   * @returns Canonical control type
   */
  private mapControlType(type: ControlType): 'encoder' | 'slider' | 'button' | 'button_group' {
    return type;
  }

  /**
   * Generate a default human-readable name from a canonical control ID.
   * Converts underscores to spaces and capitalizes words.
   *
   * @param controlId - Canonical control ID (e.g., encoder_1, slider_8)
   * @returns Human-readable name (e.g., "Encoder 1", "Slider 8")
   */
  private getDefaultName(controlId: string): string {
    return controlId
      .replace(/_/g, ' ')
      .replace(/\b\w/g, (char) => char.toUpperCase());
  }
}

/**
 * Factory function for creating LaunchControlXL3Converter instances.
 * Provides backward compatibility and easier instantiation.
 *
 * @returns New converter instance
 */
export function createLaunchControlXL3Converter(): LaunchControlXL3Converter {
  return new LaunchControlXL3Converter();
}
```

```typescript
export class ParameterMatcher implements ParameterMatcherInterface {
  async matchParameters(
    controlNames: string[],
    pluginDescriptor: PluginDescriptor,
    options?: MatchOptions
  ): Promise<ParameterMatchResult[]> {
    // Build prompt with control names and plugin parameters
    const prompt = this.buildPrompt(controlNames, pluginDescriptor);
    
    // Shell out to Claude Code CLI
    const response = await this.callClaudeCLI(prompt);
    
    // Parse JSON response and validate
    const matches = this.parseResponse(response);
    
    return matches;
  }

  private async callClaudeCLI(prompt: string): Promise<string> {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      const process = spawn('claude', [], {
        stdio: ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
      });

      process.stdin.write(prompt);
      process.stdin.end();
      
      // Collect output, handle timeout, parse response
    });
  }
}
```

```typescript
// Step 1.5: AI-powered parameter matching (if plugin specified)
if (options.plugin) {
  try {
    emitProgress({ step: 1.5, total: 3, message: 'AI-matching control names to plugin parameters...' });
    
    const { ParameterMatcher, loadPluginDescriptor } = await import('../services/ParameterMatcher.js');
    
    // Load plugin descriptor
    const descriptor = await loadPluginDescriptor(options.plugin);
    console.log(`     ‚úì Loaded plugin descriptor: ${descriptor.plugin.name} (${descriptor.parameters.length} parameters)`);
    
    // Extract control names
    const controlNames = config.controls
      .filter(c => c.name && c.name.trim().length > 0)
      .map(c => c.name!);
    
    // Match parameters
    const matcher = ParameterMatcher.create({ minConfidence: 0.6 });
    const matches = await matcher.matchParameters(controlNames, descriptor);
    
    // Add plugin_parameter to controls
    let matchCount = 0;
    config.controls.forEach((control) => {
      if (!control.name) return;
      
      const match = matches.find(m => m.controlName === control.name);
      if (match?.pluginParameter !== undefined) {
        control.plugin_parameter = match.pluginParameter;
        matchCount++;
      }
    });
    
    console.log(`     ‚úì AI-matched ${matchCount}/${controlNames.length} controls`);
  } catch (error: unknown) {
    console.log(`     ‚ö† AI matching failed: ${errorMessage}`);
    console.log('     ‚Ñπ Continuing without parameter matching...');
  }
}
```

```typescript
private mapControl(control: ControlMapping, options: ConversionOptions): ControlDefinition {
  const canonicalId = this.mapControlId(control.id);
  const name = options.preserveLabels === true && control.name ? control.name : this.getDefaultName(canonicalId);

  const controlDef: ControlDefinition = {
    id: canonicalId,
    name,
    type: this.mapControlType(control.type),
    cc: control.cc!,
    channel: control.channel ?? options.midiChannel ?? 0,
    range: control.range ?? [0, 127],
    description: `Mapped from LCXL3 control: ${control.id}`,
  };

  // Preserve plugin_parameter from AI matching (if present)
  if (control.plugin_parameter !== undefined) {
    controlDef.plugin_parameter = control.plugin_parameter;
  }

  return controlDef;
}
```

   444‚Üífunction handleError(error: unknown): void {

   459‚Üí * @example

   464‚Üí */
   465‚Üífunction sanitizeFilename(name: string): string {
   466‚Üí  return name

   468‚Üí    .replace(/_+/g, '_')
   469‚Üí    .toLowerCase();
   470‚Üí}
   471‚Üí
   472‚Üí/**

   478‚Üí * @param str - Input string

   481‚Üí * @example

   485‚Üí * \```
   486‚Üí */
   487‚Üífunction capitalize(str: string): string {

async listConfigurations(): Promise<ConfigurationSlot[]> {
    const slots: ConfigurationSlot[] = [];

    // Read all 16 slots (0-15)
    for (let i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
      try {
        const mode = await this.device.readCustomMode(i);
        const slot: ConfigurationSlot = {
          index: i,
          isEmpty: mode === null,
        };
        // Only include name if it exists
        if (mode?.name !== undefined) {
          slot.name = mode.name;
        }
        slots.push(slot);
      } catch (error) {
        // If read fails (timeout, empty slot, or unsupported slot like factory preset),
        // mark the slot as empty
        slots.push({
          index: i,
          isEmpty: true,
        });
      }
    }

    return slots;
  }

```
async readConfiguration(slot: number): Promise<ControllerConfiguration> {
    this.validateSlot(slot);

    const customMode = await this.device.readCustomMode(slot);
    if (!customMode) {
      throw new Error(`No configuration found in slot ${slot}`);
    }

    return this.convertFromLCXL3(customMode, slot);
  }

  /**
   * Write configuration to a specific slot
   *
   * Converts generic ControllerConfiguration to LCXL3 CustomMode format.
   *
   * @param slot - Slot number (0-15)
   * @param config - Generic controller configuration
   * @throws Error if conversion or write fails
   */
  async writeConfiguration(slot: number, config: ControllerConfiguration): Promise<void> {
    this.validateSlot(slot);

    const customMode = this.convertToLCXL3(config);
    await this.device.writeCustomMode(slot, customMode);
  }

  /**
   * Get device information
   *
   * @returns Device metadata including firmware version
   * @throws Error if device not connected or handshake failed
   */
  async getDeviceInfo(): Promise<DeviceInfo> {
    const info: LaunchControlXL3Info = await this.device.verifyDevice();

    return {
      manufacturer: this.manufacturer,
      model: this.model,
      firmwareVersion: info.firmwareVersion,
    };
  }
```

### 2. Hardware Labels Required

**Impact:** AI matching skipped if controls have no custom names

**Mitigation:**

3. Set custom labels for each control
4. Upload to hardware
5. Re-run deployment with `--plugin` flag

### For End-to-End Testing

To fully test AI matching with Claude Code CLI:

1. **Install Claude CLI:**
   \```bash
   npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-cli
   claude auth login
   \```

2. **Set Custom Labels in Hardware:**
   - Open Novation Components
   - Create/edit custom mode with meaningful labels
   - Example: "VCF Cutoff", "VCF Res", "VCA Level", etc.
   - Upload to hardware slot

3. **Run Deployment:**
   \```bash
   npx controller-deploy deploy --slot <slot> --plugin "TAL-J-8" --daw ardour
   \```
